revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 00:24:40.000000000', 'message': 'Use the same root test class.

Instead of being strongly tied to unittest2 make
it easier for taskflow to switch to another root
class by abstracting out the unittest2 usage.

This also enables some useful functionality to exist
in that root test class that other tasks can take
advantage of.

Change-Id: I90fb98150476ff56e0455c24d852e52d16eb4890
'}]
commit_message:
Use the same root test class.

Instead of being strongly tied to unittest2 make
it easier for taskflow to switch to another root
class by abstracting out the unittest2 usage.

This also enables some useful functionality to exist
in that root test class that other tasks can take
advantage of.

Change-Id: I90fb98150476ff56e0455c24d852e52d16eb4890

ideally the whole gzip command would be configurable so that the end user (I.E. the admins who are deploying OpenStack) could change gzip out for pigz if they so desired, as well as adjust the compression level."}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-06-06 15:55:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thanks everyone for your feedback.

I kept the main configuration name the same. I can set this to be image_gzip_options if you guys agree on that. -1 through -9 flags apply pretty much all compression utilities, so it should be future proofed in my mind and work with just about any algorithm.

I adjusted the functions to have none by default (instead of -6, which is basically, but not quite the same), along with some tests if none, to not set the GZIP variable. Corrected an off space (sorry, I'm used to working with tabs!).

The compression_mode is set in image_properties, which is also sent to glance via HTTP headers. This might be handy for logging purposes and debugging. I added an if clause around the compression_mode setting via properties.

What do you all think?

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-12 01:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Hi Matt!

I've reviewed your comments and have applied them to the patch. Could you start me in the right direction for adding a unit test? I'm not sure if there are any Openstack guides for writing unit tests and what exactly I'd test for.

If I were to be really specific, the test would probably look for GZIP in the environment of the gzip sub-process and compare it, testing with a few different values, including none. If not that involved, can I merely write a patch to syntatically check the involved files and break if it finds them likely to be invalid?

Thanks,
Teran"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-06-12 15:41:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Couple more nits, but think this is getting close.

FWIW, I'm personally okay skipping the unit-test here; we traditionally haven't unit-tested dom0 plugin-code, the hassle wasn't worth it. Manual, functional testing has been sufficient.

That's not so say getting unit-test coverage around this wouldn't a good long-term goal."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-12 15:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Hi Teran,

Here is an overview:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/topics/testing.html

I'd first look for existing test cases that cover the methods you're changing. The test modules should be under nova/tests/ in a directory structure that mirrors the modules you're touching. Then look for calls to the methods that you've changed in existing test cases and see if you can work in your changes there for added coverage.

If the changed method isn't already being covered by an existing test, then you have to think about adding something and I'm not sure how difficult that is for the xen-specific parts of this patch, and I would probably leave that up to the xen folks in nova that know more about that submodule than I do, but the nova api module should have significant coverage already so I wouldn't think that one would be a problem."}, {'account_id': 7802, 'date': '2013-06-12 20:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-06-12 20:27:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Agree with Matt -- this should use builtin gzip to simplify the code."}, {'account_id': 7802, 'date': '2013-06-14 04:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 7802, 'date': '2013-06-14 04:17:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Hi everyone,

Really appreciate the continuous stream of feedback I've gotten from you guys. I know it takes a lot of time to look over such changes.

I agree that Python's gzip module sounds like the ideal solution. However, I did some digging and the gzip module may not properly support streaming, especially in Python 2.X. If you can find some simple examples of gzip streaming I'd sure appreciate it. Python also has the tarfile module, so I'd like to use both if possible. Tarfile can open in a gzip mode at the same time, but I don't think the compression mode is settable so I'd probably have to piece both together. The other concern is performance. I'd like to benchmark Python's gzip modes before pushing them upstream to make sure there's no significant losses.

I rewrote the test, hopefully properly this time. We'll see what Jenkins says.

I await your feedback. I sure appreciate your time!

Thanks,
Teran"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 05:01:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Doesn't seem to work

"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-20 03:45:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't think this should be adding the compression level at all in image properties.  It feels like that is just abusing the image properties to pass a message to the XenAPI glance plugin.

The conf variable should be defined in the compute manager, not the API.... and for XenAPI, you should pass in the value as a part of the vhd_upload (or whatever) plugin call.  IMO, anyway.   And if libvirt has image compression code before uploading, you should also make it work there, too.  (I didn't check it)"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-20 03:53:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-20 09:51:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

I would just add an extra param to the glance upload method that is called from here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/xenapi/imageupload/glance.py#L61

Myself, I would add a config in the above file that is specific to xenapi, and let people move it later, if that makes sense.

This also needs a blueprint I think, its new functionality, and needs DocImpact to document the new config flag."}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-06-20 14:21:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-06-20 15:22:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 7802, 'date': '2013-06-26 21:42:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-06-26 22:18:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

There are still several flaws and unanswered questions about this patch; I've marked some of them in-line.  I would also strongly advise you to rebase this patch; the last time you did that was June 5th, and nova tends to be a very fast-moving code base, so failing to rebase risks encountering a conflict after approval.

By the way, if you don't know how to respond to comments, you need to click on the "Review" button, where you can put overall comments in the "Cover Message" text field, then click on the "Publish Comments" button.  You also need to do this to publish your inline comments (or your responses to our inline comments); otherwise, they remain "Draft"s and we don't see them.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-26 22:27:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22: Doesn't seem to work

"}, {'account_id': 7802, 'date': '2013-06-27 20:55:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 7802, 'date': '2013-06-27 21:00:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

Hi Kevin!

Thanks for explaining how the comments work. I wasn't sure how to respond to inline comments. I don't really know how to make the exception piece properly. I was told to write a test case so I copied another block and rewrote it. In concept, I'm hoping that it'll test the code path and ideally make an image with different compression settings and benchmark the time taken to tell it's working (assuming it's a fairly static environment).

I'll rebase the code base pretty soon. I rewrote the patch with IntOpt and some of your other suggestions. I added a blueprint. Gerrit doesn't seem to like the link in the summary page here.

Let me know what I should do from here. I'd really appreciate it if you can explain how exactly the test cases work.

Thanks,
Teran"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-06-27 21:23:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: (2 inline comments)

OK, just one quick housekeeping comment: you can reply to inline comments by clicking the "Reply" button on the comment.  ("Reply Done" just puts a comment with the text "Done" on the line.)  To make a new inline comment on a line that doesn't already have one, double-click the line.  (You can view the inline comments on a particular file by clicking on the file from the patch's top-level.)

I've commented on a couple of your questions as in-line comments.  As for tests, what I'm particularly expecting to see in a test is at least one assertion—a verification that some condition is as expected.  For instance, verifying that an instance variable has a given value.  Generally, this means that you run a particular function, then verify that its side effects were as expected, i.e., that it set instance variables to the expected values, called some other function or method with a given set of arguments, etc.

We are using several tools in nova to accomplish this, and I'm afraid describing everything is a little out of scope for a review comment :)  The best place to start is probably by reading other elements of the test suite and trying to figure out what they're doing, how they're doing it, and why.  This will no doubt involve asking others, of course :)

For the record, I'm willing to help answer specific questions, but I'll be on vacation next week, so hopefully some of the other reviewers will also be able to help you.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-27 21:47:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23: Doesn't seem to work

nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py
Line 69:	
By default, the GZIP environment variable is not set and it is a system default. I think we should keep it as none so that we are not altering existing installs in any way, out of the box. GZIP=-6 *should* be identical, but it may not always be.

Line 70:	
I think we should explain the tradeoff so it's more clear. 0 as no compression is a nice option and can be added after this patch is accepted.

Thanks for your feedback. Sorry, I broke my review reply. I did most of what you said."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-08-13 20:00:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 38: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-06 00:38:17.000000000', 'message': "Set GZIP to -1 for tarball creation in XenServer

Images will default to gzip -6, which is quite CPU intensive. -1 is
much faster, at a slight trade off of size. -1 appears to be 30-50%
faster in real world snapshot speed, with maybe 10-20% lower
compression. As this is an environment setting, I can't see it breaking
anything across varying deployments. This should be a configurable
option in the future, but I feel for now it's a good interim improvement
to the imaging process.

Change-Id: I02e136b7215a4f2cefc259f40bde9c1b205737ed
"}, {'created': '2013-06-11 20:11:56.000000000', 'message': "nova.conf configurable gzip compression level

Defaults to -6, which is gzip's default mode, so unlikely to
unexplicitly affect current installs. Xen only.

Change-Id: I02e136b7215a4f2cefc259f40bde9c1b205737ed

commit_message:
nova.conf configurable gzip compression level

Currently only used by XenAPI.

Sets GZIP environment variable before spawning tar -cz to force the
compression level. Defaults to none, which means the GZIP environment
variable is not set and the default (usually -6) is used.

Implements: blueprint image-compression-mode

Change-Id: I02e136b7215a4f2cefc259f40bde9c1b205737ed

commit_message:
Fix signature of _create_volume() in ThinLVMVolumeDriver

create_volume_from_snapshot will call _create_volume() with the
wrong parameters when using ThinLVMVolumeDriver.  It should be
compatible with LVMVolumeDriver's _create_volume() method.

Fixes bug: 1210853

Conflicts:
	cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py

(cherry picked from commit 7323d8751538e06bb2dba106ba394bc6e29b8b84)
Change-Id: I18f7baf60601b3bcf01425b505a0579a826f072e

commit_message:
Run models unittest after database migrations.

Changeset I3939e474aa6e8e5549b1d89725e988dd056400d9 introduced testing
of the expected schemas, this change also applies these tests to a
migrated database.

Change-Id: I5ff8c223e270f951c3f205f465ca828f334f21a7

commit_message:
boot an instance will fail if use "--hint group=XXXXX"

When use command "nova boot --image <image name> --flavor <flavor id>
--hint group=<group uuid> vm1", booting will fail.

To fix this issue, should use utils.metadata_to_dict to translate
metadata to dict and then update dict.

Change-Id: I850fef968115cd120a2a760f1207a01c683ef558
Fixes: bug #1213149

commit_message:
Cleanup: Add common "ssh-login server" method

There are some "ssh-login server" methods in scenario tests, and
they will increase in the future by increasing scenario tests.
This patch adds common "ssh-login server" method to parent class
and uses it instead of each implementation.

Change-Id: Iefee90b7a79b85b67694bc32382b4c4d776bc5b2

commit_message:
Pin python-subunit to 0.0.13

0.0.14 is broken due to:

  https://bugs.launchpad.net/subunit/+bug/1216163

Which in my testing with nova (and others) produces the error
described in that bug.

Change-Id: Id00f2f643a0dc3da781ecae2ef3b9f3b562d1145

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-24 00:15:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the Domain Context for Users panel

Add display of Domain ID and Domain Name in the Create and Update
Users page to give user a hint where the User will be created.
For Keystone V2, the two fields will be hidden.

When the Domain Context is set, the User will be created in that
Domain Context. Otherwise, the User will be created in the Domain
of the logon user.

On users creation, the listing of available projects will be based
on the Domain where it will be created.

Fixes bug 1215697

Change-Id: I98a2161004054a41e2311ef12aec6335b87aa856
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the Domain Context for Users panel

Add display of Domain ID and Domain Name in the Create and Update
Users page to give user a hint where the User will be created.
For Keystone V2, the two fields will be hidden.

When the Domain Context is set, the User will be created in that
Domain Context. Otherwise, the User will be created in the Domain
of the logon user.

On users creation, the listing of available projects will be based
on the Domain where it will be created.

Fixes bug 1215697

Change-Id: I98a2161004054a41e2311ef12aec6335b87aa856

Add a has_interface() method to the resource class

This is to better indentify resource types, given that they
can be mapped in the environment.

commit_message:
Remove unused methods from LVM driver

_set_execute() has been unused since b569df9, and _size_str() has
been done since f4a9429. So this patch removes them for clean-up.

Change-Id: If8a2703afb08623b69ec6adc105cf58b0e4a15dc

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-23 21:49:58.000000000', 'message': '3PAR driver clone volume doc updates

Adding the -online option to the operation that is called on the
3PAR backend changed what extra specs keys are supported for
cloned volumes. This patch adds a note on exactly what is supported
now. The -online option was added to resolve some performance issues

Change-Id: Idada7b2ae12b97953ed36d865f129574bb39be96
Fixes: bug 1211974
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR driver clone volume doc updates

Adding the -online option to the operation that is called on the
3PAR backend changed what extra specs keys are supported for
cloned volumes. This patch adds a note on exactly what is supported
now. The -online option was added to resolve some performance issues

Change-Id: Idada7b2ae12b97953ed36d865f129574bb39be96
Fixes: bug 1211974

commit_message:
Install MySQL-python<1.2.4 for virtualenv

The latest version(1.2.4) of MySQL-python can not be install
properly, then the virtualenv is cleanup.

Designate MySQL-python<1.2.4 in test-requirements.txt.

Bug #1213014

Change-Id:Ie9cc538bba2874bc626934e326831a70da632178

messages:

[{'created': '2013-08-20 18:35:54.000000000', 'message': "Fixes sync issue for fixed ips and floating ips

fixed ips and floating ips can't be synced properly because they're
tracked per user in the quota table but they're not tied to a user so
it's not feasible to grab a count of how many are being used by any
particular user. So the quota_usages table can get into a bad state if
it sync with user level.
Sync these resources with project level, and set quota with project
level to solve the problem.

Fixes bug 1214523

Change-Id: Icd94e95fb706ee90e0737e85cfa50f05ff3c0ff8

commit_message:
Fixes sync issue for user level resources

fixed/floating ips and networks can't be synced properly because they're
tracked per user in the quota table but they're not tied to a user so
it's not feasible to grab a count of how many are being used by any
particular user. So the quota_usages table can get into a bad state if
it sync with user level.
Sync these resources with project level, and set quota with project
level to solve the problem.

Fixes bug 1214523

Change-Id: Icd94e95fb706ee90e0737e85cfa50f05ff3c0ff8

commit_message:
Fix migration downgrade 146 with mysql

Add availability zones back in individually to work with MySQL downgrades
on migration 146.

Fixes bug 1207956

Change-Id: I48b3ce27b92f231e280ee5af7a3e1b8ce6c4b018

commit_message:
Remove the indexes on downgrade to work with MySQL

Fixes MySQL downgrade on migration 203.
Add tests to check the indexes.

Fixes bug 1207174

Change-Id: If50fb49e1c76c2a7512141dae5f1a5818dc1b699

subject: Downgrade MySQL to the same state it used to be

commit_message:
Downgrade MySQL to the same state it used to be

virtual_interfaces_instance_uuid_fkey exists as a KEY, not a UNIQUE KEY in
MySQL which causes trouble when downgrading.

Don't re-create the virtual_interfaces_instance_uuid_fkey on downgrade as it
wasn't upgraded properly and therefore still exists. This forces the downgrade
to look exactly like it was before the upgrade.

Fixes bug 1207344

Change-Id: Id1700e1cbba669df2dd8e5c5a842b859577aa32c

[{'created': '2013-08-09 14:34:19.000000000', 'message': "Add more tests for Swift Account Quota

2 new tests are added:

+ test that the admin is able to modify/remove a quota
  on a user's account

+ test that a user is not able to modify/remove a quota
  on its own account

Change-Id: I54cad8b244a26be8445fa4fe9ea63785aef4472a
"}, {'created': '2013-08-19 13:16:05.000000000', 'message': "Add more tests for Swift Account Quota

2 new tests are added:

+ test that the admin is able to modify/remove a quota
  on a user's account

+ test that a user is not able to modify/remove a quota
  on its own account

Change-Id: I54cad8b244a26be8445fa4fe9ea63785aef4472a
"}]
commit_message:
Add more tests for Swift Account Quota

2 new tests are added:

+ test that the admin is able to modify/remove a quota
  on a user's account

+ test that a user is not able to modify/remove a quota
  on its own account

Change-Id: I54cad8b244a26be8445fa4fe9ea63785aef4472a

'}, {'account_id': 2976, 'date': '2013-08-20 13:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-08-20 13:55:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I understand the nreed for such a change but wonder two things:

 1. why do we need a colon in the regexp? (bug:)
 2. to avoid matching lot of unneeded stuff, can't we start the regexp with .*testtools\.skip rather than just .*skip ?"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-08-21 20:59:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

1. The colon is there because that is what was decided the bug format should be. Back when I was originally fixing up the skip tracker there was a brief discussion on whether we should try to make this broader or lock into a certain bug id format for skips. It was decided to limit the formatting to make the regex more specific and enforce it with (what at the time was) a pep8 rule.

2. Starting with testtools\.skip wouldn't work for 2 reasons. The first being skip exceptions with bugs. They aren't from the testtools module as I recall. Secondly, that would prevent multi-line skips from being picked up which is what I am trying to address in this patch.

The hacking check probably needs to be updated to account for these 2 additional conditions.(I think it only works on single line decorator skips) But, that can come in a follow-up patch."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-08-23 07:33:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

The missing part of the story was, the regexp will match on the 'Skipped until the Bug #1182883' and not strictly on the method name.

This should be part of the commit message."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-08-23 14:45:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

hi Matthew and thanks for sharing that but I see we use "bug:" only in two occasions and the checks.py file suggests we don't need to use the colon: "T101: skips must contain "Bug #<bug_number>". To be honest I don't know how this could have worked until today.

We should also make sure every line contains the "skip" keyword or again that won't be counted and there are instead quite a lot using just "Until Bug #1069849 is resolved."'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-08-23 15:21:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I think together with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/43490/ this change should be okay.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-08-23 15:21:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Probably a future change to hacking/checks.py is needed to make that match the counter.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-08-23 20:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-23 20:37:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 21:54:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix skip tracker regex for multi-line skips.

This commit changes the regex used for detecting a skip line by
removing the requirement on an '(' immediately following 'skip'.
This changes the skip tracker to match multiline skips (assuming
'skip' is on the same line as the bug number. It also enables
conditional skips that have a bug number from being picked up.

Change-Id: I95a0521661084034f7625c3c517ae9210120de4c
"}, {'created': '2013-08-19 14:16:05.000000000', 'message': "Fix skip tracker regex for multi-line skips

This commit changes the regex used for detecting a skip line by
removing the requirement on an '(' immediately following 'skip'.
This changes the skip tracker to match multiline skips (assuming
'skip' is on the same line as the bug number. It also enables
conditional skips that have a bug number from being picked up.

Change-Id: I95a0521661084034f7625c3c517ae9210120de4c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix skip tracker regex for multi-line skips

This commit changes the regex used for detecting a skip line by
removing the requirement on an '(' immediately following 'skip'.
This changes the skip tracker to match multiline skips (assuming
'skip' is on the same line as the bug number. It also enables
conditional skips that have a bug number from being picked up.

Change-Id: I95a0521661084034f7625c3c517ae9210120de4c

[{'created': '2013-05-10 18:28:36.000000000', 'message': "Remove invalid block_device_mapping volume_size of ''

Fixes bug #1171190

Parsing block_device_mapping from strings sometimes results in
volume_size being set to '' or u''.  This causes a problem when
inserting into PostgreSQL, which insists that integer columns
actually contain integers.  Remove invalid device_size before
inserting or updating block_device_mapping database records.

Change-Id: If9132a96604b5b0e3a6df96624e565e016d5c9a3
(cherry picked from commit 188a94c898bcf07f9fe42ef2f3b5ee4aa8859b49)

commit_message:
Remove invalid block_device_mapping volume_size of ''

Parsing block_device_mapping from strings sometimes results in
volume_size being set to '' or u''.  This causes a problem when
inserting into PostgreSQL, which insists that integer columns
actually contain integers.  Remove invalid device_size before
inserting or updating block_device_mapping database records.

(cherry picked from commit 188a94c898bcf07f9fe42ef2f3b5ee4aa8859b49)

Fixes: Bug #1171190
Change-Id: If9132a96604b5b0e3a6df96624e565e016d5c9a3

commit_message:
XenAPI: Return platform_version if no product_version

Nova now requires a version to be set.  In the case of xapi-XCP/xenserver-core
no product_version exists, so use the platform_version instead.

Fixes bug 1206948

Change-Id: I4d6008216075716c8b969493b7a2ccb7713f755d

commit_message:
XenAPI: Support local connections

Currently there is no way to connect to XAPI through the unix socket,
requiring a URL and credentials.

This change allows you to run in dom0 (particularly in xenserver-core
environments) and connect to XAPI using the unix domain socket by
specifying "unix://local"
DocImpact

Change-Id: I3d5ace31c9c0411fa711cfdf87383d36f61bfa4a

commit_message:
Stub out entry points in LookupTorrentURLTestCase

Torrent URL lookup functions are registered via entry-points.

If the tests run in an environment where the production lookup function is
present, it will use that; not what we want for tests.

Instead, we should stubout entry-points so we have a mock URL lookup function.

Fixes bug 1211396

Change-Id: Ibc2b34bfdcecaad4c53fb00e925a8b21965d8577

commit_message:
Revert "Make compute_capabilities_filter use ..."

This reverts commit a4ad62ac9fdacecfbc5229e688a7d937d177889b.

Nova baremetal architecture scheduling was broken by it. While
workarounds exist it is backwards incompatible, and baremetal is
supported since Grizzly.

Fix bug: 1213967

Change-Id: I319b8a17f3ae7a3b527d388c6ff2954c0bcc0108

Skip those two tests until Bug #1213912 is solved,
as it freezed all stable/grizzly checks.

commit_message:
Remove "N309 Python 3.x incompatible construct"

This check was implemented as H231 in Hacking 0.6 or newer
(I0bd89fa05d88de34ca62ce59f427468ede226126),
so the duplicate implementation can be removed.

Change-Id: I003d8611621adc53f1afcfd77691f345397670b0

Commit 616098dcd36b20e01d38898b8942003df664e6ac fixed the exception
handling in the V2 version of the coverage extension so backtrace

commit_message:
Fix exception handling in V3 API coverage extension

Commit 616098dcd36b20e01d38898b8942003df664e6ac fixed the exception
handling in the V2 version of the coverage extension so backtrace
information is not lost when an exception is reraised. This applies
the same fix to the V3 version

Change-Id: I29ec1492c2def9c60c8ff471683914ae2943966e

commit_message:
Allow swap_volume to be called by Cinder

This allows Cinder to call swap_volume as part of a volume migration.
Cinder creates the new volume and calls Nova to perform the swap. When
Nova finishes, it calls Cinder to complete the migration, where it
updates the volume metadata so that the volume ID remains unchanged.
Thus, if Cinder detects that the migration was initiated by Cinder, it
will return the original volume ID to keep using. Otherwise, it will
return the new volume's ID for Nova to use, which is what it had done
before.

Change-Id: If352f2e11701148a5aeccaf7fd6379528fa8be31

commit_message:
Refactor plugin API methods

* Supported method now must respond to an enumeration
* Modified encrypt/generate_data_encryption_key to use supports
* Refactor a bunch of confusing kek_meta_tenant, kek_metadata,
* kek_meta_dto things
* Modify plugins to support new method signatures in abstract base class
* Unit tests for more error conditions
* Hacking fixes (but many more needed...)

Change-Id: I33c20959f145f1c8f22725f62fb410033080b64f
Implements: blueprint crypto-refine-is-supported

Fixes: bug 1211974

commit_message:
3PAR driver clone volume doc updates

Adding the -online option to the operation that is called on the
3PAR backend changed what extra specs keys are supported for
cloned volumes. This patch adds a note on exactly what is supported
now. The -online option was added to resolve some performance issues.

Change-Id: I67dd41055d226f8d0c8f8800e6fd9be94c8768e0
Fixes: bug 1211974

commit_message:
image-delete fires multiple queries to delete its child entries

1. Changed individual query calls for soft-deleting the image's
   child entries to one db query call for all child entries of a
   given type.
2. Added a fix to simple db's 'image_destroy' api to clear
   the location entries.

Fixes bug 1201758

Change-Id: Ib673de5460d59ea3af74553048ffcf74dccbdc36

commit_message:
Enforce flavor access during instance boot

The code in the servers API did not pass the context when retrieving
flavor details.  That means it would use an admin context instead,
bypassing all flavor access control checks.

This patch includes the fix, and the corresponding unit test for the v2
API.

Closes-bug: #1212179

(cherry picked from commit 4054cc4a22a1fea997dec76afb5646fd6c6ea6b9)

Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py
	nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_servers.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_servers.py

Change-Id: I681ae9965e19767df22fa74c3315e4e03a459d3b

commit_message:
Added parted to the list of packages to install on debian family

Parted is not installed by default on Debian system, and provides the command
partprobe needed in disk-image-create.

Change-Id: Ie03173398e425d65a908f25a880538a4912494b2

commit_message:
Fix ReservationTestCase on PostgreSQL

setUp() of ReservationTestCase calls quota_reserve() passing
timeutils.utcnow() as a value of 'until_refresh' argument.
until_refresh column is actually of type int rather than
datetime or varchar, so these tests fail on PostgreSQL.

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Change-Id: Ib57579db2080f44bd41b91e83b0eee6f77f51840

[{'created': '2013-08-12 13:27:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix instance_group_delete() DB API method

Table 'instance_groups' has two columns that can be used to
unambigously identify the specific row:
  - 'id' (Integer, primary_key=True, autoincrement=True)
  - 'uuid' (String)

The former is used internally to bind related instances by FKs
(InstanceGroupMember, InstanceGroupPolicy and InstanceGroupMetadata),
and the latter is accepted by public methods of DB API. This must
be a miss in DB schema design, because 'uuid' could be used for both
use cases.

instance_group_delete() deletes the instance group (and all related
instances) given its UUID value. When related entities are deleted
they are filtered by the FK value - the 'group_id' column, however,
the 'group_uuid' value is passed.

Such DELETE statement is executed successfully (though WHERE clause never
evaluates to True, so the query is logically incorrect) on MySQL and SQLite,
which are often too 'soft' when checking data types of passed values.

This patch fixes the instance_group_delete() method and renames the 'group_uuid'
argument of _instance_group_model_get_query() to 'group_id', because this one
is actually always called with id value rather than with uuid.

Closes-Bug: #1211307

Change-Id: Ic8bcb4b218f570f26420904aeb74eb14567235fb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix instance_group_delete() DB API method

Table 'instance_groups' has two columns that can be used to
unambigously identify the specific row:
  - 'id' (Integer, primary_key=True, autoincrement=True)
  - 'uuid' (String)

The former is used internally to bind related instances by FKs
(InstanceGroupMember, InstanceGroupPolicy and InstanceGroupMetadata),
and the latter is accepted by public methods of DB API. This must
be a miss in DB schema design, because 'uuid' could be used for both
use cases.

instance_group_delete() deletes the instance group (and all related
instances) given its UUID value. When related entities are deleted
they are filtered by the FK value - the 'group_id' column, however,
the 'group_uuid' value is passed.

Such DELETE statement is executed successfully (though WHERE clause never
evaluates to True, so the query is logically incorrect) on MySQL and SQLite,
which are often too 'soft' when checking data types of passed values.

This patch fixes the instance_group_delete() method and renames the 'group_uuid'
argument of _instance_group_model_get_query() to 'group_id', because this one
is actually always called with id value rather than with uuid.

Closes-Bug: #1211307

Change-Id: Ic8bcb4b218f570f26420904aeb74eb14567235fb

commit_message:
PCI utils

Some basic PCI utilities, like PCI spec match and
address parser, which will be used by multiple PCI
passthrough functionalities.

bp:pci-passthrough-base

Change-Id: I8a77a49c93edf2699bceb6a52dd7f4ae45d577fe
Signed-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Enable the compute admin API by default

There is currently a patch up for review that adds an admin API for
nova.  This patch includes the necessary change for devstack to have
this API enabled by default.

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/project:openstack/nova+branch:master+topic:bp/qemu-assisted-snapshots,n,z

Change-Id: I0e87cbf190a93117c3bfea1c97eacfdde990e8b3

subject: Set default VNC password if not configured
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 447, 'name': 'dan wendlandt', 'email': 'dan@nicira.com', 'username': 'danwent'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 7400, 'name': 'Tracy Jones', 'email': 'tjones@vmware.com', 'username': 'tracyajones'}, {'_account_id': 7629, 'name': 'Shawn Hartsock', 'email': 'hartsock@acm.org', 'username': 'hartsocks'}, {'_account_id': 7776, 'name': 'Paul Carver', 'email': 'pcarver@att.com', 'username': 'pcarver'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7776, 'date': '2013-06-14 17:37:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This seems like a bad idea to me. Someday someone who's having a bad day will forget to set a password in nova.config when doing a new deployment and then some time later they'll have a REALLY BAD DAY when a black hat compromises their hosts via this well known default password.

I think the behavior of disabling VNC on the ESXi host is a good thing. It means that the person having a bad day will be slightly more annoyed when they have to go back and fix the nova.config that they didn't setup properly, but it will save them having the REALLY BAD DAY later.

As a bonus, if they forgot to set a password, they probably messed up other things too. Giving them a push to go back and re-read their nova.config is a form of "tough love" and is probably better for them in the long run than letting a little mistake slide.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 17:40:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/28944 : SUCCESS in 3m 48s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-nova-docs/23163/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 5m 46s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-nova-python26/24549 : SUCCESS in 22m 18s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-nova-python27/24652 : SUCCESS in 10m 13s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/23421 : SUCCESS in 41m 13s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/23128 : SUCCESS in 51m 40s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/30774 : FAILURE in 43m 50s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/10445 : FAILURE in 17m 29s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/13828 : SUCCESS in 10m 14s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 7400, 'date': '2013-06-14 22:23:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Paul - that's a very good point.  

So perhaps the fix should be
  if vnc_enabled and vnc_password = ''
      throw an exception

otherwise it's very difficult to debug the vnc failure after the vm is created.  It simply appears to not work"}, {'account_id': 7400, 'date': '2013-06-14 22:41:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck bug 1182679'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 23:23:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/28957 : SUCCESS in 4m 47s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-nova-docs/23176/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 13s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-nova-python26/24562 : SUCCESS in 23m 01s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-nova-python27/24665 : SUCCESS in 10m 10s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/23460 : SUCCESS in 40m 26s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/23167 : SUCCESS in 41m 34s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/30821 : SUCCESS in 21m 42s
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/10481 : FAILURE in 35m 17s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/33088/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/13837 : SUCCESS in 10m 04s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 7776, 'date': '2013-06-15 15:32:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes, Tracy, throwing an exception is definitely the "Fail Fast" approach. However, I was about to write "I really don't think there's any good reason for leaving a hypervisor password blank so if someone does that we should let them know about their mistake ASAP rather than silently working around their mistake." when something occurred to me. What if someone really did intentionally leave the password blank because they wanted the behavior of VNC not working?

Does VNC not working also prevent using vSphere client from managing the host? Maybe disabling VNC is someone's desired result.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-06-17 17:02:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Does the KVM/QEMU implementation require a password in this scenario at all?  I don't believe so.  My understanding is that with OpenStack, VNC is proxies, not direct access, so a password is less important.  

If this password is critical to security, then I agree that it should not be hard coded.  However, if not, I'd actually much rather find a way to disable the use of the password all together.  I spoke with someone who knows ESX VNC well and they said that the password is optional."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-06-19 03:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-06-19 03:55:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

whoops I missed Dan's comments:

I looked into this a while ago and found if you put &logging=debug in the URL for the novnc window you'll see the vnc protocol decoded in the javascript debug console. The only difference between ESX and KVM (vnc debug) is that that the security_type is set to 2. Which requires a password to be passed in. Oddly though if you use a vncviewer that ignores that it will work fine if no password is set. This works with http://sourceforge.net/projects/cotvnc/ without a password but novnc will prompt you."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-06-19 03:56:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-27 15:30:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't like the idea of openstack embedding a default password, which opens up a potential security issue like having default linksys passwords.

I like the current behavior better."}, {'account_id': 7400, 'date': '2013-06-27 16:08:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Based on Aaron's input (and other comments) i am considering abandoning this change."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-06-27 20:49:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Tracy - how do you plan to handling this instead? It seems like the we need a custom vnc client or some change that tricks the security_type to be 1. 


@Sean - With the current behavior there is no way to vnc access a vm running on a esx box without the password set. If running nova-cert this should be fine ( and should be fine without it too/this is the same as the kvm case when vnc'ing except kvm allows you to create vnc sessions without passwords)."}, {'account_id': 7776, 'date': '2013-06-27 21:00:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Why is there a requirement to allow access without a password? What's the downside of requiring the person installing to provide a non-default password as a required parameter?

If a default password IS set via this patch what compensatory controls prevent an unauthorized party from using that default password to gain access?"}, {'account_id': 7400, 'date': '2013-06-27 22:26:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd like to do the following

1.  log a warning when someone creates a VM without a password set in the config file so when it doesn't work they will have a clue in the log

2.  investigate the possibility that ESX will allow a null password in the configu file if the RemoteDisplay.vnc.password property is missing - i.e. it is enabled, there is a port, but no password.  There is a possibility that this use case works.


OR 

force all users to set a password when vnc is enabled by crashing nova compute at startup since a password is required when vnc is enabled - therefore this is a configuration error.  That makes it very clear what the issue will be when no password is specified…  thoughts on that?"}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-06-27 22:50:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Paul - the issue is that everyone using an image that lands on on an ESXi host will have to know the vnc password to vnc into  an instance which is painful. 

@Tracy - if there is a way to tweak the config file so that is possible that would be the best solution. 

"""
1. log a warning when someone creates a VM without a password set in the config file so when it doesn't work they will have a clue in the log
"""

Openstack doesn't expose a way to set the password for a vm so i don't think that will work.'}, {'account_id': 7400, 'date': '2013-06-28 13:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Aaron - but the vnc password is set when the VM is created in _set_vnc_config.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-06-28 21:22:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

yes but that is a hardcoded password...'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-06-28 21:23:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

# Set the vnc configuration of the instance, vnc port starts from 5900
        if CONF.vnc_enabled:
            vnc_port = self._get_vnc_port(vm_ref)
            vnc_pass = CONF.vnc_password or ''
            self._set_vnc_config(client_factory, instance, vnc_port, vnc_pass)"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-06 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-06 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 7400, 'date': '2013-08-23 17:06:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Restored

bringing this back based on a iirc discussion with Dan 

The use of a global cloud-wide VNC password is not good practice. In fact, it is so bad practice it should be disabled. If the ESX host can't deal with a password, it should not present the illusion that a password can provide cloud-wide security.

Better to propose a change that allows some form of strong encryption between the proxy and the VNC host."}, {'account_id': 7400, 'date': '2013-08-23 17:07:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

need to rebase this'}, {'account_id': 7400, 'date': '2013-08-23 18:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

going to fix this in a different patch after all'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-14 16:48:05.000000000', 'message': "Set default VNC password if not configured

An emtpy password will disable VNC on an ESXi host as it is not allowed.
This fix sets a default password of 'openstack' if the vnc_password is not
set in nova.config.

Change-Id: Iac871030164aee62ab696671e71bd7f72a38db28
Fixes: bug # 1189585
"}]
commit_message:
Set default VNC password if not configured

An emtpy password will disable VNC on an ESXi host as it is not allowed.
This fix sets a default password of 'openstack' if the vnc_password is not
set in nova.config.

Change-Id: Iac871030164aee62ab696671e71bd7f72a38db28
Fixes: bug # 1189585

very least, they have different uuids. Task decorator should produce

instead of wrapping it.

commit_message:
Refactor decorators

Make decorator code lean and mean by employing FunctorTask to implement
them. This results in:
- making everything we call 'task' to provide same interface;
- encouraging distinction between task classes and task instances;
- code becoming simpler.

Implements: blueprint refactor-decorators
Change-Id: I43f4ae2db2b7a20f294e2f2d91d53e151a60b139

'}]
commit_message:
Nicer way to make task out of any callable

This commit introduces taskflow.functor_task.FunctorTask class, which is
adapter that can be used to make a task from any callable. Dependencies,
revert callable, name and version can be specified at the moment of
construction.

Partially implements blueprint refactor-decorators
Change-Id: If92de20a67ea6c228abb0a78edaa837b98581646

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 02:46:55.000000000', 'message': 'Always validate auth_uri with allowed_auth_uris

The original intention was to allow heat to orchestrate
on any requested cloud when allowed_auth_uris is configured
with an empty list.

This change makes all requests be validated against
allowed_auth_uris for the following reasons:
- there is a potential security issue with requests
  being authorised by a fake keystone, allowing an exploit in
  heat to be executed without any valid authentication factors
  first being presented.
- ec2token middleware will also need to be made multi-cloud aware
  however as a compatible API it is not possible to specify the desired
  auth_uri with each request. Instead ec2token will need a list of
  configured endpoints so that it can try each one until a request
  is authenticated.

Change-Id: I3d6b7edf381a66b87b6e1fae07bc5dbe9db024bc
'}, {'created': '2013-08-19 04:08:56.000000000', 'message': 'Always validate auth_uri with allowed_auth_uris

The original intention was to allow heat to orchestrate
on any requested cloud when allowed_auth_uris is configured
with an empty list.

This change makes all requests be validated against
allowed_auth_uris for the following reasons:
- there is a potential security issue with requests
  being authorised by a fake keystone, allowing an exploit in
  heat to be executed without any valid authentication factors
  first being presented.
- ec2token middleware will also need to be made multi-cloud aware
  however as a compatible API it is not possible to specify the desired
  auth_uri with each request. Instead ec2token will need a list of

'}, {'created': '2013-08-21 23:11:40.000000000', 'message': 'Always validate auth_uri with allowed_auth_uris

The original intention was to allow heat to orchestrate
on any requested cloud when allowed_auth_uris is configured
with an empty list.

This change makes all requests be validated against
allowed_auth_uris for the following reasons:
- there is a potential security issue with requests
  being authorised by a fake keystone, allowing an exploit in
  heat to be executed without any valid authentication factors
  first being presented.
- ec2token middleware will also need to be made multi-cloud aware
  however as a compatible API it is not possible to specify the desired
  auth_uri with each request. Instead ec2token will need a list of
  configured endpoints so that it can try each one until a request
  is authenticated.

Change-Id: I3d6b7edf381a66b87b6e1fae07bc5dbe9db024bc
'}]
commit_message:
Always validate auth_uri with allowed_auth_uris

The original intention was to allow heat to orchestrate
on any requested cloud when allowed_auth_uris is configured
with an empty list.

This change makes all requests be validated against
allowed_auth_uris for the following reasons:
- there is a potential security issue with requests
  being authorised by a fake keystone, allowing an exploit in
  heat to be executed without any valid authentication factors
  first being presented.
- ec2token middleware will also need to be made multi-cloud aware
  however as a compatible API it is not possible to specify the desired
  auth_uri with each request. Instead ec2token will need a list of
  configured endpoints so that it can try each one until a request
  is authenticated.

Change-Id: I3d6b7edf381a66b87b6e1fae07bc5dbe9db024bc

commit_message:
Replace using tests.utils part1

It is the second step to replace using tests.utils with
stack.common.test.
In this patch first part of tests is changed for using
openstack.common.test and added needed fixtures in test classes.

Change-Id: Id95743059818a80af5bf1fab4ae1cee528b92809
bp: common-unit-tests

[{'created': '2013-08-16 08:30:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix testcase erros in test_auth_token_middleware

Fixed assertRaises tests which did not pass conf as a keyword argument
to self.set_middleware

Fixes bug #1212984

Change-Id: I5933d4a16aadd80ed7ad0b9150f444ce0f3294ab
'}, {'created': '2013-08-23 03:38:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix testcase errors in test_auth_token_middleware

Fixed assertRaises tests which did not pass conf as a keyword argument
to self.set_middleware
Removed test_invalid_auth_version_request() according to the comment in
AuthProtocol._choose_api_version

    # If the configuration specifies an auth_version we will just
    # assume that is correct and use it.

Fixes bug #1212984

Change-Id: I5933d4a16aadd80ed7ad0b9150f444ce0f3294ab
'}]
commit_message:
Fix testcase errors in test_auth_token_middleware

Fixed assertRaises tests which did not pass conf as a keyword argument
to self.set_middleware
Removed test_invalid_auth_version_request() according to the comment in
AuthProtocol._choose_api_version

    # If the configuration specifies an auth_version we will just
    # assume that is correct and use it.

Fixes bug #1212984

Change-Id: I5933d4a16aadd80ed7ad0b9150f444ce0f3294ab

commit_message:
Re-order oauth commands and sync with keystoneclient

1) split out token and consumer
2) sync parameters with keystoneclient

Change-Id: I2d529f0f9087f9939101e963af3d801497fc1171

[{'created': '2013-08-23 15:22:20.000000000', 'message': "Freeze amqp version for rpm packaging

The latest version of Kombu requires amqp version
be less than 1.1, so we're freezing at 1.0.13.

Change-Id: I0ed6d717b428687600dfc99ff1c51cacb0930bce
"}]
commit_message:
Freeze amqp version for rpm packaging

The latest version of Kombu requires amqp version
be less than 1.1, so we're freezing at 1.0.13.

Change-Id: I0ed6d717b428687600dfc99ff1c51cacb0930bce

revisions:

commit_message:
Fix spice/vnc console api samples tests

Start the consoleauth service, otherwise authorize_console() will fail
if we start timing out call()s in the fake RPC driver when there are no
consumers for a topic.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ieee37a0370c0b548c589a0573e6e8a68e10a6fdc

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 22:24:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix network manager tests to use correct network host

Without this, if we time out call()s in the fake RPC driver when there
are no consumers for a topic, then the test fails when it tries to call
_disassociate_floating_ip() on a non-existent host.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I99c9c75c07145a60b43701826fb680a346ec955f

commit_message:
Fix network manager tests to use correct network host

Without this, if we time out call()s in the fake RPC driver when there
are no consumers for a topic, then the test fails when it tries to call
_disassociate_floating_ip() on a non-existent host.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I99c9c75c07145a60b43701826fb680a346ec955f

subject: Stub out get_console_topic() in test_create_console

commit_message:
Stub out get_console_topic() in test_create_console

Without this, if we time out call()s in the fake RPC driver when there
are no consumers for a topic, then the test just fails.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ic085909711b19a05dedb0d7bafbd019bb0448212

subject: Stub out instance_fault_create() in compute tests

commit_message:
Stub out instance_fault_create() in compute tests

Without this, if we time out call()s in the fake RPC driver when there
are no consumers for a topic, the test_swap_volume_volume_api_usage()
test fails because of this.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ied223370769da19c01356673d2f2751fb83af328

commit_message:
Fix confirm_resize() mock in compute tests

Looks like this intended to mock out confirm_resize() but forgot a
crucial bit. If we time out call()s in the fake RPC driver when there
are no consumers for a topic, the test_delete_in_resized() test fails
because of this.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Iedc540170f6df29050764f497afa1ba07fed997a

commit_message:
Bump python-ceilometerclient to 1.0.3

Heat needs the new "repeat_actions" option that is in
that release.

Change-Id: I6574d0845bc59eeb3af73375247569030154de68

This is to address an unimplemented comment at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41290/2/heat/engine/event.py
Bascically, there is a logical_resource_id/resource_name mismatch to
address, and this patch is trying to resolve that.

Change-Id: Idac696259af30f8db7816499474057c354d73800
'}]
commit_message:
Rename event logical_resource_id to resource_name

This is to address an unimplemented comment at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41290/2/heat/engine/event.py
Bascically, there is a logical_resource_id/resource_name mismatch to
address, and this patch is trying to resolve that.

Change-Id: Idac696259af30f8db7816499474057c354d73800

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 04:04:32.000000000', 'message': 'turn out usb_tablet for libvirt

This patch turns out usb_tablet for the libvirt nova.conf file.
When usb_tablet is turned on, qemu will poll for usb events and
this causes CPU usage even when the qemu is idle.

Change-Id: I03e260dfd0873b7d15e01c10c206203833d04e73
'}]
commit_message:
turn out usb_tablet for libvirt

This patch turns out usb_tablet for the libvirt nova.conf file.
When usb_tablet is turned on, qemu will poll for usb events and
this causes CPU usage even when the qemu is idle.

Change-Id: I03e260dfd0873b7d15e01c10c206203833d04e73

'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-08-20 08:37:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: (1 inline comment)

I don't understand why we need this. It seems to me that every storage drivers stores data with a correct type, and that JSON data are deserialized to correct types too.

Why I recognize there's a bug currently, how do we ended up needing this?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-08-20 11:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

Julien, the data coming from the notifications and going into the storage system has the correct type because it's "unspecified" JSON. The payload is just passed through json.load() and the parser deals with the types.

The queries, on the other hand, come in through the API layer and WSME does the transformations. We specify that the type of the "value" field for a Query item is a string, and so it always is by the time we get it (at least that's how the problem was reported).'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-08-20 11:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

That makes sense indeed. 

It seems to me we can also provides Query by posting JSON data rather than using query parameters. In this case, it should be safe right?

I think we should also handle timestamp based on iso8601 at some point, though it can be added in a later patch.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-08-22 15:58:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Just tell me if you want to fix your nickname before I approve ?'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2013-08-23 13:57:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-08-23 13:59:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Fixes non-string metadata query issue

Based on current wsme implement, all the metadata query will get
the metadata value as string type. As a result, all the non-string
metadata query will not get correct result. Since the data is store
in database with correct data type. The fix will try to eval the
value before setting so as to get the correct data type.

Fixes bug 1200577

Change-Id: I8114e816da123b9dc08f32f9022db0e1b9fc2e5a

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26441/"}, {'account_id': 7494, 'date': '2013-08-16 16:22:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks Matt. Just check the issue as you mentioned, I think that we are doing the same thing, make code clean and easy to read. ;-)

What I want to do is to clarify two APIs, one is using id and the other is using uuid.
1) instance_get -> id

commit_message:
Change parameter name from instance_uuid to instance_id

There are two API to get instance by id
1) instance_get
2) instance_get_by_uuid

instance_get is using instance_id as parameter and
instance_get_by_uuid is using instance_uuid as parameter.

For some functions which is calling instance_get, it also using
instance_uuid as parameter, this might cause some confusion for
developers. It is better to change instance_uuid to instance_id
for instance_get.

Change-Id: I0e391ac96718234993d2d7557a05fa83b23acfb0

subject: Fix rpc calls on pre/post live migration tests

commit_message:
Fix rpc calls on pre/post live migration tests

If we time out call()s in the fake RPC driver when there are no
consumers for a topic, lots of tests fail when we attempt to call()
out to the compute service to do pre_live_migration().

Also use the same method to mock out some post_live_migration() calls
which are currently done a pretty awkward way.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ifb1675cfbc3c6a325f0a3d2d130268561342001e

commit_message:
Stub out setup_networks_on_host() in compute tests

If we time out call()s in the fake RPC driver when there are no
consumers for a topic, lots of tests fail when we attempt to call()
out to the network service to do setup_networks_on_host().

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I62f855f111c5f69a676e8e3747a9894847d5d27d

commit_message:
Use timeutils.utcnow in alarm threshold evaluation

This change use timeutils.utcnow() in alarm threshold evaluation
instead of datetime.utcnow() to allow mock the the now datetime

It also add a test to check the behavior of bound_duration method.

Change-Id: I970e63da33e17018ed4fef31d0082803f6e0fb29

commit_message:
Updated include_recipes to use proper cb name

We will want to update the attributes to the proper new naming,
but for now, updated include_recipe to match the actual cb name.
Also, brought in berkshelf 2.x since it is used across rest of
cookbooks, and updated Berkfile to our standard.

Change-Id: Ic13eb27eb471d15b8a3f7dd38318c4ba0033ed69

commit_message:
Update Cinder's policy.json file for migration

Add necessary policies to support Cinder's volume migration, using a
new policy_add function which can be re-used.

Fixes: bug 1214569

Change-Id: I9baad5f933e14c5d3647786478992462d190f53e

subject: Skip os-fixed-ips test since neutron has not implemented it
messages:
[{'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-08-20 06:43:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I would remove this patch from the dependency chain, since it can be done interdependent.
As I remember just 2 of the test cases actually failing with neutron, do we need to skip the others ?'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-08-20 08:02:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

the nova fixed ips extension only supports nova network, not neutron. So if tests are passing its by accident :) 

I agree it would be much better if its not dependent on a patch which it really isn't dependent on so just +1"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-08-20 11:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The authorization normally came before any real action.

I am ok with skipping this extension with neutron for now.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-08-20 15:42:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

(1 inline comment)

Fine by me. See note inline about no need for + concat within parens...'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-20 15:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-08-20 15:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Removing +1A due to concern from Matthew'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-08-20 15:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

So this -2 only to prevent the merge from the previous +A. Just treat it as a -1.

Instead of using a skipIf decorator on each test in that class. You should instead just raise a skipException in setUpClass() if neutron in enabled in config. There are a couple of other test classes that do it this way.'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2013-08-21 01:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2013-08-21 01:40:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

hi Matthew, has changed to use skipException in setUpClass() instead of using a skipIf decorator on each test.

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-07-29 13:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure this is such a good idea. It seems a bit fragile, essentially saying that various test cases can be called by a different "runner", thus introducing new possibilities of breakage things change. It is always possible to run multiple copies of tempest with a selected set of tests to achieve a similar effect. What do other folks think?'}, {'account_id': 7872, 'date': '2013-07-29 14:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

dkranz: I like the idea to have an easy way to convert usual test cases to a stress test. But sure such a test is not designed as a stress test. If we find a good and fancy approach this will save us a lot of time and code duplications.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-07-29 17:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Attila suggested in IRC that this could be a good way to chase down flaky regular tests. That makes sense but perhaps this patch could focus on the ability to do that. I still think this feature is a bit too easy to misuse.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-30 12:37:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

IMHO it is better than a multiprocessing in a bash script :)

Until you do not have good enough guess for a more focused stress test case, it can be a good starting point, for reproducing the issue.

Usually you have guesses which test cases can be involved (the ones ran at the same time), or just the one which raised the exception.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-08-02 06:07:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-08-05 08:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Marc that this is a nice feature to have; given how the api tests are structured I think they can in many cases be reused as stress tests by just executing them with some concurrency (I'm thinking about the create_get_delete or list tests we have).

At the same time I agree with David that this could be easily misused so, as a sort of "security" measure, I'd keep it deadly simple and drop the setUpClass/tearDownClass logic, forcing the execution of those method in every action rather than let testers configure it to be shared amongst the threads or not.

Other than that I think it will be a job for reviewers/approvers decide on a case by case basis when it is worth to use this feature for a new stress test or not.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-08-09 08:48:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-08-09 08:53:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

@afazekas: in case anyone asks for additional changes, I'd think about renaming class_setup_once_per_thread in class_setup_per_thread"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-09 09:30:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

commit_message:
Unit tests as stress tests

Creating a special stressaction, which is able to call an
arbitrary existing unit test as stress action.

The setUpClass() and tearDownClass() can happen in every action,
 or just once per thread or once per stress application run,
 it is configure able option.

Change-Id: Ia5432a4d9d749aa7618e098d8eeedd70d00b0b6d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-20 00:10:12.000000000', 'message': 'Cisco plugin (grizzly) does not pass proper args.

Fixes bug 1213147

The Cisco plugin in grizzly does not pass proper arguments to
the enable_vlan_on_trunk_int() method in cisco_nexus_network_driver_v2.
The definition calls for 4 arguments (not counting self):

    def enable_vlan_on_trunk_int(self, mgr, nexus_switch,
                                 interface, vlanid)

but the call in the nexus driver passes only 3 arguments:

    self._client.enable_vlan_on_trunk_int(man,
                                          port_id,
                                          vlan_id)

Change-Id: Ie51affe692151a2ac92f22450e2e70b1005f3507
'}]
commit_message:
Cisco plugin (grizzly) does not pass proper args.

Fixes bug 1213147

The Cisco plugin in grizzly does not pass proper arguments to
the enable_vlan_on_trunk_int() method in cisco_nexus_network_driver_v2.
The definition calls for 4 arguments (not counting self):

    def enable_vlan_on_trunk_int(self, mgr, nexus_switch,
                                 interface, vlanid)

but the call in the nexus driver passes only 3 arguments:

    self._client.enable_vlan_on_trunk_int(man,
                                          port_id,
                                          vlan_id)

commit_message:
Remove unsafe XML parsing

Move to using xmlutils for XML parsing. Fixes missing patch
for the V3 API in commit 0ef2c55d804e0dab58cb5419a0cafd6a805315c7
and fixes bug 1210529

Change-Id: I6dc6111844277565d075a4ff5a08fdee5bc99344

commit_message:
Add new compute method for building an instance

The run_instance method on the compute manager handles rescheduling of a
failed build by casting back to the scheduler.  In order to maintain
backwards compatibility while modifying the build process to go through
the conductor a new method is being added to co-ordinate building an
instance.

This is one part of a series of patches to build up the
build_and_run_instance method.

The conductor will be switched over to calling this method once it
reaches a level of consistency with the current run_instance method.

Part of bp query-scheduler

Change-Id: I879805efa4a0a045082c02b10926e1278136b72c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-23 12:25:26.000000000', 'message': "VMDK copy_image_to_volume and copy_volume_to_image

Implemented copy_image_to_volume that creates a new volume backing (vm) and
copies over the vmdk file from the glance image. Only glance images of disk
format 'vmdk' can be used to create a volume using this driver.

Also implemented copy_volume_to_image that creates a new glance image using
the volume's vmdk file. The steps involved are to take a snapshot of volume
vmdk, take a copy of this read only file and upload to glance.

Implements: blueprint vmware-vmdk-cinder-driver
Change-Id: Ice4ec29b480fed2932720cae9adbd2f50d4eb743
"}]
commit_message:
VMDK copy_image_to_volume and copy_volume_to_image

Implemented copy_image_to_volume that creates a new volume backing (vm) and
copies over the vmdk file from the glance image. Only glance images of disk
format 'vmdk' can be used to create a volume using this driver.

Also implemented copy_volume_to_image that creates a new glance image using
the volume's vmdk file. The steps involved are to take a snapshot of volume
vmdk, take a copy of this read only file and upload to glance.

Implements: blueprint vmware-vmdk-cinder-driver
Change-Id: Ice4ec29b480fed2932720cae9adbd2f50d4eb743

commit_message:
Fix live migration test for no scheduler running

If we time out call()s in the fake RPC driver when there are no
consumers for a topic, the live_migrate() test fails when we attempt
to call() out to scheduler.

Mock up the live_migration() rpcapi and verify it gets called.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Id06a4ff29a0bb4d2caee17576a0ff27bfab4cd87

commit_message:
Fix get_diagnostics() test for no compute consumer

If we time out call()s in the fake RPC driver when there are no
consumers for a topic, the get_diagnostics() test fails when we attempt
to call() out to compute.

Mock up the get_diagnostics() rpcapi and verify it gets called.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I4e33d089a9b01ea6dbe31ddf3c67c1733fce10aa

commit_message:
Corrected  misspelled method in horizon documentation

In the page:  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/topics/testing.html had two misspelled assertion method.

asertNoMessages() changed by assertNoMessages(), twice.

Change-Id: Icde7d230e57701eb93ed4f0e705b7737260d7ecf
Fixes: without launchpad bug number.

commit_message:
Generate property Schema objects directly from parameters

Use Schema.from_parameter() instead of Property.schema_from_param() to
generate a property schema from a parameter schema.

Change-Id: I1049822057d954ddbb47027aad136f7b45541943

commit_message:
Use Template to instantiate TemplateResource

Use the Template class, rather than the raw template data, to obtain the
information required to create the schema of a TemplateResource facade.
This will allow this feature to work with multiple template formats (e.g.
HOT vs. CloudFormation).

Change-Id: Ifde739b081e95ed9f14567f35a0a1680c5e9b631

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 11:42:54.000000000', 'message': "Fixing format_flavor to handle flavor extra_specs

Flavor detail/show call has extra_specs as a child element in xml.
The parser strips off the namespace before comparing key value pairs.
We need to expect just the key 'extra_specs' without the namespace.

Fixes bug 1213896

Change-Id: I163d99d08b42aaedeeba377898f23f79153e3ee5
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing format_flavor to handle flavor extra_specs

Flavor detail/show call has extra_specs as a child element in xml.
The parser strips off the namespace before comparing key value pairs.
We need to expect just the key 'extra_specs' without the namespace.

Fixes bug 1213896

Change-Id: I163d99d08b42aaedeeba377898f23f79153e3ee5

commit_message:
Run a more GC iterations to make sure weakrefs are collected

This is needed to make sure the weakref callback is fired under PyPy.

Change-Id: I5d1b83186780ee6130463fe42fac58e411ad9f79

commit_message:
Cleanup: Add common "create volume" method

In scenario tests, there are some "create volume" methods and their
behaviors are almost the same. They create a volume with random name,
size 1GB and wait for volume status "available".
So this patch adds a common "create_volume" method and uses the method
instead of each implementation for code-cleanup.

Change-Id: I06f29a77116fd617f47b0ae6916de933ebb7fdc3

commit_message:
Replaced AD Domain Name with DNS Domain Name restriction

Note: Only first 15 chars or chars before first period is used as NetBIOS name.
We also should add later special field for NetBIOS names.

Change-Id: I10d4bfd2a0a6a35dbb3e9fca437ceae9e853cc1b

'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-11 20:07:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-07-12 19:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We need to think of the right way to deal with slow tests. In the past we have said that slow tests would not be part of the gate. If that is true we can just tag slow tests as slow, change tempest-full to skip slow tests, and they will run as part of the periodic tempest-all. 

But there was also a suggestion that some slow heat tests could be part of the gate but in a different job which would require a different approach. Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-13 12:40:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

dkranz: Creating a new gate job for heat (and slow) test  idea was popped up on the previous QA meeting.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-07-14 23:37:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

A dedicated gate job to slow heat tests is what I've been hoping for.

We would really like to gate on tests like these. Our autoscaling has so many moving parts that regressions are more common than we would like, and the prevailing wisdom seems to be that if you ain't gating on it, it will brake, and take longer to fix."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-07-15 13:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-16 20:46:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

According to an IRC discussion with lifeless, the testr is able to use attributes for test case selection.

So probably we need an attribute for identifying the several slower test.

I think we should try with this one first.
So we need to add an attribute like 'gate-alt' or 'slow' to this test case.
Add a nose parameter for exuding it from the full and smoke jobs. (tox.ini)

We also need to define a new tox.ini section, before setting up a new gate job."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-07-18 01:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So if there is a separate gate job for heat-specific slow test, maybe the attribute should be a bit more specific.

slowheat?'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-07-18 13:04:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think there is a similar issue with slow tests for cinder so I'd pick a more generic tag and actually avoid to call it 'slow' but choose something like 'full' (all tests doesn't necessarily mean slow tests).
 
I believe this has been discussed before and the idea was to just not place any tag on tests which aren't smoke or gate tests; this could be a periodic job.

Please correct me also in the review if this is wrong."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-07-19 19:28:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Couple of things. 

I do think the heat templates should come into a file instead of inline, makes them possible to use mode specific editors on them later.

Also, from the last qa meeting we're recommending this come in as a scenario test instead of an API test, as that will let it use the heatclient, and make it easier for use to carve this off into a separate gate job to give you guys a dedicated time budget. That will let the autoscale stuff be more realistic."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-07-26 20:00:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Sean, I agree with both of your points. python-heatclient needs tempest gating enabled before it can be used for scenario testing (I can do that).

I've been quiet on pushing this test because I'm currently blocked on building the test image with diskimage-builder in devstack (I'm waiting for a pbr release)."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-03 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-03 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Heat autoscaling scenario test

This test starts with a single server and scales up to
three servers triggered by a script that consumes memory.

Seven minutes after stack creation, memory consumption script
will quit and the scale down alarms will scale back down to
a single server.

Due to the nature of this test, it takes about 10 minutes to
run locally.

The scenario test has been put in package orchestration
for the following reasons:
- this will be the first of many heat scenario tests
- this will allow a tox filter to run this test for the
  slow heat gating job

Change-Id: I53ed12369d12b902108b9b8fa7885df34f6ab51f

commit_message:
(WIP) cli: add messages to assertTrue

---
Trying to backport change I3abba1d9509bee649aa1675beee4153341b1e170
to see if it provides enough info for bug 1213912.

For now with invalid C.Id so it's not connected with
original change (yet).
---

1) Unify assertion of 'usage: service-name' from
   {cinder, glance, keystone, neutron} help tests
   into assertFirstLineStartsWith method, which provides
   more usefull failure message.
2) Add failure message to assertTrue in keystone-catalog
   test.

Conflicts:
	cli/__init__.py
	tempest/cli/simple_read_only/test_cinder.py
	tempest/cli/simple_read_only/test_glance.py
	tempest/cli/simple_read_only/test_neutron.py

Change-Id: I12c5db29e997500f6090a9ee93231053b5d275fc

commit_message:
Stubout reserve_block_device_name() in test

Otherwise it gets called during attach_volume() and fails if we time out
call()s in the fake RPC driver when there are no consumers for a topic.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I81a8e7fc3c10b6f1ddbec7b1c4ddbbfc9bb45934

subject: Stubout deallocate_for_instance() in compute tests

commit_message:
Stubout deallocate_for_instance() in compute tests

Otherwise it gets called during delete() and fails if we time out
call()s in the fake RPC driver when there are no consumers for a topic.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I14516d43b2850c554cb997b3d41d20db04ff7a9b

subject: Stub out net API sooner in servers API test
