commit_message:
Stub out net API sooner in servers API test

Currently we're stubbing out the network API after the controller has
already cached a pristine copy of it.

Without this, validate_networks() fails if we time out call()s in the
fake RPC driver when there are no consumers for a topic.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ia777f964d56678cabb62c1c1dc5db5684ef5dbc0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 02:58:49.000000000', 'message': 'flake8 H202 error in test_image_utils.py

H202 will detect following case:
self.assertRaises(Exception, foo)

Replace Exception with test.TestingException to pass the H202 checking.

Bug #1214365

Change-Id: Idbd13d11995e6a22e99bb9d63c344a5b1a75f987
'}]
commit_message:
flake8 H202 error in test_image_utils.py

H202 will detect following case:
self.assertRaises(Exception, foo)

Replace Exception with test.TestingException to pass the H202 checking.

Bug #1214365

Change-Id: Idbd13d11995e6a22e99bb9d63c344a5b1a75f987

commit_message:
Add a CloudWatch::Alarm implementation based on Ceilometer

It's off by default for the moment so the current cloudwatch tests can run.

Change-Id: Ibdce9c9223969bdcb8f2368e98dc6ab1241b84df

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-14 07:47:07.000000000', 'message': 'To support both CW and CM, return alarmurl from policy ref

This is so we can still have the following:
  AlarmActions:
  - {Ref: ServerScaleUpPolicy}

and use Ceilometer underneath.

The watchrule now tries to look up the resource by
both name and resource_by_refid.

Change-Id: I4759806919ab4f3ccef66698235b23f7f310cb03

commit_message:
To support both CW and CM, return alarmurl from policy ref

This is so we can still have the following:
  AlarmActions:
  - {Ref: ServerScaleUpPolicy}

and use Ceilometer underneath.

The watchrule now tries to look up the resource by
both name and resource_by_refid.

Change-Id: I4759806919ab4f3ccef66698235b23f7f310cb03

commit_message:
GPFS use clone_image for creating volumes

If both source and target of gpfs create volume from image operation
are backed by gpfs storage use clone_image method for implementing
the move of image data to the new volume.

The copy_image_to_volume method is used only if this is not true,
and uses image_utils.fetch_to_raw to move image data to the new
volume.

Fixes bug #1213248

Change-Id: I3958febe67cc86bc3cb608288f7d064f74d3a731

commit_message:
Move root task class to base file.

Start cleaning up the large create_volume file by
splitting up the base task and task naming helper
into its own file.

Change-Id: Ibff80dc8b10507d49374737b4760039f51d8e1ba

commit_message:
Remove unused methods from cinder.utils

These methods were left over from the split from Nova and are unused still.

Remove methods:
	fetchfile()
	trycmd()
	generate_uid()
	last_octet()
	get_my_linklocal()
	parse_mailmap()
	str_dict_replace()
	flatten_dict()

Change-Id: I5d41dec66246814bb1edb6f4993d5307587a00f9

commit_message:
cli: add messages to assertTrue

1) Unify assertion of 'usage: service-name' from
   {cinder, glance, keystone, neutron} help tests
   into assertFirstLineStartsWith method, which provides
   more usefull failure message.
2) Add failure message to assertTrue in keystone-catalog
   test.

Change-Id: I3abba1d9509bee649aa1675beee4153341b1e170

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 16:35:16.000000000', 'message': '3PAR driver add missing domain check on QOS cmd

The 3PAR drivers need to support CPGs that are not part of a
virtual domain on the 3PAR backend. This patch now checks
if the domain is set before calling the createvvset command.
This instance was overlooked in the following patch that has
already been merged: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42697/

Also fixes: bug 1212328

Change-Id: I0375dfc89104775582b9258f18f97c683e6148b1
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR driver add missing domain check on QOS cmd

The 3PAR drivers need to support CPGs that are not part of a
virtual domain on the 3PAR backend. This patch now checks
if the domain is set before calling the createvvset command.
This instance was overlooked in the following patch that has
already been merged: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42697/

Also fixes: bug 1212328

Change-Id: I0375dfc89104775582b9258f18f97c683e6148b1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 19:15:11.000000000', 'message': "Dont crash service if sf cluster isnt available

Currently if the SolidFire driver is configured but the cluster
isn't available for some reason the ensure_export call will raise
an unhandled exception and crash the volume-service.

We should be able to handle things like loosing connectivity to
a single back-end without impacting the other volume-service
backends.

Rather than raise, we can just sit in a loop waiting for the
SolidFire cluster to come back.

Fixes: bug 1215064

Change-Id: Ice3f517d220c40113074bb77adbb10d5e32abd0b
"}, {'created': '2013-08-22 17:21:55.000000000', 'message': "Dont crash service if sf cluster isnt available

Currently if the SolidFire driver is configured but the cluster
isn't available for some reason the ensure_export call will raise

backends.

return None in the case that the connection can't be made.

message that the connection timed out.

commit_message:
Dont crash service if sf cluster isnt available

Currently if the SolidFire driver is configured but the cluster
isn't available for some reason the ensure_export call will raise
an unhandled exception and crash the volume-service.

We should be able to handle things like loosing connectivity to
a single back-end without impacting the other volume-service
backends.

We'll wrap the ensure_export call in a try block here and
return None in the case that the connection can't be made.
This will keep the service from crashing and log an error
message that the connection timed out.

Additional work would include adding a periodic retry task
to the manager to try and start the backend service for us
on some regular interval incase the device comes back.

Fixes: bug 1215064

Change-Id: Ice3f517d220c40113074bb77adbb10d5e32abd0b

commit_message:
Move all opens in auth_token to be in context

This commit switches the use of open() to be in a with context. This
will prevent leaking file descriptors because using a context
provides an inherent close(). Prior to this commit it was possible
that an exception or error during the write() call could prevent
close() from running.

Change-Id: Ib13fe651d41f0eafea23a1c96c6c64d405de7e49

k, got it now. But I can't imaging copy-paste is the best approach here? Can't we reuse most of the impl_mongodb.py code? Perhaps some dependency injection on the mongo module?"}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-08-12 18:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sandy, I was thinking about subclass, but I think over time it
may not be a good idea, classes in impl_mongo meant to be
mongo specific and was not developed for subclass especially
for other databases, so I do not think subclass is an option.
If we want to do more code sharing, I think impl_mongo will
need to be refactored to make it more reusable. I think over
time, the code will actually diverge more.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-08-12 18:49:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

k, if others are cool with all this copy-paste I'll change my vote. My gut says we should refactor impl_mongo and make this file very small/simple and only contain the differences."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-08-12 18:55:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I haven't reviewed this code yet, but I do want to chime in on the copy-and-paste question.

Usually I would agree with Sandy, but in my past experience drivers are one area where refactoring to get code reuse can make the result more complicated to understand. In this case it would mean someone modifying the mongo driver would also need to understand how those changes may affect db2 (and vice versa). The differences are often subtle enough that the base class has weirdly artificial "hooks" or other constructs that just copying the classes and making the required changes eliminate. As long as we do a good job of documenting those areas through comments, I'm more comfortable making a copy than trying to make a single base class for both drivers.

That said, if the databases are exactly compatible, then I'd rather just register the db2 name to point to the mongo driver instead of adding a separate driver at all. That would be similar to what we do with the SQL databases and sqlalchemy.'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-08-12 20:15:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Doug, DB2 is adding the nosql features but it has some
differences and requirements and also some thing specific
restrictions. For example, map_reduce won't be available.
having two separate drivers can be a flexible solution. Mixed
db2 and mongo altogether will make the code not clean and
hard to maintain down the road. At this point, we would like
to have it in a separate driver, when db2 has full compatible
functions available, one can simply switch to mongo driver.
The db2 driver can sunset."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-08-12 20:41:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I will try to come back and review the implementation in more detail, but I agree that keeping the drivers completely separate is a good approach.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-08-13 10:47:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck bug 1211532'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-13 11:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-08-16 16:24:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

SQLAlchemy supports DB2 with the ibm_db_sa adapter:

http://code.google.com/p/ibm-db/wiki/README

There's no reason to have a different driver for DB2 IMO.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-08-16 16:55:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Jay, it seems this is the NoSQL version of DB2, I don't think SQLAlchemy supports that."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-08-16 17:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: No score

NoSQL version of DB2? :( Why oh why must IBM torture itself....'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-08-16 17:36:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Jay, IBM comes with a new feature for DB2, which eventually
will be compatible with mongodb in terms of features. The
SqlAlchemy still lacks certain functions and they fundamentally different from mongodb. Using RDBMS for
unstructured data is like using a hammer for screws. With NoSQL feature added for DB2, it will be an outstanding product on the market place. You probably can not name one
product that can do both SQL and NoSQL other than DB2.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-08-16 18:02:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Ceilometer data is highly structured and relational data. An RDBMS is a better solution for structured/relational data than a NoSQL solution, IMO. But, that's besides the point. I did not realize that DB2 was supporting a Mongo-style API..."}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-08-16 18:23:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-08-16 20:34:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-08-16 20:38:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Jay, If you only consider the data other than metadata, sure,
it is highly structured. But metadata is where the nteresting
things actually happen. Vendor specific notifiers will most
likely develop their own meters with various metadata. Today
using rdbms still can not have metadata filtering supported.
That is what I was talking about unstructured data.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-16 22:51:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
db2 support

this patch set makes db2 available as a database backend for ceilometer
it implements the blueprint documented at:
blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/ibm-db2-support

implements bp ibm-db2-support
Change-Id: I33903fe5ebd02679d5a7adbd79dd2650a52f689a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-20 09:16:15.000000000', 'message': "Doc: clarify the 'cpu_util' measurement.

As explained in bug #1202938, the 'cpu_util' measurement documentation may not
be clear enough. In this patch, we specify that it gives the guest (not the
host) CPU utilisation and that it computes the average utilisation when there
are more than one VCPU (since the measurement is divided by the number of VCPUS
during the 'scale' phase of the transformation).

Change-Id: I69f46b5f82dc0dec2a584ea002dbee19bd55568d
"}, {'created': '2013-08-22 11:58:04.000000000', 'message': "Doc: improve doc about Nova measurements

As explained in bug #1202938, the 'cpu_util' measurement documentation may not
be clear enough. In this patch, we specify that it returns the average
utilisation when there are more than one VCPU (since the measurement is divided
by the number of VCPUS during the 'scale' phase of the transformation).

We also explicitely state that the Nova measurements return information about
the guests, not the hosts.

Change-Id: I69f46b5f82dc0dec2a584ea002dbee19bd55568d
"}]
commit_message:
Doc: improve doc about Nova measurements

As explained in bug #1202938, the 'cpu_util' measurement documentation may not
be clear enough. In this patch, we specify that it returns the average
utilisation when there are more than one VCPU (since the measurement is divided
by the number of VCPUS during the 'scale' phase of the transformation).

We also explicitely state that the Nova measurements return information about
the guests, not the hosts.

Change-Id: I69f46b5f82dc0dec2a584ea002dbee19bd55568d

commit_message:
unset locking mode for querying IPAllocationPool

Comment #4 of bug 1111572 shows that ip_allocation_pools is a
read-only attribute. So we don't need a lock to query it.

Fixes bug 1215350

Change-Id: Ife2036f254e56f88185e01e20670289d8dd506d3

[{'created': '2013-08-15 09:09:58.000000000', 'message': "use testCase.assert instead of assert and try...except

In unit tests, we should use: self.assertTrue or self.assertFalse
instead of 'assert xxx is True/False', and use self.assertRaises instead
of 'try ... except ...'

fixes bug #1212602

Change-Id: I25318eb59cd26a98afdce5495273e3b3266655a4
"}]
commit_message:
use testCase.assert instead of assert and try...except

In unit tests, we should use: self.assertTrue or self.assertFalse
instead of 'assert xxx is True/False', and use self.assertRaises instead
of 'try ... except ...'

fixes bug #1212602

Change-Id: I25318eb59cd26a98afdce5495273e3b3266655a4

Change-Id: Ic478754b7b96001fa0d4110a66d008609de7b482
'}, {'created': '2013-08-22 23:31:35.000000000', 'message': 'Do not delete nova server on create fail

commit_message:
Do not delete nova server on create fail

To keep in line with the behaviour of other resources,
a nova server should only be deleted on resource delete.

Fixes bug: #1215132

Change-Id: Ic478754b7b96001fa0d4110a66d008609de7b482

commit_message:
Do not assume nova provides a fault on ERROR

A nova server object in an ERROR state does not
always provide a fault attribute to get the error
reason from.

Fixes bug: #1213285

Change-Id: I861951207cf8fd526a65f768154c76afd0be9081

Add a script show all possible state transitions

The output of this script will be useful in documenting all possible
state transitions.

commit_message:
Fix instance metadata access in xenapi

In preparation for objects, use the helper method in utils to get instance
metadata.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I552369937854ec195d1f9abb1835b4e6afef7a70

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 03:52:38.000000000', 'message': 'Adds infra for v3 API sample creation

Adds the required infrastructure for the v3 API sample creation.
- v3 API samples and the test cases are in their own v3 directory
- API samples from "core" are now put in their own (per plugin)
  directory rather than in the root directory
- Testcases to create api samples are now placed in individual
  files rather than one giant one. I think it makes it clearer what
  testcases we do have and avoids merge conflict pain

Adds API samples for basic servers interaction

Fix for bug in servers.py where if no extension was loaded which
extends create xml deserialization an exception would occur (fixed
here because it causes the api sample tests ported to fail).

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests

Change-Id: I653af49dcc499c18f14b6e1764711a9922354069

commit_message:
Adds infra for v3 API sample creation

Adds the required infrastructure for the v3 API sample creation.
- v3 API samples and the test cases are in their own v3 directory
- API samples from "core" are now put in their own (per plugin)
  directory rather than in the root directory
- Testcases to create api samples are now placed in individual
  files rather than one giant one. I think it makes it clearer what
  testcases we do have and avoids merge conflict pain

Adds API samples for basic servers interaction

Fix for bug in servers.py where if no extension was loaded which
extends create xml deserialization an exception would occur (fixed
here because it causes the api sample tests ported to fail).

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests

Change-Id: I653af49dcc499c18f14b6e1764711a9922354069

subject: Port integrated tests for V3 API

commit_message:
Port integrated tests for V3 API

Ports most of the integrated tests to the V3 API. The
test api samples test will be ported to the V3 API in a later
changeset

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests

Change-Id: I00a93471d95760e6c97534808c5a93522710b20d

commit_message:
Refactor integrated tests to support V2 and V3 API testing Part 2

This changeset moves the APISampleTestBase class out into its own
file so the V3 versions of the tests can cleanly import it separate
from the V2 code.

Partially implements v3-api-unittests
Partially implements v3-api-specification

Change-Id: If0994934edb2ab19004353f9a4089ce525ed31dd

Rename event logical_resource_id to resource_name

If0b88e0f9e243cf3cc6d747ffa04b9a429ea83a2.

commit_message:
Create various heat config files

Have puppet create separate heat-api, heat-api-cfn,
heat-api-cloudwatch and heat-engine config files

Fixes bug 1214824

Change-Id: Ie4f4ddb75eeec8bb47669c3b402bd76425ea9870

[{'created': '2013-08-20 06:06:34.000000000', 'message': 'Set VM back to its original state if cold migration failed

If migration of a VM in the SHUTOFF state failed due to
NoValidHost, the VM was erroneously set to ACTIVE.

The fix sets the VM back to its original state instead.

Fix bug 1204905

Change-Id: I67ccac9ff4104fbd63c545b9f9399206a7febae7
'}, {'created': '2013-08-20 15:53:15.000000000', 'message': 'Set VM back to its original state if cold migration failed

If migration of a VM in the STOPPED state failed due to
NoValidHost, the VM was erroneously set to ACTIVE.

The fix sets the VM back to its original state instead.

Fix bug 1204905

Change-Id: I67ccac9ff4104fbd63c545b9f9399206a7febae7
'}]
commit_message:
Set VM back to its original state if cold migration failed

If migration of a VM in the STOPPED state failed due to
NoValidHost, the VM was erroneously set to ACTIVE.

The fix sets the VM back to its original state instead.

Fix bug 1204905

Change-Id: I67ccac9ff4104fbd63c545b9f9399206a7febae7

commit_message:
Convert heat.common.template_format to use C yaml

Will fall back to pyyaml if CSafeLoader/CSafeDumper are not available.
This should increase template parsing performance by a factor of 9 and
reduce memory usage by an order of magnitude.

We also convert the one test that was directly calling yaml to use the
template_format.parse function, so that the same parsing is used
everywhere.

Change-Id: I0d14be2ef7fb2dccac43fc41b1d2d9e4395c6f77
Fixes bug #1214580

'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2013-08-08 20:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-08-14 02:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-08-14 03:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

This needs to be deprecated. In the config, users can specify a list of extensions with the osapi_volume_ext_list.'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-08-14 05:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Mike, can you give some more details please?'}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-08-14 15:20:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sure. In the cinder.conf [1] there's a osapi_volume_ext_list config option. You can pass a list of extensions. If that's set, when loading extensions we check if the classnames from the extensions in the contrib directory are in that list. [2] I'm worried that if people have this set now, when they upgrade to H they will have to update this list in order for things to work the same.

[1] - https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample#L100
[2] - https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/api/extensions.py#L351"}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-08-15 08:38:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I see what you're saying.  Because I changed the class name, people will need to change their config files, right?  In my migration patch, I have another one of these files to expose the migration status to the admin.  Having 3 database accesses instead of 1 and 3 copies of the code is ugly.  Suggestions?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-23 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-23 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-08 13:22:22.000000000', 'message': 'Unify code for volume attribute API extensions

There are two files that are copy-pastes of each other for returning
volume attributes. This factors out that common code in both the
implemtation and the tests. There are 2 main reasons for this:
1. Reduce code duplication
2. Reduce the number of DB accesses

Change-Id: Ibb9378f1ca0a40a6c0b92ef5a7e237ddd9d8b63f
'}]
commit_message:
Unify code for volume attribute API extensions

There are two files that are copy-pastes of each other for returning
volume attributes. This factors out that common code in both the
implemtation and the tests. There are 2 main reasons for this:
1. Reduce code duplication
2. Reduce the number of DB accesses

Change-Id: Ibb9378f1ca0a40a6c0b92ef5a7e237ddd9d8b63f

'}, {'account_id': 7395, 'date': '2013-08-05 19:17:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

These configuration files are a lot easier to use than the rent heat.conf being used to replace them. I would like to see a heat.conf submitted with this patch which requires the <= the amount of configuration the current config files. Also it would be nice if install.sh was updated to setup options on the heat.conf the same way it does in the current config files."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-08-06 08:36:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

The work should be oriented towards generating smaller, more readable, and with better default value configuration file, not maintained manual configuration files that will be outdated most of the time.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-08-06 09:14:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So this change clearly needs some further discussion (is there a ML thread?  I didn't see one..), but one observation is that there are references to these files in multiple locations in the docs, so that either needs fixing in this patch, or a followup patch which depends on this change.

I also don't like that this will break all the puppet configs etc which people have been working on, relatively late in the Havana cycle, and also will we need a Devstack patch up to cope with this change?  If so I'd like to see it posted and probably mentioned in the commit message"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-08-06 16:00:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I totally agree that we should discuss on it by the ML or whatever. I'm going to shoot an email right now.

For the puppet module, the work is in progress : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39980/

Thank's for review"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-08-06 16:07:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

commit_message:
Using unicode() to handle image's properties

Replace str() to unicode() to allow nova-api work well with the fix Liu
Zhi Yan did in glanceclient (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29245/6).

Fixes: Bug #1180377

Change-Id: I6bfcaf6d69abcfe7c1d45eae28d77795a7443252
(cherry picked from commit 832a66cf0bd8f7ccb0878889174c1ce4da7f42f3)

[{'created': '2013-08-15 13:50:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing dependencies

Add pbr and d2to1 as dependencies otherwise dpkg will
try to download the packages while building unless
if its explictily added as a build-dependency.

Change-Id: Ibd60a75e24dd491ce70b844761030dcf5ce4a508
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing dependencies

Add pbr and d2to1 as dependencies otherwise dpkg will
try to download the packages while building unless
if its explictily added as a build-dependency.

Change-Id: Ibd60a75e24dd491ce70b844761030dcf5ce4a508
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add api list, match commands

* 'api list' displays various bits about the API versions available in
  the client and on the servers.
* 'api match' tests the matching bits
* useful in debugging api version-related issues

Depends on the restapi support

Change-Id: I02452f62ee0cd698594bbcf90c0654234d86257a

Fixes files with wrong bitmode

setup.py have bitmode 755, Changed to 644,
do not remove shebang because of openstack requirements.

Change-Id: Id65a04f39a8d50c4cde61f1a6a3d3597b9c0ba06

Fixes files with wrong bitmode

setup.py have bitmode 755, Changed to 644,
do not remove shebang because of openstack requirements.

Change-Id: I2b03a434f10b5bd8fafa1c359d8171ab10235fc4

'}, {'account_id': 7661, 'date': '2013-07-16 21:45:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The point of this patch is it was found on slow connections, the delete connection times out before the objects are deleted.  The raise in the connection timeout isn't caught in the mainline.  Still not sure why it doesn't throw an error but I suspect it might be in part due to the interaction with the other threads.

This is relatively easily reproduces by commenting out the sleep(1) in _delete_container() and even changing the 10 tries to just one.  Then go ahead and try to delete a container with a bunch of objects in it.  ON my slow home connection it only takes a single object in the container and it hangs almost every time."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-08-16 01:57:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-15 03:06:54.000000000', 'message': 'No log handler is set for middleware.auth_token

run run_tests.sh without argument, it will get following warning:
No handlers could be found for logger "keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token"

In class AuthProtocol, there is no handler configured for self.LOG.
add logging.basicConfig() to do basic configuration for logging,
including handler.

After the handler is set, the warning info are exposed, they can be resolved
if necessary.

Fixes Bug #1212472

Change-Id: Ib996c40d3d29f6f0d6e5dbe822f46e90902cb2d4
'}]
commit_message:
No log handler is set for middleware.auth_token

run run_tests.sh without argument, it will get following warning:
No handlers could be found for logger "keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token"

In class AuthProtocol, there is no handler configured for self.LOG.
add logging.basicConfig() to do basic configuration for logging,
including handler.

After the handler is set, the warning info are exposed, they can be resolved
if necessary.

Fixes Bug #1212472

Change-Id: Ib996c40d3d29f6f0d6e5dbe822f46e90902cb2d4

Fix for bug#1208974

commit_message:
Store the generated signed urls in resource_data

This is so it does get regenerated everytime GetRefId() is called.

fixes bug 1206505
Change-Id: Ia69d6d65247555918850ecaadfd1c5d1bc837af8

subject: Remove "lazy=joined" from the resource_data backref

commit_message:
Remove "lazy=joined" from the resource_data backref

This is having some weird interaction with the rsrc_metadata column.
In a later patch I add a call to resource_data_set() in signal_responder
and the metadata tests start failing.

Change-Id: Ib59972fe69570f4ae36e672987419f4841a2de40

commit_message:
Implement Fn::MemberListToMap

This is to allow the CloudWatch::Alarm to be implemented as
a resource template. The Dimensions need to be converted
from [{Name: bla, Value: foo}] into a normal dict.

So we define the Dimensions as a CommaDelimitedList in the template,
then in TemplateResource we see that the property is a list of dicts
and convert it into the aws style memberlist
 '.member.0.Name=bla,.member.0.Value=green'
then in the CW template we can do the following:

matching_metadata:
  "Fn::MemberListToMap": [Name, Value, {"Fn::   Split": [",",
{Ref: Dimensions}]}]

Note: this in not a single case usage as we can use this for the Tags
property that is in a lot of other resources.

Change-Id: I68910c51eaeb0857531028e87b89b9192db4c8ba

subject: Handle InstanceInvalidState of soft_delete

"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-08-02 00:09:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Do not merge

I don't understand the justification for this. Why should soft_delete be allowed if the instance never started? The point of a soft_delete is to allow the instance to be recovered later, but if it never started, that should be equivalent to starting a new one from the same image.

I think further justification is needed for this, but I suspect it's a misinterpretation of what soft_delete is."}, {'account_id': 2069, 'date': '2013-08-02 13:18:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi Dan,

Thanks for your review. As you said, soft_delete is to allow the instance to be recovered later. But it not provied in nova-api, but in the form of nova configuration. As long as we set reclaim_instance_interval a non-zero value in nova.conf, all 'delete' actions issued to nova-api are 'soft-delete'. Instances could be recoverd, force-deleted or reclaimed later. 

So the logic of this patch is: some instances may fail on initial build, thus they are instances which has never been active. If we don't allow soft_delete such instances(when reclaim_instance_interval is set non-zero in nova.conf), they cannot be deleted in any way."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-08-02 18:52:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

The problem makes sense, but I don't think this is the way to solve it. Shouldn't we make the api not call soft delete if the instance has never been started, even if configured with a reclaim interval?"}, {'account_id': 2069, 'date': '2013-08-03 16:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2069, 'date': '2013-08-03 17:03:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Thanks Dan for your suggestion. I refactor the patch to add a 'try-catch' when call soft_delete, thus such instances would not get into the 'soft-deleted' status which would introduce confusion. A delete() call is issued instead in this situation to clean up the instance. Would you please have a review on it?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-03 17:44:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

commit_message:
Handle InstanceInvalidState of soft_delete

Since commit 99c51e34230394cadf0b82e364ea10c38e193979, instance
is not able to be soft_deleted if instance has never been active.
But there are circumstances when instance fails on initial build.
Thus if we set reclaim_instance_interval in nova.conf, we cannot
delete such instances in any way.

This patch fixes this by handling InstanceInvalidState exception
when try to soft_delete instance. The delete() function is called
for instance which has never been active.

Bug 1202158

Change-Id: I7d0d9414d7436e56b6a3e5861ee3c2f02473df2b

[{'created': '2013-08-08 16:25:20.000000000', 'message': "xenapi: refactor - extract get_virtual_size

This change extracts a function get_virtual_size. This is needed,
because we would like to support tar.gz files, in which case the image's
virtual size will be determined by looking at the tar.gz stream. The
first tarinfo will tell us the size.

related to blueprint xenapi-supported-image-import-export

Change-Id: If34bb8849ad2dacf471f1bec5e72a37ddda79464
"}]
commit_message:
xenapi: refactor - extract get_virtual_size

This change extracts a function get_virtual_size. This is needed,
because we would like to support tar.gz files, in which case the image's
virtual size will be determined by looking at the tar.gz stream. The
first tarinfo will tell us the size.

related to blueprint xenapi-supported-image-import-export

Change-Id: If34bb8849ad2dacf471f1bec5e72a37ddda79464

Thanks Yufang, and for your review Zhi Yan. I think it makes sense to go ahead and land this fix and then separately track any enhancements to code reuse in glance-replicator. Honestly, putting a lot of work into glance replicator architecture might not make a ton of sense in the near term, so its nice to land this simple fix now.'}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-08-21 01:28:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
glance-replicator: enable logging exceptions into log file

bug 1213779

Currently, glance-replicator provides option to enable logging
information into a specified file. But exceptions are not logged
into the log file when they are thrown.

Reproduce steps:

When setting a wrong source or target address, exceptions would be
thrown, but not logged into log file.

Change-Id: Ic2c59e04aa6099f3ede0c6b8579c31a3dfff895c

[{'created': '2013-08-23 03:17:03.000000000', 'message': "Add netaddr to test-requirements

Because of the way we do old keystoneclient tests we depend on
keystoneclient without actually installing it. Therefore we need to have
keystoneclient's requirements met in our test-requirements.

Fixes: bug 1212939
Change-Id: I25eca24c6820611a5937a1f709ba42620b70b304
"}]
commit_message:
Add netaddr to test-requirements

Because of the way we do old keystoneclient tests we depend on
keystoneclient without actually installing it. Therefore we need to have
keystoneclient's requirements met in our test-requirements.

Fixes: bug 1212939
Change-Id: I25eca24c6820611a5937a1f709ba42620b70b304

commit_message:
Fix bug by passing correct number of arguments

* nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py:
  (LibvirtDriver.attach_interface,
   LibvirtDriver.detach_interface): Pass correct number of arguments.

* nova/tests/virt/test_virt_drivers.py:
  (_VirtDriverTestCase.test_attach_detach_interface): New test.

* nova/compute/manager.py,
  nova/virt/fake.py:
  (ComputeManager.attach_interface, ComputeManager.detach_interface,
   FakeDriver.attach_interface, FakeDriver.detach_interface):
    Update to use nova.network.model instead of legacy
    "network, mapping" tuple.

Partly implement blueprint nova-network-legacy
Closes-Bug: 1210203
Change-Id: Ic50eed9aaebdfc833a89e8c9574a2772574a8154

subject: Limit maximum size of all templates
messages:
[{'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-08-21 23:10:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

something of a question."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-08-22 00:23:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The REST API allows templates to be specified as part of the json create body, giving the user a way of circumventing this check (see heat/api/openstack/v1/stacks.py#90)

Maybe that is a separate concern - let me know what you think."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-08-22 05:04:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-08-22 05:08:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Steve I didn't realize that, but now I see it. We will have to limit the size of the whole JSON body, as I did in my previous patch. I'll ponder on whether or not we should use the same parameter or a different one."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-08-22 05:17:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-08-22 05:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ok so thinking more about it, and I think that the body-embedded JSON template is less of a concern than the template that needs parsing. In my tests, json.loads() is 13x faster than yaml.load() with Loader=CSafeLoader, and uses almost 3x less RAM. We still need to limit the body size just for general defensiveness. However, I feel like that is a separate bug, and would also be mitigated by per-stack and per-tenant resource limits.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-08-22 07:24:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

sounds like the best approach'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-22 11:44:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Limit maximum size of all templates

Templates of an extremely large size can eat up tons of CPU time,
memory and storage. By refusing to parse any template over a certain
size, we can prevent users from abusing the service.

Fixes bug #1214234

Change-Id: I2f731c8e2fc9e1f497199e310de81fa48c9582af

Your patch use utils.create_volume() instead which is not identical/much less flexible compared to this local helper function, therefore you have to do quite amount of db.volume_update()."}, {'account_id': 7331, 'date': '2013-08-21 09:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7331, 'date': '2013-08-21 09:13:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6509, 'date': '2013-08-21 10:05:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Huang,

What's the point having a local implementation of create_volume with almost the same name which does slightly different things?

There are a number of similar methods in cinder tests also:

 - db/test_transfers.py
 - api/contrib/test_backups.py 
 - test_gpfs.py
 - test_volume_transfer.py

and maybe some other.

I think it would make sense to avoid duplication of this code and make utils.create_volume flexible enough. Probably making it accepting kwargs and having reasonable default values would do the job."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-21 10:08:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

commit_message:
Refactor cinder/tests/test_volume.py

Refactor test_volume.py to remove code duplication.
- remove iterant definition of the 'expected' dict from
'test_create_delete_volume' and 'test_create_delete_snapshot'
method;
- move 'test_copy_volume_to_image_status_available',
'test_copy_volume_to_image_status_use' and
'test_copy_volume_to_image_exception' methods to new class
 CopyVolumeToImageTestCase;
- move 'test_volume_get_active_by_window' and
'test_snapshot_get_active_by_window' to new class
GetActiveByWindowTestCase;
- create base class BaseVolumeTestCase for TestCase classes.
bp cinder-tests-improvement

Change-Id: I5d3644375d321e613418ea8e544557d33401ff77

commit_message:
Allow configure the number of http retries

Allow setting the maximum number of times we want to retry to
http_connect when communicating with the Identity service.

Closes-Bug: 1209194
Change-Id: I56bff55dc808a1188d42f1643a8018a8d49012c6

commit_message:
Migrating ec2 credentials to credential.

Merging ec2 credentials into the credentials
table to simplify management of ec2
credentials.

blueprint migrate-ec2-credentials

Change-Id: I8f83c007a44857ca41d7ef23f70cb9718d83ca5d

commit_message:
Stub out more net API methods floating IP DNS test

Otherwise e.g. create_public_dns_domain() fails if we time out call()s
in the fake RPC driver when there are no consumers for a topic.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I44455fa23c4b0e4026414d74379361de0576cbeb

[{'created': '2013-08-16 22:14:18.000000000', 'message': "Enable CastAsCall for test_api_samples

Like the EC2 tests, the API sample tests are pretty much full-on
integration tests.

However, unlike the EC2 tests, the API tests currently don't use
CastAsCall. Without CastAsCall enabled, it seems that a bunch of issues
are masked simply because the test exits before some RPC casts ever get
executed.

The previous commits fix the cases where CastAsCall causes a failure.
This commit just enables it. Hopefully, it will ensure issues don't get
masked in future.

commit_message:
Enable CastAsCall for test_api_samples

Like the EC2 tests, the API sample tests are pretty much full-on
integration tests.

However, unlike the EC2 tests, the API tests currently don't use
CastAsCall. Without CastAsCall enabled, it seems that a bunch of issues
are masked simply because the test exits before some RPC casts ever get
executed.

The previous commits fix the cases where CastAsCall causes a failure.
This commit just enables it. Hopefully, it will ensure issues don't get
masked in future.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ib01797cec76c7cb3298808636e1b27fec4175594

subject: Stub out attach_volume() in test_api_samples

commit_message:
Stub out attach_volume() in test_api_samples

If you enable CastToCall, the attach_volume_to_server() test fails when
it attempts to connect to cinder (i.e. initialize_connection()).

Best thing is to just stub out the attach_volume() call.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I75f4e3fd1ecd0635867c167872a8eb7606cf295e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 22:14:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix remove_fixed_ip test with CastAsCall

If you enable CastAsCall, a bunch of issues with the remove_fixed_ip
API sample integration test crops up.

Firstly, the sample network is getting created with 'fake-mini' from
CONF.host as the network host rather than the host UUID generated for
the network service in start_service(). This results in
allocate_fixed_ip() attempting to invoke an RPC on a non-existant host.

Secondly, the test is attempting to remove a fixed IP which was never
allocated. Use the add_fixed_ip() test to allocate a fixed IP and then
remove that one, which is 10.0.0.3 rather than 10.0.0.2 which is the
IP reserved for VPN.

Lastly, disable the instance DNS manager because it seems this isn't
compatible with multinic. I was getting FloatingIpDNSExists raised.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Related-Bug: #1213251
Change-Id: I9854863bbec8834c638c55832411f63da570f82d

commit_message:
Fix remove_fixed_ip test with CastAsCall

If you enable CastAsCall, a bunch of issues with the remove_fixed_ip
API sample integration test crops up.

Firstly, the sample network is getting created with 'fake-mini' from
CONF.host as the network host rather than the host UUID generated for
the network service in start_service(). This results in
allocate_fixed_ip() attempting to invoke an RPC on a non-existant host.

Secondly, the test is attempting to remove a fixed IP which was never
allocated. Use the add_fixed_ip() test to allocate a fixed IP and then
remove that one, which is 10.0.0.3 rather than 10.0.0.2 which is the
IP reserved for VPN.

Lastly, disable the instance DNS manager because it seems this isn't
compatible with multinic. I was getting FloatingIpDNSExists raised.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Related-Bug: #1213251
Change-Id: I9854863bbec8834c638c55832411f63da570f82d

commit_message:
Remove trivial cases of unused variables

Removes trivial cases of unused variables from V3 API version of
servers.py. This was applied to the V2 API but not the V3 API
in commit 9f7eaca80d259201844f097fec24d1e9fe9fb5e3.

Change-Id: I42c1eb73a502afb61bf9c2dd81b79266e0966b5f

commit_message:
Allow name argument to flavor-access-add

Administrator cannot use the flavor name in arguments of
"nova flavor-access-add" and "nova flavor-access-remove"
in following conditions.

1. The flavor is non-public.
2. The falvor doesn't belong administrator's tenant.

This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Ic5e3222d0ff62667e003a61e6a94e85833da5d11
Fixes: bug #1205298

commit_message:
Allow volume create from source unless in error status

This patch restores the source volume status checking behavior
to allow create_volume function to proceed unless it is in
error status. In FibreChannel attached environment, it is typical
to have a volume attached before the volume clone starts. The
operating system owns the volume will ensure the consistency.

Fixes: bug #1214235
Change-Id: Ie639f2f36e2939399303ca0658c169124801e86b

commit_message:
Remove duplicate variable _host_state

* The variable _host_state is initialized twice in __init__() method of libvirt driver.
This patch removes the second occurrence.

Fixes bug #1214431

Change-Id: I13f175abcbce7752afb0d8c69ee209928afa1eb3

commit_message:
Make the API for getting dependency graph edges public

This will allow us to build new dependency graphs from combinations of
existing graphs.

Change-Id: I6da62607fa1e361d4d2e1581fd286c62f0d9470a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 13:04:50.000000000', 'message': 'Pass the previous stack to StackUpdate

This starts out like the existing stack, but is not stored in the database
or updated as the stack update proceeds. This allows the StackUpdate object
to store any information that might be relevant to a future rollback.

Change-Id: I94f0dd69b5e7818f811c8c0d50566a79b81acba7
'}]
commit_message:
Pass the previous stack to StackUpdate

This starts out like the existing stack, but is not stored in the database
or updated as the stack update proceeds. This allows the StackUpdate object
to store any information that might be relevant to a future rollback.

'}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2013-08-08 16:47:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Backup drivers shouldn't assume the volume_file they're given is a real file - it's just a python I/O object. If you can't backup to TSM without a local file, you could check if the volume_file has a realpath attribute, and use it if it has one, otherwise use the standard python file-like object read operations to save the device contents to a local file."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2013-08-08 21:01:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(9 inline comments)

Had a number of comments.  I also think that the new configuration options you are adding need to be added to etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample with some explanation as to what the options mean and what the default settings are."}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2013-08-09 04:16:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Backup driver for IBM Tivoli Storage manager (TSM)

An implementation of Cinder backup driver using TSM as a backend for
Cinder backups. The driver is a wrapper for the TSM command line
utility dsmc, and uses TSM image backup and restore.

Re-added make_dev_path from cinder/utils.py which was removed by commit
d65425453d215ad64e2bf31b66a3b613c6e7f879

Change-Id: Id105c91ffd3ca953a9fc67dc13f31c3b885bccd7

subject: Add root_helper param to get_connector_properties

[{'created': '2013-08-16 15:19:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add root_helper param to get_connector_properties

This patch adds the ability to pass in a custom
root_helper for executing commands.  This is needed
for other projects that need a custom root-wrapper,
such as nova.

fixes Bug #1213135

Change-Id: Ie18276ae2e736bb2276d4e9c57385d2588441428
'}]
commit_message:
Add root_helper param to get_connector_properties

This patch adds the ability to pass in a custom
root_helper for executing commands.  This is needed
for other projects that need a custom root-wrapper,
such as nova.

fixes Bug #1213135

Change-Id: Ie18276ae2e736bb2276d4e9c57385d2588441428

commit_message:
option to use UUID keystone tokens instead of PKI

allows devs to use short UUID tokens instead of long PKI tokens
fixes bug #1213250

Change-Id: Ic6869231f494ec79b0e432845ec7ca0b670fe059

commit_message:
Implement hard reboot for powervm driver

Implements the OS reboot API in the powervm driver. Soft reboot is not
supported as it requires additional configuration on the LPAR when it's
spawned so this patch simply performs an immediate hard reboot.

Also adds tests for start_lpar and stop_lpar which didn't exist before.

Closes-Bug: #1205089

Change-Id: Iad64dda79f46d18c7aa5bee12ed41e7a01853d34

Rule parser for property protections

This patch introduces the way protected properties
will be configured and parsed.

Related to api-v2-property-protection

The test still imports netaddr, so it should likely be updated and netaddr removed from requirements I guess."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-08-20 20:58:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Make dependency on netaddr optional

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/38023/ pointed out that
the dependency on netaddr is unnecessary and can be avoided.
Use try_import to avoid a hard dependency on netaddr.

Change-Id: I8b246f20f9001379fcb5ca3a84aabee3847cb945

[{'created': '2013-08-21 14:17:01.000000000', 'message': 'ceilometer-agent-compute did not catch exception for disk error

When get instance disk info, ceilometer-agent-compute did not
catch exception if failed to get disk info caused by libvirt
error.

The fix was enable the exception handling for such case.

Fix bug 1209509

Change-Id: Ibcdcf3a7490a60b654f09e8aba487200e0c1d8fa
'}]
commit_message:
ceilometer-agent-compute did not catch exception for disk error

When get instance disk info, ceilometer-agent-compute did not
catch exception if failed to get disk info caused by libvirt
error.

The fix was enable the exception handling for such case.

Fix bug 1209509

Change-Id: Ibcdcf3a7490a60b654f09e8aba487200e0c1d8fa

This change extracts the get_stream_funct_for function. As we would like
to support tar.gz compressed raw images, the stream function for them
should be different from the plain ones.

related to blueprint xenapi-supported-image-import-export

Change-Id: I27681da069ba2cd23670ef41f54ed9ac5af31ae6
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: refactor - extract get_stream_funct_for

This change extracts the get_stream_funct_for function. As we would like
to support tar.gz compressed raw images, the stream function for them
should be different from the plain ones.

related to blueprint xenapi-supported-image-import-export

Change-Id: I27681da069ba2cd23670ef41f54ed9ac5af31ae6

Thx! 
fast-post should be good if you're updating quite large objects"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-08-01 09:19:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

more reasonable!

I think we could abandon https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39410/ and merge this in a new patch set. It's not meaningful to leave that codes in repo ..."}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-08-13 03:41:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Can somebody explain more about what fast-POST is?

Do I understand the code changes to mean that the DiskFile class is where the disallowed headers for metadata are defined, and that it cannot be overridden by the configuration file now, where as before it could?

Instead, the new code always ensures that those headers can never stored even if allowed in the configuration file.  Correct?

So if there are objects with this data already, do we have any issues with properly handling existing data?  We should document that those headers we now be ignored if specified, and possibly log that fact on server start-up at the INFO level?"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-08-16 02:15:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

fast-POST is when you update the .meta file (instead of translate POST to COPY)

If you're running object_post_as_copy = true (default) - I don't think this change has any real impact to your cluster (that's probably why I missed it in the first diskfile refactor).

    Set object_post_as_copy = false to turn on fast posts where only the metadata changes are stored anew and the original data file is kept in place. This makes for quicker posts; but since the container metadata isn’t updated in this mode, features like container sync won’t be able to sync posts.

If you *are* running with fast-POST then this puts the guard in the diskfile module where it belongs so auditors and such get a consistent view of the object even without the proxy passing the DISALLOWED_HEADERS when it creates the object.

However diskfile is going to decide which meta keys in the data file could have been potentially deleted by a subsequent POST update to the meta file it should be the same regardless of who creates the object."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-08-20 21:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-20 23:50:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

So, I think this makes sense and it makes explicit (i hope) what is going on.  I was hoping to not have those headers in diskfile but I don't think there's a way to get around it with the state of things. Implementers of a diskfile replacement will have to worry about these headers but atleast its a little more obvious what to do and kinda why."}, {'account_id': 995, 'date': '2013-08-21 21:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-31 10:14:22.000000000', 'message': "move fast-post meta key filtering to obj.diskfile

The object-server 'allowed_headers' attribute is defined by config, but
limited by the metadata keys that should not be updated via fast POST.  Since
the diskfile class manages the merging of data_file and meta_file keys it
is the defacto Single Source of Truth for which metadata keys should NOT be
allowed to update via fast-POST.

Because fast-POST if not commonly used anymore, I tried to be very specific
about the role of the constant by renaming it from DISALLOWED_HEADERS
(presumably meaning headers that should not be passed into write_metadata) to
DISALLOWED_META_FILE_UPDATE_KEYS (meaning metadata that should not be passed
into the method that updates the meta_file).

Change-Id: I4bdfc1e4813a1d27fe726ba83481c6e7194aab7f
"}, {'created': '2013-07-31 10:25:19.000000000', 'message': "move fast-post meta key filtering to obj.diskfile

The object-server 'allowed_headers' attribute is defined by config, but
limited by the metadata keys that should not be updated via fast POST.  Since
the diskfile class manages the merging of data_file and meta_file keys it
is the defacto Single Source of Truth for which metadata keys should NOT be
allowed to update via fast-POST.

Because fast-POST if not commonly used anymore, I tried to be very specific
about the role of the constant by renaming it from DISALLOWED_HEADERS
(presumably meaning headers that should not be passed into write_metadata) to
DISALLOWED_META_FILE_UPDATE_KEYS (meaning metadata that should not be passed
into the method that updates the meta_file).

Change-Id: I4bdfc1e4813a1d27fe726ba83481c6e7194aab7f
"}, {'created': '2013-08-20 21:29:21.000000000', 'message': "move fast-post meta key filtering to obj.diskfile

The object-server 'allowed_headers' attribute is defined by config, but
limited by the metadata keys that should not be updated via fast POST.  Since
the diskfile class manages the merging of data_file and meta_file keys it
is the defacto Single Source of Truth for which metadata keys should NOT be
allowed to update via fast-POST.

Because fast-POST if not commonly used anymore, I tried to be very specific
about the role of the constant by renaming it from DISALLOWED_HEADERS
(presumably meaning headers that should not be passed into write_metadata) to
DISALLOWED_META_FILE_UPDATE_KEYS (meaning metadata that should not be passed
into the method that updates the meta_file).

Fixes: bug #1214607

Change-Id: I4bdfc1e4813a1d27fe726ba83481c6e7194aab7f
"}, {'created': '2013-08-21 21:27:47.000000000', 'message': "move fast-post meta key filtering to obj.diskfile

The object-server 'allowed_headers' attribute is defined by config, but
limited by the metadata keys that should not be updated via fast POST.  Since
the diskfile class manages the merging of data_file and meta_file keys it
is the defacto Single Source of Truth for which metadata keys should NOT be
allowed to update via fast-POST.

Because fast-POST if not commonly used anymore, I tried to be very specific
about the role of the constant by renaming it from DISALLOWED_HEADERS
(presumably meaning headers that should not be passed into write_metadata) to
DISALLOWED_META_FILE_UPDATE_KEYS (meaning metadata that should not be passed
into the method that updates the meta_file).

Fixes: bug #1214607

Change-Id: I4bdfc1e4813a1d27fe726ba83481c6e7194aab7f
"}, {'created': '2013-08-21 22:18:44.000000000', 'message': 'change .data vrs .meta file metadata filtering in obj.diskfile

Add DATAFILE_SYSTEM_META to diskfile.py which is a set of
system-set metadata keys that cannot be changed with a POST.

Fixes: bug #1214607

Change-Id: I4bdfc1e4813a1d27fe726ba83481c6e7194aab7f
'}]
commit_message:
change .data vrs .meta file metadata filtering in obj.diskfile

Add DATAFILE_SYSTEM_META to diskfile.py which is a set of
system-set metadata keys that cannot be changed with a POST.

Fixes: bug #1214607

Change-Id: I4bdfc1e4813a1d27fe726ba83481c6e7194aab7f

(1 inline comment)

To follow up from our IRC conversation, you should talk with Dragon about his trigger work. 

I think the dispatchers should just have a process_notification() call and the EventDispatcher would do all the Event fabrication in there. But this may cause havock with Dragon's stuff. I'm sure a middle ground can be found. Dragon may have to move his call to the trigger pipeline into the EventDispatcher perhaps?"}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2013-08-09 20:06:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

Hmm... for the event pipeline work, I'd be moving the notification-> event conversion to near the beginning of the process. Moving that conversion into the dispatcher wouldn't work, as it's the wrong end of the process.  If it was still in the dispatcher, then the event pipeline would have to be in the dispatcher, in a different place from all the other pipeline code."}, {'account_id': 8052, 'date': '2013-08-09 20:22:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-09 20:30:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-08-20 18:01:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This implementation fixes the bug with a high impact approach,
it introduced a new interface, record_events on dispatchers,
and also forces two entries to the same dispatch. For example,
a dispatcher will get called on record_metering_data method
and also get called on record_events, to solve the problem
described in bug #1204520, as I have suggested awhile back,
a new dispatcher just need to be implemented, the new
dispatcher just need to take the raw data passed in, do
whatever is necessary, such as wrap the raw data as event,
do further process. It is really not necessary to have this
type of implementation which impacts every meter. I think
this is really a design issue, coding wise it looks ok."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-08-21 08:55:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Storing events via dispatchers

Removes the database handle from CollectorService and
moves the logic for storing events to Dispatcher classes.

Change-Id: I22cf02685e3a33a9014d65d8d32a5b585dabe185
Fixes: bug #1204520

commit_message:
Make the length of a line logged configurable

Failed calls to rysnc can
  result in very long log lines.

These lines are
  mostly made up
of file paths and are
  not always useful.

This change will
  allow for reducing the
length of these
  lines logged if desired.

Change-Id: I9a28f19eadc07757da9d42b0d7be1ed82170d732

I think it'll play nicely with that change. This one makes it so the proxy doesn't do any conditional-request stuff, but just passes through whatever the object server does. That change will make the object server's response to HEAD requests better (among other things).

The net result is still that the object server checks etag, range, etc. and the proxy just passes through the object server's response, which is what should happen."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-08-21 21:28:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-07 23:07:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix range GET w/If-None-Match.

An object GET request with both If-None-Match: <Etag> and
Range: bytes=N-M should result in a 304 Not Modified if the Etag
matches. However, it was resulting in a 416 Requested Range Not
Satisfiable. This commit fixes that.

The fix was to remove conditional_response=True from a request in the
proxy. As far as I can see, the only effect that
conditional_response=True has in swob is to enable range
checking. Since the object server handles all the range stuff, the
proxy shouldn't do it. Otherwise, you wind up with double-application
of the Range header, and that doesn't work very well.

This is probably left over from the WebOb days.

Fixes bug #1196805.

Change-Id: I207f3839731b7503baa3fdbd7cd1cfe3e1b46f62
"}]
commit_message:
Fix range GET w/If-None-Match.

An object GET request with both If-None-Match: <Etag> and
Range: bytes=N-M should result in a 304 Not Modified if the Etag
matches. However, it was resulting in a 416 Requested Range Not
Satisfiable. This commit fixes that.

The fix was to remove conditional_response=True from a request in the
proxy. As far as I can see, the only effect that
conditional_response=True has in swob is to enable range
checking. Since the object server handles all the range stuff, the
proxy shouldn't do it. Otherwise, you wind up with double-application
of the Range header, and that doesn't work very well.

This is probably left over from the WebOb days.

Fixes bug #1196805.

Change-Id: I207f3839731b7503baa3fdbd7cd1cfe3e1b46f62

'}, {'account_id': 6534, 'date': '2013-08-01 22:40:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I still think the text is a bit ambiguous. Specifically
1. "Fetch the trusted CA certificate"
If there is a certificate chain then there are several trusted CAs - each CA in the train is trusted, so which one do you want to be fetched? Suggest change the text to
"Fetch the certificate chain up to the trusted root CA certificate" or
"Fetch the certificate chain up to the trust anchor CA certificate"

2. "exports a CA certificate"
this is no longer true. Should be changed to "exports a certificate chain"'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-08-02 02:43:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Technically, it is A CA certificate.  The certificate is what is used to validate the signing cert.  As such, it does not really need to be the whole certificate chain: it will be used as the one and only CA cert.'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-08-02 04:59:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We need an equivalent to v2/tokens/revoked as well."}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-08-02 04:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Other than that +1'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-08-02 18:40:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

The core API shouldn't dictate endpoints that are not required, and all of these calls are completely proprietary to PKI tokens. Propose as /OS-PKI/ ?"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-08-02 21:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-02 21:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/05/39405/7/check/gate-noop/8d53b76 : SUCCESS in 1s
'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-08-02 21:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-02 21:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/05/39405/8/check/gate-noop/b487db3 : SUCCESS in 0s
'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-08-02 21:20:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: (2 inline comments)

I'll do revoked token list in a separate review.  I think that there is a difference between publishing x509s which are a standard document, and token revocation lists, which are custom to Keystone.

I think, though, that there are now core API items, not optional endpoints.  PKI tokens are the default mechanism, and, as such, the APIs to support them should be in the core api."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-08-02 21:24:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-02 21:24:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/05/39405/9/check/gate-noop/7e7a6ac : SUCCESS in 2s
'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-08-03 00:01:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: (1 inline comment)

Also i kind of like dolph's suggestion of putting this into an extension."}, {'account_id': 6534, 'date': '2013-08-05 16:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

You said "Technically, it is A CA certificate. The certificate is what is used to validate the signing cert. As such, it does not really need to be the whole certificate chain: it will be used as the one and only CA cert."

Unless I have misunderstood you, you have not solved the problem of trusting a signed message. The problem with your single CA solution is as follows:
1. The client gets a message signed by (Dunno Who)
2. The client requests the CA certificate that issued Dunno Who's certificate
3. The client is returned the Dunno Who CA certificate
4. The client is no better off.
5. The client needs a certificate chain up to a CA whose public key is stored in its trusted repository of trusted root CAs. Anything else is pointless as it cannot validate any of the certificates it recieves'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-08-05 18:59:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

my concerns above haven't been addressed -- there's no way this should be a core api"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-08-06 14:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

If this is not a core API we will have a non-functioning Keystone.  

Specifically, we will have auth_token middleware with no way to fetch certificates in order to validate the tokens they are receiving.  Yes, it will be possible to validate tokens by manually managing certificates, but there will be no standard and automated way to do this.  THe result will be many broken systems.

X509 does not have a standard way to distribute certificates, and it is one of the shortcomings of the standard.  This API fills in the gap for the Keystone project in the simplest manner possible.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-08-06 16:46:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Dolph. Is that a common understanding that OpenStack-based cloud providers are *obligated* to support Core APIs, and *optionally* support any extensions? And we've always maintained that PKI tokens is an optional feature. For those reasons, it make sense to stash them into extensions."}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-08-08 00:10:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

If it's not core then we currently have a non-functioning distribution mechanism for PKI tokens.

I think the ability to manage the CA and signing certificates outside of keystone is something i'd be promoting if you have a secure orchestration system already. There are already a number of flaws here like if a certificate expires it won't be refetched. Not to mention the security issues of distributing the CA cert from within keystone.

If we turn this into the OS-SIMPLEPKI then we have a stop gap measure for retrieving certificates from a V3 API which can be improved upon later or completely disabled if you have a better distribution mechanism in place."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-15 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-15 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-08-22 22:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

restore & revise?'}]

commit_message:
Configuration Reference additions.

Moves some items to ops guide, one item to install, updates the
pom.xml, ensures validation, removes whitespace.

Moves all configuration info in Block Storage Admin Guide to Config Ref.

Removes duplicated content from Compute Admin Guide to Config Ref.

Change-Id: I0a7fb144241be7acf7c9063e5290220b5d7b7192

commit_message:
Add add_aggregate_to_host() to FakeDriver

AggregatesSampleJsonTest.test_add_host fails if you enable CastToCall on
test_api_samples because FakeDriver doesn't have stub implementations
of add_aggregate_to_host() or remove_aggregate_from_host().

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I6089e174fc12222bd823ab59adf246190346a401

commit_message:
Allow use of oslo.messaging 1.2.0a10

Since a9, a single small API addition for a performance improvement.

Change-Id: I4ec75ba61dbb7483bd528c1bbc517f62ac8ec6d6

commit_message:
Fix python 3 pep8 errors for print

The new auto-pulled requirements files exposed
python 3 compat issues in a number of modules.
We added these to tox.ini ignore temporarily,
this change updates the print routines in bin/cinder
and removes the debug cruft that was in the unit tests.

Will update requirements and test-requirements
appropriately in a follow up patch.

Change-Id: I76ea24f4dc1f61c4f8a1d202b0554c90daf2c9cc

commit_message:
Adds Support to Manage SSL

The keystone class provides UUID and PKI token formats, but does
not provide the ability to manage SSL.  This patch introduces the
enable_ssl parameter that allows users to enable and disable SSL.

Defaults to true for backwards compatibility and to enable SSL.

Based on the following master branch patch:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39205/

Had to address a cherry-pick conflict by adding a } to line 137

Change-Id: If11e3eccf145b5f87e6c8979f42665577e35b50b

commit_message:
Enable H302 check

This patch replaces some method imports with module imports and
makes H302 test enabled.

Fixes bug 1188531

Change-Id: Ibfbddeaa19cbbb244da58ffd5c918c41f03a0c65

commit_message:
Log exception details setting vm_state to error

This commit switches to LOG.exception() for exceptions that trigger
setting an instance into an error vm_state. Prior to this commit just
an error message was printed which provided no context for debugging
an actual failure. By switching to LOG.exception() instead of
LOG.error() a traceback will be printed to show where the exception
came from.

Fixes bug 1215068

Change-Id: If3aaf3d8ec61c3e902c299f3e5889dcafa144a9a

Don't use posixpath for URLs

Use URL functions instead.

Fixes bug #1208618

Change-Id: I27bb29a6422200a1a522c50335e5d93d495ec429

This commit fixes the Cisco plugin device connections issue where the plugin would drop
connections to the Nexus switches.

Change-Id: I9f09d22cb359b4fcdae5f5063a97011d82daf5a1
Fixes: Bug 1212834

commit_message:
Cisco plugin (grizzly) device connection errors

This commit fixes the Cisco plugin device connections issue where the plugin would drop
connections to the Nexus switches.

Change-Id: I9f09d22cb359b4fcdae5f5063a97011d82daf5a1
Fixes: Bug 1212834

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-20 19:05:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix IVS vif to correctly delete interfaces on unplug

The IVS unplug method was incorrectly calling the OVS
specific interface removal methods. This corrects it
to call the IVS removal methods.

Fixes: bug #1214532
Change-Id: Ie718e167d5bdcfae0d915ef85976aeeb3449ad18
'}]
commit_message:
Fix IVS vif to correctly delete interfaces on unplug

The IVS unplug method was incorrectly calling the OVS
specific interface removal methods. This corrects it
to call the IVS removal methods.

Fixes: bug #1214532
Change-Id: Ie718e167d5bdcfae0d915ef85976aeeb3449ad18

commit_message:
Fix api samples image service stub

If you enable CastAsCall with test_api_samples, test_post_backup_server
fails because the ImageService.detail() method returns None and you
get:

  TypeError: object of type 'NoneType' has no len()

Fix by returning an empty list.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I0cc413d6d428caebb1f67cbc701a36227dead567

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 22:14:09.000000000', 'message': "Add CastAsCall fixture

In Ia7f40718533e450f00cd3e7d753ac65755c70588 we made the EC2 integration
tests treat all RPC cast()s as call()s. The idea being that rather than
insert sleeps in the tests to ensure that a cast()ed operation is
completed before we continue, we instead just do the operation with
call() and thereby block until it is completed.

If we take a step back, the approach is questionable - if there's no way
for us to block on the completion of an async task in our unit tests,
what hope do users have?

But, it is a sweet little hack, and is better than sleeping in tests.

With oslo.messaging, it will be both harder to implement this hack and
seemingly needed more often. Encode the hack as a fixture so it can be
easily re-used.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I5f9e74f46e347594103484460e81da46835eeb7e

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I5f9e74f46e347594103484460e81da46835eeb7e
"}]
commit_message:
Add CastAsCall fixture

In Ia7f40718533e450f00cd3e7d753ac65755c70588 we made the EC2 integration
tests treat all RPC cast()s as call()s. The idea being that rather than
insert sleeps in the tests to ensure that a cast()ed operation is
completed before we continue, we instead just do the operation with
call() and thereby block until it is completed.

If we take a step back, the approach is questionable - if there's no way
for us to block on the completion of an async task in our unit tests,
what hope do users have?

But, it is a sweet little hack, and is better than sleeping in tests.

With oslo.messaging, it will be both harder to implement this hack and
seemingly needed more often. Encode the hack as a fixture so it can be
easily re-used.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I5f9e74f46e347594103484460e81da46835eeb7e

commit_message:
Enable consoleauth service during ec2 tests

Otherwise delete_tokens_for_instance() fails if we time out calls()
in the fake RPC driver when there are no consumers for a topic.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Id27f20144bc3dc273d72b2dad59c94bddd61f03f

commit_message:
Disable periodic tasks during integration tests

While debugging various test failures, I was confused several times by
weirdness caused by periodic tasks running during the tests.

It doesn't seem to make much sense to allow this to happen, even if it
doesn't appear to affect the tests.

Change-Id: I75d34b5ee2bf76b64ae8ba108d9c78b741ce4574

commit_message:
Use ExceptionHelper to bypass @client_exceptions

Rather than stubbing out catch_client_exception() to bypass the wrapping
of exceptions in ClientException, use the existing ExceptionHelper to do
it.

This is import for oslo.messaging, because there's no public API method
for us to stub out.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I32c83ef15fece35526739c4fcdfccf7a275c7033

I won't have time to start with until Wednesday, so feel free to continue working on this. The next step could be to modify the prototype of all get_meter_statistics() functions to accept this group_by parameter, raising NotImplementedError in the first place.

We'll then implement in each driver. :)"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-08-13 10:48:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add SQLAlchemy implementation of groupby

Implements: blueprint api-group-by

New class StatisticsGroupByTest contains the storage tests for group by
statistics and has its own test data

The storage tests check group by statistics for
 1) single field, "user-id"
 2) single field, "resource-id"
 3) single field, "project-id"
 4) single field, "source"
 5) single metadata field (not yet implemented)
 6) multiple fields
 7) multiple metadata fields (not yet implemented)
 8) multiple mixed fields, regular and metadata (not yet implemented)
 9) single field groupby with query filter
10) single metadata field groupby with query filter (not yet implemented)
11) multiple field group by with multiple query filters
12) multiple metadata field group by with multiple query filters
    (not yet implemented)
13) single field with period
14) single metadata field with period (not yet implemented)
15) single field with query filter and period
16) single metadata field with query filter and period (not yet implemented)

It also includes the implementation for the SQLAlchemy driver.

Change-Id: I902db657e424b9894c0382db4869b22317fc25da

commit_message:
Add missing content type and encoding business logic after MIME-type revamp.

The intial work on the MIME-type revamp addressed most of the content-type/encoding
and accept/accept-encoding work flows, but there were some flows that weren't addressed,
including some corner cases such as dealing with all the flavors of 'text/plain' that
clients can send to Barbican. This commit set also reorganizes some of the business
logic sections to enable better unit testing of this somewhat complicated workflow.

Change-Id: I091f33bfe1515a3faa13024536745d8fed68604a

commit_message:
Move tests back to neutronclient package

Neutron itself has all of its tests in neutron/tests, as do 2/3 of
the projects in OpenStack. There are a wealth of reasons to put
them in the package, not the least of which that tests/__init__.py
implies a code living in a global namespace called tests.

Change-Id: I2aaacfe59d6790648aa4587e89e6dd28a9149a6c

commit_message:
Merge duplicate repo description in one that can be shared

The repository setup is the same for all three nodes - and needs
updates for every release. So, let's have it only once in a common
section and reference it from other places.

I've also fixed markup of the shared part.

Change-Id: I5d2b96744a1bcfa9cb11f60c8bae5bd0ee076ede

* use filename consistently

commit_message:
chore: cleanup the unit tests with ddt

ddt stands for data-driven-tests, and it's also a Python module.
It adds the test data as a decorator to the test methods, so that
the test code can focus on each type of behaviors instead of using
`for` loops internally (on the other hand, you have to split big
tests which testing different types of behaviors into small tests).

Change-Id: I1cba67c15e9bb6e5e73e26a11e08fb1390a0504a
