Remove duplicate computescheduler chapters

Merge changes to computescheduler into
openstack-config/ch_computescheduler

openstack-compute-admin will now use the version from openstack-config.

commit_message:
Update requirements

This is the fabulous result of running the update.py script from
openstack/requirements with this repository as the target. It therefore
updates all dependencies, with nice version numbers that this repository
have to use to work. It also fixes case on some dependencies.
This update also brings a brand shiny new setup.py automatically handled
and generate by this same openstack/requirements repository.

Due to some changes somewhere, testr configuration has to be modified,
and I actually fixed and simplified a bit to make tests ran.

Change-Id: Ibbea49fbc98caa6a175e9174243ab66a753493f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 14:19:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix logic in add_host_to_aggregate()

Commit I788782a9f21ec2672551f75123753175bb268586 introduced some
changes into the add_host_to_aggregate() method to catch adding an
host to an availability zone when the host was already a member of
a different availability zone. However there were a couple of issues
with this change. There was no check that the availability_zone was
in the metadata grabbed from the database which would raise a
KeyError back to the api. Additionally, the check wouldn't always
work as expected because the database returned a set of availability
zones (including sometimes an empty set) so the check would fail in
some conditions when it was expected to pass.

This commit fixes the logic for checking if the host is already in an
availability zone. It also replaces the try/except block in the
aggregates extension to check up front if the action is valid instead
of waiting for a key error when it goes to use the action.

Fixes bug 1208627
Fixes bug 1208628

Change-Id: I81b79602e23e78c8b077d313e556796de1255bbf

commit_message:
Fix logic in add_host_to_aggregate()

Commit I788782a9f21ec2672551f75123753175bb268586 introduced some
changes into the add_host_to_aggregate() method to catch adding an
host to an availability zone when the host was already a member of
a different availability zone. However there were a couple of issues
with this change. There was no check that the availability_zone was
in the metadata grabbed from the database which would raise a
KeyError back to the api. Additionally, the check wouldn't always
work as expected because the database returned a set of availability
zones (including sometimes an empty set) so the check would fail in
some conditions when it was expected to pass.

This commit fixes the logic for checking if the host is already in an
availability zone. It also replaces the try/except block in the
aggregates extension to check up front if the action is valid instead
of waiting for a key error when it goes to use the action.

Fixes bug 1208627
Fixes bug 1208628

Change-Id: I81b79602e23e78c8b077d313e556796de1255bbf

commit_message:
Use new BDM syntax when determining boot metadata

This patch makes it possible to use new BDM syntax (if it was used in
the request when booting) to be used when determining where to get the
metadata from.

Since the new syntax has the boot_index field - it is easy to determine
which device is intended to be booted from.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Co-authored-by: Xavier Queralt <xqueralt@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If92c9df261880eb0dcf0fd0a81fd1ae7c688d201

commit_message:
Allow more than one ephemeral device in the DB

This patch changes the database api behaviour when creating/updating a
block device mapping to allow more than one ephemeral device instead of
overriding the old ones.

Part of blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I71c283cbd5ad3d28a27d06cb01b5ba9433f8ab46

commit_message:
Change datagrid field to work with units templates.

Now datagrid uses dcInstances value converted to units (though, still 2 hacks
are needed - to JSON-stringify input data and destringify output data). This seems
appropriate to be done, when we will throw away djblets package.

Datagrid uses data from another form as initial data (thus make useful MRN-831).

Also one change is made to unitTemplates data: every occurrence of '#' in strings
is replaced with current unit 1-based index, as in unitNamingPattern.

Change-Id: I283a67e437d1495257e4c39b18e558072875ffea

commit_message:
Update Tests for Input Validation

This patch updates the tests, to reflect the API changes in input
validation. This includes adding new data driven tests and removing some
tests that are better addressed unit tests.

Tests: bp input-validation
Tests: bug #1212389

Change-Id: I8e09541b8bfa1e23804e3d13490ff755646f2127

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-20 19:56:08.000000000', 'message': "Add plug-in mechanism to swift-init

While the plug-in layer for the Swift backend storage processes is being
finalized, intermediate efforts have generally supplanted the top level
executable scripts with custom implementations that will typically deviate
only slightly from the stock implementation.  This approach is both flexible
and effective; however, because it is not well defined it has a side effect of
being incompatible with swift-init.

The optional command line argument --plugin-command-prefix for swift-init will
make it possible for swift-init to manage alternative top level Swift server
executable scripts which are compatible with the stock Swift processes by
appending an alternative prefix to the name of launched script.

For example, if you install an alternative swift-object-replicator
implementation at 'mybackend-object-replicator' you can start the process from
the command line using swift-init's config and pid management with the
command:

    swift-init -p mybackend object-replicator start

Change-Id: I25210b9c3dc6541f2c59be8295c07e9bc21e3881
"}, {'created': '2013-08-20 23:15:47.000000000', 'message': "Add plug-in mechanism to swift-init

While the plug-in layer for the Swift backend storage processes is being
finalized, intermediate efforts have generally supplanted the top level
executable scripts with custom implementations that will typically deviate
only slightly from the stock implementation.  This approach is both flexible
and effective; however, because it is not well defined it has a side effect of
being incompatible with swift-init.

The optional command line argument --plugin-command-prefix for swift-init will
make it possible for swift-init to manage alternative top level Swift server
executable scripts which are compatible with the stock Swift processes by
appending an alternative prefix to the name of launched script.

For example, if you install an alternative swift-object-replicator
implementation at 'mybackend-object-replicator' you can start the process from
the command line using swift-init's config and pid management with the
command:

    swift-init -p mybackend object-replicator start

Change-Id: I25210b9c3dc6541f2c59be8295c07e9bc21e3881
"}]
commit_message:
Add plug-in mechanism to swift-init

While the plug-in layer for the Swift backend storage processes is being
finalized, intermediate efforts have generally supplanted the top level
executable scripts with custom implementations that will typically deviate
only slightly from the stock implementation.  This approach is both flexible
and effective; however, because it is not well defined it has a side effect of
being incompatible with swift-init.

The optional command line argument --plugin-command-prefix for swift-init will
make it possible for swift-init to manage alternative top level Swift server
executable scripts which are compatible with the stock Swift processes by
appending an alternative prefix to the name of launched script.

For example, if you install an alternative swift-object-replicator
implementation at 'mybackend-object-replicator' you can start the process from
the command line using swift-init's config and pid management with the
command:

    swift-init -p mybackend object-replicator start

Change-Id: I25210b9c3dc6541f2c59be8295c07e9bc21e3881

commit_message:
chore: remove unneeded statements in wsgi

1. Falcon response's status defaults to 200, no need to set it;
2. Message posting count checking is already covered by input
   validation.

Change-Id: I905dba8bb55e6a4254b2625bb9b71c51496fd2a8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 16:23:24.000000000', 'message': "Remove uwsgi requirement

Even though we use uWSGI as our WSGI server for barbican,
we don't have any code dependencies.  It is possible to run
barbican usin gnuicorn or any other WSGI server, so we won't
require uWSGI in the pip-requires file.

Change-Id: Ia0f53cfea18a9c6d8087247c5c58114523437d50
"}]
commit_message:
Remove uwsgi requirement

Even though we use uWSGI as our WSGI server for barbican,
we don't have any code dependencies.  It is possible to run
barbican usin gnuicorn or any other WSGI server, so we won't
require uWSGI in the pip-requires file.

Change-Id: Ia0f53cfea18a9c6d8087247c5c58114523437d50

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-08 11:36:46.000000000', 'message': 'API Nodes states

Expose in the API the states a baremetal node can be in (power state,
provision state and transition state) also expose an URI where the user

commit_message:
API Nodes states

Expose the power state and provision state of a baremetal node in the
API, each state is represented by a separate entity where clients can
GET/PUT value from/to it. A generic /state subresource is also exposed
allowing clients to GET all the current states of that node and links
to each one of the specific states.

Partially implements blueprint state-machine

Change-Id: I0dcea268718dc3bcb152880654631f9fd61295e7

'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-07-22 23:37:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I have a couple of questions:
 - what will happen if a current version of quantumclient is used (rather than one with support for the extension?).

 - what will happen if a branch of nova with this support in it is run in a cloud running an older Neutron (or a Quantum) ?

If they will silently degrade, I'm cool with this; if they will blow up, it will make rolling this out harder as it will need to be sequenced properly.

Ideally it would log a message to the logs and then degrade: so it would behave as it does today, but tell the admin that it couldn't use the new feature. 

But as I say, I'm happy if it just tries and silently doesn't set the option, as long as the port is still created etc, which will permit folk running the current hack (manual dnsmasq etc) to keep working."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-07-23 21:14:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

Very good questions, lifeless!'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-24 06:14:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Some minor issues - please note that the code needs to be rebased as quantum sadly no longer exists - you need to change to neutron
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 5572, 'date': '2013-07-24 21:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (4 inline comments)

This shows the variious tracebacke when certain condiions are there or aren't for dhcp_options support in various modules (i.e. not in the neutron layer or in the neutronclient  but not in the neutron server).

commit_message:
quantum pxeboot-port support for baremetal

Baremetal provisioning currently requires a separate
DHCP server because PXE options are not being set in Neutron.
This feature does not support nova-network, only Neutron.
Implements blueprint pxeboot-ports

Change-Id: I2fefced6ce8ce466f0bc6dc5dd68053fb5827884

commit_message:
db_base_plugin_v2, ipam: introduce ipallocator extension to specify strategy

blueprint: configurable-ip-allocation
As second step, this patch adds ipallocator extension to specify
ip allocation strategy and its parameter. column ip allocation
strategy/parameter column is added to subnets table.

3rd step will be to implement other ip allocation driver like random, LRA,
and exhaust before repeat
The last step will be documentation.

Change-Id: I58637ee17d15eb42b3dfc67eca2b416e3344c1fc

commit_message:
Clean up some unused wrap_exception() stuff

The only use of wrap_exception() without notifier and publisher_id
arguments is in nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py ... and since no notifier
argument is supplied, this decorator does exactly nothing useful. So
let's delete the useless uses of this in the libvirt driver.

Now we can make the notifier and publisher_id the only arguments to the
decorator and make them mandatory, allowing us to clean up some unused
stuff.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I482e7f5e536493c06334b6aefb50c0e48d80c478

commit_message:
set package defaults to present

The package defaults in cinder are set to
latest. This is not consistent with the
other package defaults (which are set to
present).

This patch is aimed at making the package install
state default more consistent across all openstack
packages.

Change-Id: I0551777245acaacb551e84f64c0ef4d80c8c46b0

commit_message:
xenapi: test functions for _stream_disk

Add test cases to cover nova.virt.xenapi.vm_utils:_stream_disk, so that
it could be refactored/extended without fear.

Change-Id: Ice43218680d2d5dffad51155cd8da2c2ad2e2cfa

[{'created': '2013-08-19 15:09:05.000000000', 'message': "Ensure REMOTE_USER can contain '@' when using multiple domains

The external authentication support allows the domain to be passed
as part of the REMOTE_USER name, by using the '@' as a delineator,
but did not handle the case when the actual username itself also
contained the '@' character.

Fixes bug 1213842

Change-Id: Idffa42fe9c70818c71379669dfcd17d3113738a3
"}, {'created': '2013-08-20 09:10:57.000000000', 'message': "Ensure username passed by REMOTE_USER can contain '@'

The external authentication support allows the domain to be passed
as part of the REMOTE_USER name, by using the '@' as a delineator,
but did not handle the case when the actual username itself also

commit_message:
Ensure username passed by REMOTE_USER can contain '@'

The external authentication support allows the domain to be passed
as part of the REMOTE_USER name, by using the '@' as a delineator,
but did not handle the case when the actual username itself also
contained the '@' character.

Fixes bug 1213842

Change-Id: Idffa42fe9c70818c71379669dfcd17d3113738a3

commit_message:
Unified Volume Driver for IBM XIV and IBM DS8K

    * Refactored xiv.py to xiv_ds8k.py
    * Updated tests
    * Updated flags
    * Updated compatibility checks
    * DocImpact
    * Added extend_volume and migrate_volume

implements blueprint ibm-unify-xiv-ds8k

Change-Id: Ifd64fc1dab91ada6fd42a7e92a41361cf220042f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 18:43:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add UpdatePolicy attribute to Instance/AutoScalingGroup

This is the second part of a series to implement support
for AutoScaling UpdatePolicy.

Defined new UpdatePolicy class, included update_policy as an
attribute to InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup, and modified
init of InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup to parse the
UpdatePolicy from the template. Included tests to validate
various uses cases of templates with and without the
UpdatePolicy. This patch does not address the handling of update
using UpdatePolicy yet. The next patch will address that.

Change-Id: I1faf1a8a3ba1faf063b6687b34b57b2a96c6bfa8
blueprint: as-update-policy
'}, {'created': '2013-08-18 02:09:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add UpdatePolicy attribute to Instance/AutoScalingGroup

This is the second part of a series to implement support
for AutoScaling UpdatePolicy.

Defined new UpdatePolicy class, included update_policy as an
attribute to InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup, and modified
init of InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup to parse the
UpdatePolicy from the template. Default values for UpdatePolicy
will be handled in the handle_update method. Included tests to
validate various uses cases of templates with, with bad, and
without UpdatePolicy. This patch does not address handling of
update with UpdatePolicy yet. The next patch will address that.

Change-Id: I1faf1a8a3ba1faf063b6687b34b57b2a96c6bfa8
blueprint: as-update-policy
'}, {'created': '2013-08-18 02:48:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add UpdatePolicy attribute to Instance/AutoScalingGroup

for AutoScaling UpdatePolicy.

attribute to InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup, and modified
init of InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup to parse the
UpdatePolicy from the template. Default values for UpdatePolicy
will be handled in the handle_update method. Included tests to
validate various uses cases of templates with, with bad, without,
and removal of UpdatePolicy. This patch does not address handling
of instances update with UpdatePolicy yet. The next patch will
address that.

Change-Id: I1faf1a8a3ba1faf063b6687b34b57b2a96c6bfa8

Change-Id: I1faf1a8a3ba1faf063b6687b34b57b2a96c6bfa8
blueprint: as-update-policy
'}, {'created': '2013-08-21 19:18:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add UpdatePolicy attribute to Instance/AutoScalingGroup

This is the second part of a series to implement support
for AutoScaling UpdatePolicy.

Defined new update_policy attribute for InstanceGroup
and AutoScalingGroup, and modified init of InstanceGroup and
AutoScalingGroup to parse UpdatePolicy from the template.
Currently, only InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup manages
update using UpdatePolicy and so this is not implemented in the
Resource class. This can be revisited when UpdatePolicy is
applicable to other resource types. The resource validation
method is also overridden here to validate the UpdatePolicy.
Default values for the update policy will be handled in the
handle_update method. Included tests to validate various uses
cases of templates with, with bad, without, and removal of
UpdatePolicy. This patch does not address handling of instances
update with UpdatePolicy yet. The next patch will address that.

Change-Id: I1faf1a8a3ba1faf063b6687b34b57b2a96c6bfa8
blueprint: as-update-policy
'}, {'created': '2013-08-21 21:41:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add UpdatePolicy attribute to Instance/AutoScalingGroup

This is the second part of a series to implement support
for AutoScaling UpdatePolicy.

Defined new update_policy attribute for InstanceGroup
and AutoScalingGroup, and modified init of InstanceGroup and
AutoScalingGroup to parse UpdatePolicy from the template.
Currently, only InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup manages
update using UpdatePolicy and so this is not implemented in the
Resource class. This can be revisited when UpdatePolicy is
applicable to other resource types. The resource validation
method is also overridden here to validate the UpdatePolicy.
Default values for the update policy will be handled in the
handle_update method. Included tests to validate various uses
cases of templates with, with bad, without, and removal of
UpdatePolicy. This patch does not address handling of instances
update with UpdatePolicy yet. The next patch will address that.

Change-Id: I1faf1a8a3ba1faf063b6687b34b57b2a96c6bfa8

commit_message:
Add UpdatePolicy attribute to Instance/AutoScalingGroup

This is the second part of a series to implement support
for AutoScaling UpdatePolicy.

Defined new update_policy attribute for InstanceGroup
and AutoScalingGroup, and modified init of InstanceGroup and
AutoScalingGroup to parse UpdatePolicy from the template.
Currently, only InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup manages
update using UpdatePolicy and so this is not implemented in the
Resource class. This can be revisited when UpdatePolicy is
applicable to other resource types. The resource validation
method is also overridden here to validate the UpdatePolicy.
Included tests to validate various uses cases of templates
with, with bad, without, and removal of UpdatePolicy. This
patch does not address handling of instances update with
UpdatePolicy yet. The next patch will address that.

Change-Id: I1faf1a8a3ba1faf063b6687b34b57b2a96c6bfa8
blueprint: as-update-policy

commit_message:
Add Identity v2 user tests

* implement Identity command tests for v2 user

Also re-work the user create and set commands for exclusive options
(--enable|--disable) to actually behave properly.  Yay tests!

Change-Id: Ie1ec2569b3d85a9d556ee70f2e8f69fd2a3c03c8

commit_message:
Fully qualify form fields (with form name) in YAQL expressions.

This allows to address cleaned data on any wizard step.

Change-Id: Icc1651aeed02784b8a3bde792550efb067af19c9

@afazekas, thanks for your remind, I have added this into ether-pad, and I believe this patch will solve the issue 35165 you said as well.
Because now nova change to use async manner (NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper) to alloc network, then in the end will update the instance_info_cache table.
Since nova api just query instance_info_cache table to obtain network info for one instance, it will throw the error if the test cases in tempest uses network info immdiately before instance_info_cache hasn't been consistent. 

I don't know why the jenkins always fail in the test "test_server_rescue", it seems that it's not caused by my patch. but I will look into it tomorrow.

"}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2013-08-19 22:57:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Zhang Hua,

I have two observations regarding this patch set:

1) You have included changes to tempest.api.compute.admin.test_fixed_ips. You added code to skip several test methods if networking is provided by Neutron. This is great and the right thing to do. However, these changes don't belong in this commit. Would you please create a commit specific for this? I'll be more that happy to +1 it

2) I didn't see at all the Jenkins jobs where this patch set triggered failures. I took a look at only one of them, gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full. The failures we are getting are below. These failures are caused by test method test_delete_server_while_in_building_state in tempest.api.compute.servers.test_servers. You changed in tempest.services.compute.json.servers_client line (159):

while(server_status != status):

for line (160):

while(server_status != status or len(addresses) < 1):

You are ONLY going to exit this loop until you get the desired state (BUILD in this case) AND you get at least 1 address. Problem is that test_delete_server_while_in_building_state doesn't request any networks for the server. So tempest.services.compute.json.servers_client times out in line 161. You need to take this case into consideration

The API used by this tempest test relies on instance_info_cache
updated by two threads. The result is not deterministic,
but in the end the info_cache will be consistent.
So wait for two cycles of CONF.heal_instance_info_cache_interval.

Fixes bug #1210483

'}, {'created': '2013-08-19 07:04:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes the issues of tempest due to async network allocation

Nova uses NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper to alloc network in an
async manner, and this allows one to start querying for
network info before you know you will need it. Nova will
invokes refresh_cache method to update instance_cache_info
after excuting the allocate_for_instance method as well.

But nova rest api will query allocate_for_instance table
directly, thus we will get the empty network info before
instance_cache_info table has been updated asynchronously.
The result is not deterministic,
but in the end the instance_info_cache will be consistent.

The api used in tempest relies on instance_info_cache,
So this patch try retry and timeout in both
wait_for_server_status and list_addresses methods to fix the
issues of tempest due to async network allocation manager.

Fixes bug #1210483

commit_message:
Fixes all issues of tempest caused by async network allocation

Nova uses NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper to alloc network in an
async manner, and this allows one to start querying for
network info before you know you will need it. Nova will
invokes refresh_cache method to update instance_cache_info
after excuting the allocate_for_instance method as well.

But nova rest api will query allocate_for_instance table
directly, thus we will get the empty network info before
instance_cache_info table has been updated asynchronously.
The result is not deterministic,
but in the end the instance_info_cache will be consistent.

The patch will check network info in the method
wait_for_server_status to fix this issues.

Change-Id: Ia256bcea41437ee2ffb0b0de9215ce6088bd73ae
Closes-Bug: #1210483

I still don't understand why the loop is required after we have unique constraints, and why we expect it to succeed after it's failed once, that's actually the baffling part to me. I also think brute force loops like that aren't really where we want to be headed. That needs a lot more explanation of exactly the kind of scenario that would trigger that, and how that would resolve it, and that should be in the code so that someone down the road understands why we ever did something like that."}, {'account_id': 7711, 'date': '2013-07-30 16:55:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The name of method 'aggregate_metadata_add' does not reflect that it does (update or create metadata). Let's consider the following situation: we are doing insertion of new entries in aggregate_metadata_add(), and at this moment a concurrent transaction is committed. Insert fails due to integrity error (unique constraint violation). We can immediately raise exception from this method, but in this situation I think it is better to make attempt update duplicate entires as existed."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-08-02 11:45:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-08-07 15:00:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I still do not think that the way that aggregate_metadata_add does a loop is a proper solution.
This seems to be very patchy. Why do the locking and unique keys not help here?'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-08-07 15:20:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: No score

@garyk

It's a tricky case:
  1) SELECT FOR UPDATE doesn't prevent new rows from being added
  2) the semantics of this DB API method is actually "add or update" rather than "add", so it should not fail if entries with such "keys" have been already added to a DB, but rather update them (where "key" is a tuple of columns of the composite unique constraint)

So the unique constraint here is only needed to ensure that it's impossible for concurrent transactions to insert entries with the same key values.

Consider the following case: we have two concurrent calls to aggregate_metadata_add(); the first is committing a DB transaction, so the other is going to fail with IntegrityError. From perspective of the method's caller, it should not fail, but rather always update existing entries.

AFAIK, the only way to implement the correct behavior of an "add or update" method in this case is to use a retry loop,
which checks for IntegrityError and reselects entries to be updated, the ones to be inserted, do updates/inserts and then commits again.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-08-07 15:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Are you sure that there will not be any database inconsistencies due to this.
Do you actually have an example where this happens?'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-08-07 15:43:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@garyk

Every loop iteration is done within a transaction. So all transactions are rolled back, if we get an IntegrityError. Only the one successful insert/update operation is committed.'}, {'account_id': 7711, 'date': '2013-08-07 15:44:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

garyk,
MySQL and Postgres offer row-level locking by default, which cannot help in this case. Unique constraint used for race condition check, as I wrote in my old comment for patch set 4. In worse-case exception raised (line 5015 in api). No inconsistencies (due to unique constraint).'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-08-07 15:47:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@garyk 

It is impossible to get inconsistence here, because in each loop we are:

create transaction
do nasty things
commit or revert

So it is same as just try to call this method more then 1 times from os api. 

We are updated or creating, if this method is two time called, then it is possible to get unique constraint violation.

Example 

call of method 1: 
1. Strat transaction
2. Get all records
5. Update old
6. Add new rows with key = "new_key"
10. commit

call of method 2:
3. Start transaction 
4. Get all records
. 
7. Update old and try to add row with "new_key" (as in step 3 we didn't get it)
8. Unique constraint violation
9. revert this transaction
11. Start new transaction
12. get all records (now with new_key) 
13. update all
14. commit'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-08-08 06:00:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: (2 inline comments)

Hi,
My problem with the patch is as follows: say a admin wants to update the values {'foo': 'bar1'} and another admin wants to update with {'foo': 'bar2'}. If there is a race then which one will win? Ideally it would be good if there is an error to one of the admins that there is a clash with the 'foo'.
This is a real edge case, but I think that we need some indication - either real time - an exception to the user that a problem has occurred or a log that they can know after the fact that there was a problem.
In short I am willing to compromise with the log messages.
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 7711, 'date': '2013-08-08 09:31:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7711, 'date': '2013-08-08 09:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (2 inline comments)

commit_message:
Add unique constraint to AggregateMetadata

Added unique constraint
'uniq_aggregate_metadata0aggregate_id0key0deleted'
('aggregate_id', 'key', 'deleted') to
AggregateMetadata model and migrate
scripts.

Exception from UC violation used in method
aggregate_metadata_add() for race condition check.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: I793706964ce76340c87e536af35a2dfa37408869

[{'created': '2013-08-21 16:40:56.000000000', 'message': '3PAR driver terminate connection host validation

The 3PAR backend does not allow FQDN host names (i.e. foo.rose.hp.com),
instead it requires just foo without the rose.hp.com. This patch will
now validate the host name in terminate connection by calling
_safe_host just as it was doing in initialize connection when creating
the host on the 3PAR backend.

Change-Id: I52e90938c782473edc93f30672a0530ab5934edc
Fixes: bug 1214994
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR driver terminate connection host validation

The 3PAR backend does not allow FQDN host names (i.e. foo.rose.hp.com),
instead it requires just foo without the rose.hp.com. This patch will
now validate the host name in terminate connection by calling
_safe_host just as it was doing in initialize connection when creating
the host on the 3PAR backend.

Change-Id: I52e90938c782473edc93f30672a0530ab5934edc
Fixes: bug 1214994

RequestContext.to_dict() adds user/tenant keys, but from_dict() spews
this warning a "Arguments dropped when creating context" if you pass a
dict which contains user/tenant keys.

Seems to make perfect sense that from_dict() would remove these extra

This is import for oslo.messaging because we deserialize request context
dicts into nova's RequestContext using from_dict().

commit_message:
Pop extra keys from context in from_dict()

RequestContext.to_dict() adds user/tenant keys, but from_dict() spews
this warning a "Arguments dropped when creating context" if you pass a
dict which contains user/tenant keys.

Seems to make perfect sense that from_dict() would remove these extra
keys. A test case ensures this won't happen for new arguments.

This is import for oslo.messaging because we deserialize request context
dicts into nova's RequestContext using from_dict().

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I0938f3c7c581383cbebc3a973d64454250f6ab8e

commit_message:
Don't initialize neutronv2 state at module import

Currently, neutronv2.API defines conductor_api when the module is
imported. This could easily happen before any configuration files are
parsed so e.g. use_local may not be applied.

In the case of oslo.messaging, I was seeing this cause problems bcause
it was happening before oslo.messaging transport was initialized.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ia193442d9c9156b1afdbb24be3c83f4be3c8f35f

commit_message:
Fix fake image_service import in v3 test_disk_config

In one place, we use the full module path for the image.fake module and
in another place we simply use 'fake', however we only import the
latter. This appears to only work because of the common.rpc import which
results in nova.tests.image.fake being defined. This import is going
away with oslo.messaging, though.

It looks like we use a mixture of approaches across the tests, so go
with the full path approach.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Ida4c9e261a99d0610b557ba46c9f56927af21fef

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-24 00:10:38.000000000', 'message': "Put fault message in the correct field

Currently when adding an instance fault, the message field looks
for kwargs['value'], which many exceptions do not have.  This
results in the message field being set to the name of the
exception class, which in some cases is not useful (see the bug
report for an example).

This change puts the exception message in the message field, and
removes it from the details field since there's no need to put it
in both places.  That leaves the details field for actual details,
like stack traces.

Fixes bug 1203880

Change-Id: Ic92a9bd9cb2e139ce7a9f3f1299b7a6ccae82dd1
"}, {'created': '2013-07-24 03:22:59.000000000', 'message': "Put fault message in the correct field

like stack traces.

commit_message:
Put fault message in the correct field

Currently when adding an instance fault, the message field looks
for kwargs['value'], which many exceptions do not have.  This
results in the message field being set to the name of the
exception class, which in some cases is not useful (see the bug
report for an example).

This change puts the exception message in the message field, and
removes it from the details field since there's no need to put it
in both places.  That leaves the details field for actual details,
like stack traces.

Fixes bug 1203880

Change-Id: Ic92a9bd9cb2e139ce7a9f3f1299b7a6ccae82dd1

commit_message:
Relax policy so owner can access encryption info

The admin only policy is too restrictive to allow Nova to access a
volume's encryption metadata using the owner's request context. Hence,
this commit relaxes the policy for the volume encryption metadata
API extension so the metadata is accessible to the volume's owner.

Implements: blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes
Change-Id: Ia946850b79f7f717ab7528caf7cac2905e650917
SecurityImpact

[{'created': '2013-08-19 20:46:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix prep_resize() stale system_metadata issue

In compute manager, the _prep_resize() method can clobber the
caller's instance['system_metadata'] if it is in dict format,
and leave's the caller's instance object stale after an update.
This seemingly obscure fix isn't hit until the next patch where
we actually have a way to encounter this specific situation.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

commit_message:
Fix prep_resize() stale system_metadata issue

In compute manager, the _prep_resize() method can clobber the
caller's instance['system_metadata'] if it is in dict format,
and leave's the caller's instance object stale after an update.
This seemingly obscure fix isn't hit until the next patch where
we actually have a way to encounter this specific situation.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I4b3a20c483dd632149c7808daf4986c00dc72890

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-08 19:52:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unnecessary msgstr's from English po files

The English translations had translated message strings
specified.  This is unnecessary as there is no need to
translate English to English and the bigger problem was the
fact that there were many cases where the translated string
was incomplete or the wrong string all together.

This commit fixes this problem for the en_US, en_AU and en_GB
locales.  The msgstr is now set to "" .  This will cause the
translation to be skipped and the English msgid will be used instead.

Fixes bug #1209317

Change-Id: Ia78f5ebb4bec996798798bb25ea1b97c47b5e50b
'}, {'created': '2013-08-14 21:23:26.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unnecessary msgstr's from English po files

locales.  The msgstr is now set to "" .  This will cause the

'}, {'created': '2013-08-21 22:06:18.000000000', 'message': "Fix incorrect msgstr's to avoid translation errors

There are numerous msgstr's in the cinder.po files for en_US,
en_AU and en_GB that are incorrect translations of the associated
msgid.  It appears that there are a number that are the result of

development very difficult if the string that is coming out in the

bad msgstr's.

Once this commit is merged, Transifex will catch the change to

Fixes bug #1209317

Change-Id: Ia78f5ebb4bec996798798bb25ea1b97c47b5e50b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect msgstr's to avoid translation errors

There are numerous msgstr's in the cinder.po files for en_US,
en_AU and en_GB that are incorrect translations of the associated
msgid.  It appears that there are a number that are the result of
problems with past fuzzy translations gone wrong and some may also be the
result of copy/paste mistakes.  Regardless of the origin it makes debug and
development very difficult if the string that is coming out in the
logs doesn't match what is expected.  This patch fixes the numerous
bad msgstr's.

Once this commit is merged, Transifex will catch the change to
the Cinder po files and then spin a new Transifex Translations import.

Fixes bug #1209317

Change-Id: Ia78f5ebb4bec996798798bb25ea1b97c47b5e50b

commit_message:
Add task_state filter for nova list

e.g. nova list --status REBOOT

Fixes: bug #1196999

Change-Id: I55f3367952c1de756a1a87c7313a0dbb2da3f613

(4 inline comments)

except Exception:
    self.fail()
.
Style of exception handling on creation is one of the worst possible in tempest, please exclude it from the generic one.

(AttributeError exception handling also not a good example, but not as dangerous as this.)

The self.fail() itself also on the current delete list.

The all 'Exception' catcher normally just used for forced resource deletion.."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-08-19 00:07:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Cleanup: Add common "create security rule" method

There are many "create security rule" methods in each scenario test,
their behaviors are almost the same. They create security rule which
is loginable/reachable to a server with ssh/ping.
For code-cleanup, this patch adds the method which creates loginable
rules to the specified security group.

Change-Id: I4e2ebd099b7373948c82abf86615a85db055c7c5

Otherwise looks good.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-08-06 04:57:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Salvatore for raising a good point.
The original intention of this patch is to make the help messages intuitive. Introducing choices leads to backward incompatible change, so it looks better not to introduce choices in this patch and to add available values in the help message. At least I want to know what values are accepted for an attribute from the help message.

Regarding whether we accept lowercase values or handle values as case-insensitive, we need a consensus on the API and server side. At now, some attributes are case-insensitive and some are used as it is passed.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-08-06 05:34:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-08-06 05:34:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I checked the current server-side code. All fields for which I introduces choices are defined as enum in the db models and accepted value list in the validator. Lowercase values are not accepted now (at the server side). The difference is who returns the errors. From this point, introducing choices is backward compatible.

The other difference is that users cannot pass other values if introducing choices. This is a problem for operators using custom versions of LBaaS.

Thought?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-06 06:18:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/90/38090/2/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/801cb2b : SUCCESS in 28m 17s
'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2013-08-06 12:11:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-08-15 20:52:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I am fine with hardcoding choices at the moment.
We already tweak the CLI when it comes to provider-specific extension, we might do the same for extending choice options.

At some point we'll find a solution to this issue, but definetely not in this patch.

+1 waiting for a bit to see if someone has a different advice."}, {'account_id': 5127, 'date': '2013-08-19 18:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Improve help message of loadbalancer commands

- Correct the help for healthmonitor type (Fixes bug #1203582)
- Use choices for the enum fields:
  healthmonitor type, pool lb-method, pool protocol
- Convert metavar to uppercase

Change-Id: I2a648949b48385249dde0c5868f564e1f17c3675

commit_message:
Use the global environment to define AWS::CloudWatch::Alarm

This will make it easier for the deployer to define the default
implementation.

Change-Id: If1a8dceb4ad2cade90a56f16dd450e571425c4a6

commit_message:
Load deployer/global environment files at startup

This allows for a global environment that the deployer can use to set
their own defaults.
An example /etc/heat/environment.d/x.yaml

resource_registry:
  "OS::Quantum*": "OS::Neutron*"
  "AWS::RDS::DBInstance": "file:///etc/heat/templates/AWS_RDS_DBInstance.template"

Change-Id: Iee647a109e5a41d41cd4a79909c6edaca0d17b87

commit_message:
Add an environment_format.py like the template one

This to make the section checking mechanism less spread out
and more consistent. This can also be used by the global
environment loader.

Change-Id: I7ca7ad754fb702877dedc416a30f573d239933ad

'}, {'created': '2013-08-21 13:07:59.000000000', 'message': 'Remove calls to policy.check and policy.enforce from plugin code

This patch removes a few explicit policy checks recently added to

commit_message:
Remove calls to policy.check and policy.enforce from plugin code

Completes blueprint make-authz-orthogonal

This patch removes a few explicit policy checks recently added to
the plumgrid and cisco plugins.
They are not necessary as the same checks are already performed
by the policy engine.

Change-Id: Ie99f5fa6ad4a9568b050827bc479a62dd40e18ac

commit_message:
Fix auth_url in metadata_agent.ini

Closes-Bug: #1214921

The value of auth_url is incorrect, some operators may not change
that value and problem will occur. According to keystone, 35357 is
the port number which the public admin listens on, 5000 should be
used for neutron instead.

Change-Id: I0b35f25c1845d02f8b9b3cd8c759920d52003c0c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 10:02:18.000000000', 'message': 'Remove static NS resolution from seed image

Seed VM is getting NS resolution from its DHCP lease given by libvirt. There is no need for manually specifying resolv.conf.
Besides, these two files were having bad filenames (.conf suffix) preventing them to by executed by dib-run-parts script
(see dib-run-parts regex : allowed_regex=${RUN_PARTS_REGEX:-"^[0-9A-Za-z_-]+$"} )

Change-Id: Ic12ff9d1a8a14fdab686288cac3b3ae23375ddf0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove static NS resolution from seed image

Seed VM is getting NS resolution from its DHCP lease given by libvirt. There is no need for manually specifying resolv.conf.
Besides, these two files were having bad filenames (.conf suffix) preventing them to by executed by dib-run-parts script
(see dib-run-parts regex : allowed_regex=${RUN_PARTS_REGEX:-"^[0-9A-Za-z_-]+$"} )

Change-Id: Ic12ff9d1a8a14fdab686288cac3b3ae23375ddf0

commit_message:
use provider to validate tokens

Validate V2 token when passed to V3 api
Push the validation logic to the provider
token auth plugin works on data from v2 or v3

Bug 1212778

Change-Id: Ib2f77839c907d5013d33660920fa902613be4fb5

commit_message:
Initial Trusts support

Implements client support for the basic trusts API operations,
note this does not include support for the roles subpath operations,
support for those can be added in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: I0c6ba12bad5cc8f3f10697d2a3dcf4f3be8c7ece
blueprint: delegation-impersonation-support

commit_message:
Restore client.py for backward compatibility

Simply pull in HTTPClient from its new location. This also restores the
tests that were modified back to there original form to make sure
nothing has changed from the original.

Fixes: bug 1211998
Change-Id: Ia3241a4352eb6b37c6489cd4dd1bc373de107e12

commit_message:
Adds EDP support in the UI

First rough pass at Job Sources UI.  Still much to be done.
The API calls are not yet wired into the database, so nothing
actually gets created.  This now reflects several small changes
after the initial code review.  Also updating for the job-origins
schema change to remove job-type. Now updated to include details
view for jobs, job origins and data sources.  Also including
Red Hat in the copyright statement.  Freshly updated to
fit the job and job-origins apis.

Implements: blueprint edp-savanna-dashboard-ui

Change-Id: I1db4551279b2e4faa0159b5a2944f660778087ff

commit_message:
Add missing engine option to getopt

The option to specify a virtualization engine was documented and coded,
but not added to the list of parameters that getopt accepted.

Change-Id: Ia7079222912c6abc84edc6af5d12789eb8015dfa

commit_message:
Allow to delete a volume in error_extending status

We must be able to remove "error_extending" volume, because we
cannot retrieve it without changing database status.
If trying to remove the volume, now it fails like the following:

$ cinder delete vol-test01
ERROR: Invalid volume: Volume status must be available or error,
but current status is: error_extending
$

"error_extending" also would be error status, so it is good to
remove the volume.

Fixes bug #1214228

Change-Id: I861e7af75f2c50d4e03ef3680dccde73078b4888

[{'created': '2013-08-19 20:21:13.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid serializing CinderExceptions before they are translated

CinderExceptions were being unicode()'d when being wrapped in an
HTTPException, and this was causing the delayed translation to fail for
those errors.

Also, CinderExceptions have a 'message' class attribute that holds the
generic error message template, e.g. "Backup  %(backup_id)s is not
found", unfortunately, because the names are the same, it was
overshadowing the actual exception instance 'message', e.g. "Backup 1 is
not found", when translating. This patch puts the exception's actual
message in a new field called 'msg'.

Fixes Bug: #1214102

Change-Id: Ied9abcc3d05454852c0a5891432eb181220a744e
'}, {'created': '2013-08-19 23:06:07.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid serializing CinderExceptions before they are translated

commit_message:
Avoid serializing CinderExceptions before they are translated

CinderExceptions were being unicode()'d when being wrapped in an
HTTPException, and this was causing the delayed translation to fail for
those errors.

Also, CinderExceptions have a 'message' class attribute that holds the
generic error message template, e.g. "Backup  %(backup_id)s is not
found", unfortunately, because the names are the same, it was
overshadowing the actual exception instance 'message', e.g. "Backup 1 is
not found", when translating. This patch puts the exception's actual
message in a new field called 'msg'.

Fixes Bug: #1214102

Change-Id: Ied9abcc3d05454852c0a5891432eb181220a744e

commit_message:
Add jsonschema to Nova requirements.txt

jsonschema is requested for validate the whitelist and alias
definition.

Change-Id: Iec3c14bb407cce88fd5af54a3930d83c53033293

subject: Use system locale when Accept-Language header is not provided

commit_message:
Use system locale when Accept-Language header is not provided

Remove en_US as the default language when no header is provided, and use
None instead. Upon translation None will be defaulted to system as it
was before the translation changes.

Fixes bug: #1214476

Change-Id: I0fe22c526710e69ae0731e7d0b42170e6f3a8523

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 14:09:31.000000000', 'message': "Fix migration 210 tests for PostgreSQL

We check index in table in _check_210() and _post_downgrade_210()
methods in a such way:

self.assertIn(('project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_idx',
               ['user_id', 'deleted']), index_data)

But we have no possibility to get the order of columns due to SQLA
issue in reflection of indexes for PostgreSQL.
See http://www.sqlalchemy.org/trac/ticket/276
So columns order in `index_data` variable can be wrong and test
fails in such case.

To fix this we should store colums as sets (instead of lists) if
we run tests on PostgreSQL.

Fixes bug 1213921

Change-Id: I9e10b325940becfdcff6b13fcaa4146731126a60
"}, {'created': '2013-08-19 14:38:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix migration 210 tests for PostgreSQL

We check index in table in _check_210() and _post_downgrade_210()
methods in a such way:

self.assertIn(('project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_idx',
               ['user_id', 'deleted']), index_data)

But we have no possibility to get the order of columns due to SQLA
issue in reflection of indexes for PostgreSQL.
See http://www.sqlalchemy.org/trac/ticket/2767
So columns order in `index_data` variable can be wrong and test
fails in such case.

To fix this we should store colums as sets (instead of lists) if
we run tests on PostgreSQL.

Fixes bug 1213921

Change-Id: I9e10b325940becfdcff6b13fcaa4146731126a60
"}]
commit_message:
Fix migration 210 tests for PostgreSQL

We check index in table in _check_210() and _post_downgrade_210()
methods in a such way:

self.assertIn(('project_user_quotas_user_id_deleted_idx',
               ['user_id', 'deleted']), index_data)

But we have no possibility to get the order of columns due to SQLA
issue in reflection of indexes for PostgreSQL.
See http://www.sqlalchemy.org/trac/ticket/2767
So columns order in `index_data` variable can be wrong and test
fails in such case.

To fix this we should store colums as sets (instead of lists) if
we run tests on PostgreSQL.

Fixes bug 1213921

Change-Id: I9e10b325940becfdcff6b13fcaa4146731126a60

Remove unused nova.tests.image.fake code

Looks like this fake method was never actually used.

blueprint: oslo-messaging

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 22:14:07.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused fake run_instance() method

In a bunch of tests, we stub out rpc.call() and use it as a hook to
create instances and return their details.

The thing is, we never actually call() 'run_instance anymore .. we
always cast() it. So, these fake methods never actually get called and
can be safely removed.

A similar change was made in I63bbc98c285faebec53f8e62857c01548807db68
but missed some places.

Change-Id: I6353b248f689d5eb16dbfd2067bbb61b1e14dbbf
"}, {'created': '2013-08-17 07:47:53.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused fake run_instance() method

In a bunch of tests, we stub out rpc.call() and use it as a hook to
create instances and return their details.

The thing is, we never actually call() 'run_instance anymore .. we
always cast() it. So, these fake methods never actually get called and
can be safely removed.

A similar change was made in I63bbc98c285faebec53f8e62857c01548807db68
but missed some places.

Change-Id: I6353b248f689d5eb16dbfd2067bbb61b1e14dbbf
"}, {'created': '2013-08-19 10:51:50.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused fake run_instance() method

In a bunch of tests, we stub out rpc.call() and use it as a hook to
create instances and return their details.

The thing is, we never actually call() 'run_instance anymore .. we
always cast() it. So, these fake methods never actually get called and
can be safely removed.

commit_message:
Remove unused fake run_instance() method

In a bunch of tests, we stub out rpc.call() and use it as a hook to
create instances and return their details.

The thing is, we never actually call() 'run_instance anymore .. we
always cast() it. So, these fake methods never actually get called and
can be safely removed.

A similar change was made in I63bbc98c285faebec53f8e62857c01548807db68
but missed some places.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I6353b248f689d5eb16dbfd2067bbb61b1e14dbbf

subject: Remove use of fake_rabbit in Nova

The fake_rabbit config option enables the memory transport for kombu.

We use the fake RPC backend for all of our unit testing. As best I can
tell, fake_rabbit harks back to a time when it was used for unit
testing.

The code in nova-dhcpbridge is the only place we explicitly do anything
different for this case - i.e. we directly call out to the network

When we move to oslo.messaging, we can't rely on this config option

server" API in oslo.messaging.

can be useful to anyone. We should just remove it rather than putting in
a bunch of work to retain it with oslo.messaging.

commit_message:
Remove use of fake_rabbit in Nova

The fake_rabbit config option enables the memory transport for kombu.

We use the fake RPC backend for all of our unit testing. As best I can
tell, fake_rabbit harks back to a time when it was used for unit
testing.

The code in nova-dhcpbridge is the only place we explicitly do anything
different for this case - i.e. we directly call out to the network
manager to manage the IP address leases.

When we move to oslo.messaging, we can't rely on this config option
because it could be renamed in future. It's hard to imagine a more
generic "is the transport going to actually send a message to a remote
server" API in oslo.messaging.

I don't think anyone uses fake_rabbit anymore. I just don't see how it
can be useful to anyone. We should just remove it rather than putting in
a bunch of work to retain it with oslo.messaging.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I3a8f8a9d3cb6cc6f431d48b4222bde31da767559

commit_message:
.conf suffix for the horizon config on Fedora

On Fedora by default the *.conf imported only from
the /etc/httpd/conf.d/.

Changing the default config name to horizon.conf with all
distribution in order to have a simple logic.

Change-Id: I08c3e825f697640fd73ac1f9c569f313abc3c04f

commit_message:
Mismatch dictionary key in the process of parsing XML

Should be:
'addr': child.get('version') -> 'addr': child.get('addr'),
in the _parse_network method of servers_client.py

Change-Id: Ida6cf5ce5b2b5b89b5fadb7705798fe44a913a33
Closes-Bug: #1214198

commit_message:
Adds availability zone info to System Info panel

Also moves the host aggregates data into System Info panel
because it's exactly the type of static information that
belongs there, and it reduces a significant amount of
boilerplate.

Incidentally adds a new table feature to make listing
out unordered lists of items easier.

Implements blueprint show-zone-for-admin

Change-Id: Id8fb5c9615b018135a5d90eaa82eb80ff63bb7dc

commit_message:
Fix typos and code style check

In neutron/api/extensions.py, there are some typos, no needed blank
lines and docstrings can be improved (according to HACKING.rst).

Closes-Bug: #1213541

commit_message:
Add proxy section to metaplugin.ini

Proxy section was registered but not included in metaplugin.ini

Fixes bug 1210046

Change-Id: Id13955e976154e9b90f300372e64cd42728ba8a2

subject: Remove duplicated keystone credentials options from config files
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/31939/1/check/gate-quantum-pep8/7608 : SUCCESS in 1m 43s

'}, {'account_id': 704, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Agree with Akihiro Motoki, marking -1 to be sure developers are aware of it, It did not show ups as -1 in my gerrit view, weird!!"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

keystone credentials in quantum.conf belong to different section [keystone_authtoken], so we need to update the code in the metadata agent to use them.

In addition, the current options defined in metadata/agent.py should be marked deprecated to keep backward compatibility."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Akihiro, thank you for pointing out a different section name, I really missed that. But your second comment is not completely clear for me: I only see the option to pass deprecated name (or group) which doesn't fit current case I believe. I think we can just delete those options from metadata/agent.py (as well as from agent/linux/interface.py). What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/31939/2/check/gate-quantum-pep8/7653 : FAILURE in 1m 54s

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/31939/5/check/gate-quantum-pep8/7840 : SUCCESS in 1m 42s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/31939/5/check/gate-quantum-docs/7078/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 31s
- http://logs.openstack.org/31939/5/check/gate-quantum-python26/7449 : SUCCESS in 20m 06s
- http://logs.openstack.org/31939/5/check/gate-quantum-python27/7460 : SUCCESS in 14m 34s
- http://logs.openstack.org/31939/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/30217 : SUCCESS in 18m 49s
'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Akihiro, that depends on whether storing auth credentials in api-paste.ini was 'officially' deprecated in Grizzly or not.

From the admin guide it does not seem like we're stating that it's being deprecated.

Otherwise, I'm happy to ignore the case in which the credentials are still specified in api-paste.ini"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I wonder if this becomes no longer relevant when this one merges:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/32558/

Or at least you can rebase one on top of the other to avoid needless conflicts on similar refactoring. Just a thought..."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

When I talked with Oleg last time on IRC, we agreed that
keystone credentials in metadata_agent.ini and quantum.conf should be same and
we can remove keystone credentials from metadata agent safely.
It is true as long as keystone credentials are defined in quantum.conf.

One exception is a case where keystone credentials are defined in api-paste.ini.
Migration from api-paste to quantum.conf was done in Grizzly.
This change is regarded as backward compatible from the point of view
that api-paste.ini still can be used.

Do we need to consider the case where keystone credentials are defined in api-paste.ini?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thanks Salvatore,
I agree with the policy. I checked the admin guide and the release note.
Networking Admin Guide says "The auth_token middleware first tries the
configurations in /etc/quantum/api-paste.ini and then tries the quantum.conf
configuration. If you currently use api-paste.ini, you do not need to change it."
Grizzly Release Note also do not mention it.
I would like to say using api-paste.ini is not 'officialy' deprecated in Grizzly. 

So we need to consider the case where api-paste.ini is used for keystone auth.
I think what we need to do are:
- Depreate keystone auth in api-paste.ini in Havana (quantum-server cannot
check api-paste.ini, so we check whether api-paste.ini is used by checking
quantum.conf contains keystone auth or not).
- Update the admin guide.
- Depreate auto config in metadata agent and meta plugin.

If RPC support in metadata agent currently proposed is merged, auth config
migration in metadata_agent.ini will become unnecessary.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/32558/ was abandoned.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/32558/ was abandoned I think this patch makes sence and only action items are those listed by Akihiro:

  - Depreate keystone auth in api-paste.ini in Havana (quantum-server cannot check api-paste.ini, so we check whether api-paste.ini is used by checking quantum.conf contains keystone auth or not).

  - Update the admin guide.

But I'm not sure who can take this action items. Could someone please help/advise?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-11 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-11 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 1970, 'date': '2013-08-22 06:47:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

-1

We should move keystone options to neutron/common/config.py, since meta plugin also need these information. it's related to Id13955e976154e9b90f300372e64cd42728ba8a2"}]

commit_message:
Remove duplicated keystone credentials options from config files

Keystone credentials are defined in quantum.conf and
don't need to be duplicated in other config files

Fixes bug 1187578

Change-Id: Iea13b98b761aef97d0dc6d0f003b1f60818ebea8

commit_message:
Adds brick helpers to cinder utils

This patch adds some cinder utils functions
that wrap calls into brick to automatically
populate cinder's root wrap helper.  This
prevents propogating the recreation of the
sudo cinder-rootwrap string.

Change-Id: I3ae2add4f38a40c57ca197b231e09a9856d7e809

Use common dochistory section

Each manual has its own section to include the revision history, let's
share it with a common section.

When quantum metadata proxy reads the cli args
which are propagated from its parent processes
(l3-agent and dhcp-agent), if log-dir and log-file

files (/etc/neutron).

component becomes consistent.

commit_message:
Syslog support for neutron metadata proxy

When neutron metadata proxy reads the cli args
which are propagated from its parent processes
(l3-agent and dhcp-agent), if log-dir and log-file
are not defined in the context, it will also
double-check whether syslog is enabled and
its facility in the user-defined configuration
files (/etc/neutron).
As a result, the log behavior of each neutron
component becomes consistent.
File log is the default logging function. The syslog
is enabled when use_syslog is explicitly defined and
file log options are all disabled.

Fixes: bug #1184500
Change-Id: I7804fa8794071d21513e068d084607691215522f

Remove race condition for identitiy tests. When running tests in
parallel, the XML and JSON classes causes duplicate error when
trying to create the same user. Changing test classes to avoid hardcoded
user names.

Change-Id: I133d774be64b374aca8def3d998927b3a87cea19
bp: speed-up-tempest

commit_message:
Remove identity race condition

Remove race condition for identitiy tests. When running tests in
parallel, the XML and JSON classes causes duplicate error when
trying to create the same user. Changing test classes to avoid hardcoded
user names.

Change-Id: I133d774be64b374aca8def3d998927b3a87cea19
bp: speed-up-tempest

Kurt, according to the paramiko source code, channel.recv_exit_status() will wait until the command is finished, or until the channel is closed. Which is done below.

https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/openstack/common/processutils.py#L240

Also the close() method is called in __del__() in paramiko/channel.py so I think it not a common usecase to close the channel after each exec_command call.

Do you see mem leak with out it? If you want close() to be present, then we have to change the processutils code from oslo.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-20 01:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Removes ssh_execute in utils.py

The ssh_execute function is already defined in oslo.processutils
Removes the version in utils.py

Change-Id: Ie0bd73d1f4e6df290270f6d712584431e965be78

commit_message:
Set ignore_exceptions for hacking

It's a list of imports that will be ignored while running hacking
checks. It'll be needed when I3663c4798413f2142d50d9edf967af607d4af37f
released (afaik hacking 0.7.0).

Change-Id: Ia58ec2e043d919aab1243785bbec72df1c116da5

commit_message:
Add Ironic template

Adds an template for the Ironic element. This template is configured
to be launched by a Boot-Stack vm. As Ironic is still in the initial
development stages the initial focus of the Ironic element and this
template is for use by developers.

Change-Id: I4fe058bbe22a040ca43140c9fa64d69d64e4c331

I don't think it's already in chroot, it occurs when calling "which busybox" in diskimage-builder/lib/ramdisk-defaults which is sourced directly by the ramdisk-image-create script.

$ $TRIPLEO_ROOT/diskimage-builder/bin/ramdisk-image-create -a amd64 fedora deploy -o deploy-ramdisk
which: no busybox in (/usr/lib64/qt-3.3/bin:/usr/libexec/lightdm:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/sbin:/home/jprovazn/bin:/home/jprovazn/tripleo/tripleo-incubator/scripts)'}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2013-08-14 15:12:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yup, confirmed, so maybe this patch can just change to instead remove the busybox requirement as it shouldn't be needed."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-22 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-14 18:35:13.000000000', 'message': "Fixes install on XenServer/XCP

Devstack installation on XenServer/XCP fails due to the 'os_PACKAGE'
variable not being set and 'set -o nounset' is configured. The patch
runs the 'GetOSVersion' loop before xenrc and stackrc runs so that the
'os_PACKAGE' variable is set.

Fixes bug #1212384

Change-Id: I7758bef8bde72bf4b62cdfd8a870e48b6eaefa91
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes install on XenServer/XCP

Devstack installation on XenServer/XCP fails due to the 'os_PACKAGE'
variable not being set and 'set -o nounset' is configured. The patch
runs the 'GetOSVersion' loop before xenrc and stackrc runs so that the
'os_PACKAGE' variable is set.

Fixes bug #1212384

Change-Id: I7758bef8bde72bf4b62cdfd8a870e48b6eaefa91

commit_message:
Add a version to pytz.

Upcoming improvements to pip 1.4 (wheel support and
skip-pre-release-by-default) mean that pytz without a version
will be skipped. Adding a version here gets us what we want.

Adding an intial lower-bound on the version that's currently in RHEL6,
since we don't actually care about the version itself.

pytz uses date based versioning which isn't supported by default:

http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0440/#date-based-versions

For Backport to Grizzly:
* Add the tox.ini from master
* Add a setup.py

Recently tox was added to gating checks, so in order to pass
gating checks the support infrastructure needs to be added as well.

Change-Id: Ieb0cda61b2f8665d5f83ff8beb8a4cf5b4ece011
(cherry picked from commit 09ab86aeb9c1ce0e63c68b374bd0d95ee711ded8)

this is what I mostly expected, this doesn't actually work on most of the projects yet. Please work the changes upstream. I'd also suggest a common bug for tracking them."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-08-07 11:30:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The first error at least is:

    2013-08-06 20:28:03.477 | 2013-08-06 20:28:03   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/migrate/versioning/schema.py", line 10, in <module>
    2013-08-06 20:28:03.477 | 2013-08-06 20:28:03     from sqlalchemy import exceptions as sa_exceptions
    2013-08-06 20:28:03.478 | 2013-08-06 20:28:03 ImportError: cannot import name exceptions

So that is already handled in the distros by a trivial patch:
http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/python-migrate.git/commit/?h=f19&id=603ed1d1

Now python-migrate is EOL upstream, transferring to alembic.
So as a small adjustment to relieve this blockage, it might
be appropriate to carry this simple patch within openstack?

I'm not sure how best to do that though.
Perhaps augmenting InstallVenv.post_process() in oslo-common and then propogating the patch to all projects,
and at that stage we could do the bump here.

Maybe there is a more central place we could apply patches, pbr?'}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2013-08-07 13:51:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

It's not just python-migrate, I know that Keystone unit tests were failing for me on Fedora19 until I downgraded to python-sqlalchemy-0.7.10."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-08-07 14:22:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Outside chance that keystone issue may be addressed with:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34266/
In general the patches to support 0.8.x are just tweaks.
Good point in general though, that we should run unit tests for all projects on a 0.8.x system before we bump this.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-08-15 01:53:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with everyone - we need to make it work before we can allow the upgrade."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-22 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-22 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Removes the cap for SQLAlchemy

Ubuntu 13.10 will ship SQLAlchemy 0.8.x, and Debian Sid already
has SQLAlchemy 0.8.2. OpenStack needs to support it. The only
project which isn't updated yet to support SQLAlchemy 0.8.x is
Heat, and a bug as already been opened for it.

Change-Id: Ia0d4f29640bac29c2a3c61be7f9fdcfe4963ca59

[{'created': '2013-08-21 10:54:57.000000000', 'message': 'Bump python-swiftclient requirement to >=1.5

python-swiftclient 1.5.0 has new functionality (the ability to disable
SSL layer compression) which Glance would like to use.

Change-Id: Ibbe1b53d81f8ee8b907d5270742449644505c3ad
'}]
commit_message:
Bump python-swiftclient requirement to >=1.5

python-swiftclient 1.5.0 has new functionality (the ability to disable
SSL layer compression) which Glance would like to use.

Change-Id: Ibbe1b53d81f8ee8b907d5270742449644505c3ad

commit_message:
Remove legacy network model in tests and compute manager

Update unit tests to use current network info model, remove
old legacy "network, mapping" model. This patch also removes
code for compatible with Folsom vif db info cache in compute
manager.

Partly implement blueprint nova-network-legacy

Change-Id: I3c18d786fb3eb7105be89ccac96c6fd3d078853d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-15 08:23:49.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: fix call to get_config().

The get_config() method now takes 6 arguments, instead of 5 previously.

Change-Id: I4e874f59595c3afe820103a27036519df1a126ff
'}, {'created': '2013-07-16 09:28:25.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: fix LibvirtDriver.attach_interface()

* The get_config() method now takes 6 arguments, instead of 5 previously. This
change has been introduced by commit 08f8773b.

* Retrieve the extra_specs of the instance, since they are required in set_vif_bandwidth_config(). This is done by calling instance_type_get_extra_specs, a new RPC call in nova-conductor.

* set_vif_bandwidth_config(): quickly exit when there are no extra_specs.

* LibvirtConnTestCase: add a test_attach_interface() method to prevent future failures.

Change-Id: I4e874f59595c3afe820103a27036519df1a126ff
'}, {'created': '2013-07-16 14:32:14.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: fix LibvirtDriver.attach_interface()

* The get_config() method now takes 6 arguments, instead of 5
  previously. This change has been introduced by commit 08f8773b.

* Retrieve the extra_specs of the instance, since they are required in
  set_vif_bandwidth_config(). This is done by calling
  instance_type_get_extra_specs, a new RPC call in nova-conductor.

* set_vif_bandwidth_config(): quickly exit when there are no
  extra_specs.

* LibvirtConnTestCase: add a test_attach_interface() method to prevent future
  failures.

Change-Id: I4e874f59595c3afe820103a27036519df1a126ff
'}, {'created': '2013-07-18 12:55:34.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: fix {attach,detach}_interface()

* The get_config() method now takes 6 arguments, instead of 5
  previously. This change has been introduced by commit 08f8773b.

* set_vif_bandwidth_config(): quickly exit when there are no
  extra_specs.

* LibvirtConnTestCase: add the test_attach_interface_get_config() and
  test_detach_interface_get_config() methods to prevent future
  failures.

Change-Id: I4e874f59595c3afe820103a27036519df1a126ff
'}, {'created': '2013-07-18 13:37:46.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: fix {attach,detach}_interface()

commit_message:
libvirt: fix {attach,detach}_interface()

* The get_config() method now takes 6 arguments, instead of 5
  previously. This change has been introduced by commit 08f8773b.

* LibvirtConnTestCase: add the test_attach_interface_get_config() and
  test_detach_interface_get_config() methods to prevent future
  failures.

This fixes bug #1212565.

Change-Id: I4e874f59595c3afe820103a27036519df1a126ff

commit_message:
Perform database migration snake walk test correctly

Fixes bug 1204940

The database migration snake walk test would not properly perform downgrades
leaving that part of the test non-functional.

Also, if downgrade was True, the test wouldn't downgrade all of the way to
the first migration because of a fence post error.

Change-Id: I44873fc9bb0b159c941a90ce19b74e1afba8b6a8

commit_message:
Make sure owner column doesn't get dropped during downgrade

Fixes bug 1204941

The owner column was missing from the table schema. Because of limitations
of sqlite and implementation details in SQLAlchemy-migrate, this would end
up dropping the owner column during a downgrade when using sqlite.

Change-Id: If8f7f16c9b6fb059f0fcfdf8967afd37f19864b6

commit_message:
Add new attributes to EIPAssociation resource

AllocationId
NetworkInterfaceId

The EIP resource also now supports the Domain property, which when set
creates the resource using neutron networking. (Neutron networking is
required for all VPC operations.)

The EIP test covers the new functionality as well as some of the old
using both nova and neutron.

Fixes bug #1164865
Fixes bug #1164866

Change-Id: I7ad7fba8ed6f8a584fc2ca00aaf80144c5274134

[{'created': '2013-08-20 22:03:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix scheduler prep_resize deprecated comments

The scheduler prep_resize RPC method is still used by the compute
manager for scheduler retries on prep_resize failures.  It is not
deprecated yet despite the comments saying so.  This removes the
comments for now.

Change-Id: I858abff1bf08c7ecf50333b8776b18fc08730145
'}]
commit_message:
Fix scheduler prep_resize deprecated comments

The scheduler prep_resize RPC method is still used by the compute
manager for scheduler retries on prep_resize failures.  It is not
deprecated yet despite the comments saying so.  This removes the
comments for now.

Change-Id: I858abff1bf08c7ecf50333b8776b18fc08730145

commit_message:
Adding network api xml support

Network API tests with xml formatted request body were missing.
I added code to support this feature.
In the test cases "test_list_subnets" and "test_list_networks",
response code check was also missing.
I also added this check in the code.

The _create_instance method in test_compute.BaseTestCase simply calls
through to _create_fake_instance, so it's redundant. Furthermore, the

The _create_instance method in test_compute.BaseTestCase simply calls
through to _create_fake_instance, so it's redundant. Furthermore, the

commit_message:
Remove redundant _create_instance method from test_compute

The _create_instance method in test_compute.BaseTestCase simply calls
through to _create_fake_instance, so it's redundant. Furthermore, the
docstring was wrong, it said it returned a UUID when it really returned
the instance reference. This patch simply removes _create_instance and
replaces it's usage with _create_fake_instance.

Fixes bug 1206993

Change-Id: I3fc42c94691cd0d046f19cdf2110a95b9a125edd

[{'created': '2013-08-08 15:41:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix EC2 API Fault wrapper

Fault wrapper now returns actual EC2 error code instead of HTTP
status code which was ridiculously incorrect behavior.

Fault:__call__ wasn't covered by any unit tests, so I added one.

Implements: blueprint ec2-error-codes
Change-Id: I41f7f0aa09e2925882a0da941f9ea5d4e694e65c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix EC2 API Fault wrapper

Fault wrapper now returns actual EC2 error code instead of HTTP
status code which was ridiculously incorrect behavior.

Fault:__call__ wasn't covered by any unit tests, so I added one.

Implements: blueprint ec2-error-codes
Change-Id: I41f7f0aa09e2925882a0da941f9ea5d4e694e65c

commit_message:
Generic backup_volume and restore_backup functions

Add implementation for backup_volume and restore_backup to the
VolumeDriver class, which uses brick for attach and detach.
Add default NotImplmeneted implmentation for non block drivers:
remotefs, coraid, gpfs, scality, sheepdog and sm.

Change-Id: I291390a58608b14f0deea703fc5cec3e34b965cd
