'}, {'account_id': 4468, 'date': '2013-08-20 02:40:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hi Mathew Odden, this bug is caused by 'KeyError' of instance metadata and system_metadata, I want to fix it by adding these two attrs to the instance object, I hope this is the right way to fix it."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-08-20 02:40:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Matt Odden - the bug has the stack trace, the code needs system_metadata from the instance when working with the old/new instance type values and accessing the old_vm_state value.

I've confirmed that 'metadata' isn't used in this flow so it should be removed from expected_attrs.  And I think the assertIn call will clean up the test case.

As for the commit message, this is what I'd use (I was actually going to push a cleanup patch for this but then realized Wangpan is not IBM and I don't know if I can legally push my change to a non-IBM patch):

"Get instance system_metadata when polling for unconfirmed resizes

In the confirm_resize method at the compute API level, the
'system_metadata' attribute is needed to get the old/new instance type
values and the old vm_state, but the auto confirm periodic task
doesn't get the instance object with 'system_metadata'. This results in
a 'KeyError' exception being raised when the auto confirm periodic task
runs.

This commit sets expected_attrs to get 'system_metadata' when retrieving
the instance object in the _poll_unconfirmed_resizes compute manager
method.

Closes-Bug: #1202975

Change-Id: I940f195d45fba4f2d25f9c517f11e99b74e97a8f
"'}, {'account_id': 4468, 'date': '2013-08-20 02:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-08-20 02:48:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Need to remove 'metadata' usage since it's not used in the confirm_resize flow.

Also, please consider using the cleaned up commit message I provided in my last set of comments."}, {'account_id': 4468, 'date': '2013-08-20 02:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 4468, 'date': '2013-08-20 02:54:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Hi Matt, I have answered the question about 'metadata' inline, and I will change my commit message as your advice."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-08-20 03:03:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for confirming the usage of 'metadata' and providing a stack trace in the bug report, that's very helpful.

Clean up the commit message and I'm +1."}, {'account_id': 4468, 'date': '2013-08-20 03:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-08-20 03:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Currently, the instance object should be got with expected attributes,
if the expected attributes is not given, the default attrs ['info_cache',
'security_groups'] will be used.
And in the confirm_resize method at compute api level, 'metadata' and
'system_metadata' attrs is needed, But the auto confirm periodic task
doesn't get the instance object with these two attrs, then a
'KeyError' exception is raised when the auto confirm periodic task is
running.
This commit adds these two attrs to the auto confirm periodic task while
getting the instance object to fix bug 1202975.

Reproduce steps in my devstack env with latest master branch nova:
1. set resize_confirm_window=10 in nova.conf
2. create an instance
3. resize it
4. wait for it is confirmed and watch the log

"}, {'created': '2013-08-19 12:58:28.000000000', 'message': "Fixes auto confirm invalid error

Fixes bug 1202975

Currently, when obtaining instance object given the uuid, the expected
attributes can be optionally passed to the call, if the expected attributes
is not given, the default attrs ['info_cache', 'security_groups'] will be
used.
And in the confirm_resize method at compute api level, 'metadata' and
'system_metadata' attrs is needed, But the auto confirm periodic task
doesn't get the instance object with these two attrs, then a
'KeyError' exception is raised when the auto confirm periodic task is
running.
This commit adds these two attrs to the auto confirm periodic task while
getting the instance object to fix bug 1202975.

Reproduce steps in my devstack env with latest master branch nova:
1. set resize_confirm_window=10 in nova.conf
2. create an instance
3. resize it
4. wait for it is confirmed and watch the log

Change-Id: I940f195d45fba4f2d25f9c517f11e99b74e97a8f
"}, {'created': '2013-08-20 02:45:27.000000000', 'message': "Fixes auto confirm invalid error

Currently, when obtaining instance object given the uuid, the expected
attributes can be optionally passed to the call, if the expected attributes
is not given, the default attrs ['info_cache', 'security_groups'] will be
used.
And in the confirm_resize method at compute api level, 'metadata' and
'system_metadata' attrs is needed, But the auto confirm periodic task
doesn't get the instance object with these two attrs, then a
'KeyError' exception is raised when the auto confirm periodic task is
running.
This commit adds these two attrs to the auto confirm periodic task while
getting the instance object to fix bug 1202975.

Reproduce steps in my devstack env with latest master branch nova:
1. set resize_confirm_window=10 in nova.conf
2. create an instance
3. resize it
4. wait for it is confirmed and watch the log

Fixes bug 1202975

Change-Id: I940f195d45fba4f2d25f9c517f11e99b74e97a8f
"}, {'created': '2013-08-20 03:18:17.000000000', 'message': "Fixes auto confirm invalid error

In the confirm_resize method at the compute API level, the 'metadata' attribute
is used to notify the instance usage and the 'system_metadata' attribute is
needed to get the old/new instance type values and the old vm_state, but the
auto confirm periodic task doesn't get the instance object with these two
attributes. This results in 'KeyError' exception being raised when the auto
confirm periodic task runs.
This commit sets expected_attrs to get 'metadata' and 'system_metadata' when
retrieving the instance object in the _poll_unconfirmed_resizes compute manager
method.

Reproduce steps in my devstack env with latest master branch nova:
1. set resize_confirm_window=10 in nova.conf
2. create an instance
3. resize it
4. wait for it is confirmed and watch the log

Fixes bug 1202975

Change-Id: I940f195d45fba4f2d25f9c517f11e99b74e97a8f
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes auto confirm invalid error

In the confirm_resize method at the compute API level, the 'metadata' attribute
is used to notify the instance usage and the 'system_metadata' attribute is
needed to get the old/new instance type values and the old vm_state, but the
auto confirm periodic task doesn't get the instance object with these two
attributes. This results in 'KeyError' exception being raised when the auto
confirm periodic task runs.
This commit sets expected_attrs to get 'metadata' and 'system_metadata' when
retrieving the instance object in the _poll_unconfirmed_resizes compute manager
method.

Reproduce steps in my devstack env with latest master branch nova:
1. set resize_confirm_window=10 in nova.conf
2. create an instance
3. resize it
4. wait for it is confirmed and watch the log

Fixes bug 1202975

Change-Id: I940f195d45fba4f2d25f9c517f11e99b74e97a8f

Perhaps you could stub out _paginate_query and check its parameters against a set of redundant items in sort_keys?

My main reason for the -1 is that I think the same thing would happen if the call of image_get_all passed in sort_key='id'.  We should fix them both at once, and in a similar way.  Perhaps just eliminating duplicates for the sort_key list in _paginate_query would be best?

Again, this was a great find, thank you!"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2013-08-19 03:16:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
redundant conditions in paginate-query

For a list call on images, when a sort_key is applied, the query
generated has redundant values for 'created_at' condition. This happens
when the sort_key list has duplicate values.

Fixes Bug #1212994

Change-Id: Icd62c2886d9ab608418ba9b4dc25cd06a4146992

commit_message:
Add support for swap_volume

Add client support for swap_volume, which allows swapping a volume
currently attached to an instance with a different volume which is not
attached. The contents of the old volume will be copied onto the new
volume. This was added in nova commit
8f51b120b430c7c21399256f37e1d8f75d030484.

Change-Id: I98323d594617c1c435e403d9f3ddc4ff4fa74da6

subject: Add tenant isolation to the swift tests

commit_message:
Add tenant isolation to the swift tests

This commit adds tenant isolation to the swift api tests. This should
prevent a race condition between the different test classes when
running in parallel.

part of blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: I8d59dad3df1afff43b1b3485d2d8c30a081dadd7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 16:38:48.000000000', 'message': "Use subnet id instead of wrong built-in id()

in _validate_subnet(), built-in id() is used as param for exceptions,
this patch fix it via using proper subnet id.

Note: since param s in _validate_subnet() is user's input, its id can
be None when create_subnet(), so the message of exception may be
written with None instead of uuid.

Closes-Bug: #1213930

Change-Id: I9a88f4dc7b771047f4061fb94ba65f0515afa745
"}, {'created': '2013-08-19 22:03:03.000000000', 'message': "Use subnet id instead of wrong built-in id()

in _validate_subnet(), built-in id() is used as param for exceptions,
this patch fix it via using proper subnet id.

Note: since param s in _validate_subnet() is user's input, its id can
be None when create_subnet(), so the message of exception may be
written with None instead of uuid.

Also fix q_ prefix module alias.

Closes-Bug: #1213930
Related-Bug: #1206059

Change-Id: I9a88f4dc7b771047f4061fb94ba65f0515afa745
"}, {'created': '2013-08-20 15:32:47.000000000', 'message': "Use subnet id instead of wrong built-in id()

in _validate_subnet(), built-in id() is used as param for exceptions,
this patch fixes it via using proper subnet id.

Note: since param s in _validate_subnet() is user's input, its id can
be None when create_subnet(), so the message of exception may be
written with None instead of uuid. According to OpenStack Networking
API v2.0 Reference (http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-network\
/2.0/content/create_subnet.html), the cidr attribute must be specified,
this patch uses it to identify subnet when id is None.

Closes-Bug: #1213930

Change-Id: I9a88f4dc7b771047f4061fb94ba65f0515afa745
"}, {'created': '2013-08-21 09:10:51.000000000', 'message': 'Use subnet id instead of wrong built-in id()

In _validate_subnet(), built-in id() is used as param for exceptions,
this patch fixes it via using proper subnet id.

Closes-Bug: #1213930

Change-Id: I9a88f4dc7b771047f4061fb94ba65f0515afa745
'}]
commit_message:
Use subnet id instead of wrong built-in id()

In _validate_subnet(), built-in id() is used as param for exceptions,
this patch fixes it via using proper subnet id.

Closes-Bug: #1213930

Change-Id: I9a88f4dc7b771047f4061fb94ba65f0515afa745

commit_message:
Cleanup: Add common "create keypair" method

There are many "create keypair" methods in scenario tests, their
behaviors are almost the same. They create keypairs with random names.
This patch adds common "create keypair" method and uses it instead
of each implementation.

Change-Id: I9355b9e19604b6c2e648b3473d1de47fe19fa9ea

cisco-network-profile-*
cisco-policy-profile-*

commit_message:
Add credentials and profile support to Neutron client

Add support to the Neutron client for credentials and profiles to allow
for working with Nexus 1000V. These are in support of the Nexus 1000V
Cisco plugin work.

Change-Id: I63e7ea09b1da027e308e32ae9a8e0400ab5965f2
Implements: blueprint cisco-n1k-neutron-client

commit_message:
Introduce nova_utils.server_to_ipaddress

Create a utility function used for now by the instance and load balancer
resources to retrieve one IP of a nova server.

Change-Id: I87ace4c61b03a66f3b0c30f3bacd2fce79332ed0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-25 20:36:46.000000000', 'message': 'Support EC2 API wildcards for DescribeTags filters

The EC2 API supports glob-style wildcards in filters.

From http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeTags.html:

"You can use wildcards in a filter value. An asterisk (*) matches zero or more characters, and
a question mark (?) matches exactly one character. You can escape special characters using a
backslash (\) before the character. For example, a value of \*amazon\?\\ searches for the literal
string *amazon?\."

This patch converts the glob-style regex to a python regex and uses re.match to do the rest. The
approach to the conversion was taken from the python fnmatch library.

Change-Id: Ie9cac182faabf50fc0d40480db39a46a7e97fbec
'}, {'created': '2013-07-26 14:34:12.000000000', 'message': 'Support EC2 API wildcards for DescribeTags filters

The EC2 API supports glob-style wildcards in filters.

"You can use wildcards in a filter value. An asterisk (*) matches zero or more characters, and
a question mark (?) matches exactly one character. You can escape special characters using a
backslash (\) before the character. For example, a value of \*amazon\?\\ searches for the literal
string *amazon?\."

This patch converts the glob-style regex to a python regex and uses re.match to do the rest. The
approach to the conversion was taken from the python fnmatch library.

Fixes bug #1205099

Change-Id: Ie9cac182faabf50fc0d40480db39a46a7e97fbec
'}]
commit_message:
Support EC2 API wildcards for DescribeTags filters

The EC2 API supports glob-style wildcards in filters.

From http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeTags.html:

"You can use wildcards in a filter value. An asterisk (*) matches zero or more characters, and
a question mark (?) matches exactly one character. You can escape special characters using a
backslash (\) before the character. For example, a value of \*amazon\?\\ searches for the literal
string *amazon?\."

This patch converts the glob-style regex to a python regex and uses re.match to do the rest. The
approach to the conversion was taken from the python fnmatch library.

Fixes bug #1205099

Change-Id: Ie9cac182faabf50fc0d40480db39a46a7e97fbec

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-15 08:15:19.000000000', 'message': "clean temp dir in /tmp

In unit tests, many test class use tempfile.mkdtemp in SetUp and
shutil.rmtree in tearDown.

An common wrong case is putting test data in `testdir = os.join(mkdtemp() +
'some_class')` and `rmmtree(testdir)`. As a result, /tmp/xxx/some_class
was deleted, but /tmp/xxx is still leaved in system. So a proper fix is
`rmtree(os.path.dirname(testdir), ignore_errors=1)`

fixes bug #1212583

Change-Id: Iafbe3e11f16b51bdf49abce9e68eb01f25bc5df2
"}, {'created': '2013-08-15 09:23:34.000000000', 'message': "clean temp dir in /tmp

In unit tests, many test class use tempfile.mkdtemp in SetUp and
shutil.rmtree in tearDown.

A common wrong case is putting test data in `testdir = os.join(mkdtemp() +
'some_class')` and `rmmtree(testdir)`. As a result, /tmp/xxx/some_class
was deleted, but /tmp/xxx is still leaved in system. So a proper fix is
`rmtree(os.path.dirname(testdir), ignore_errors=1)`

fixes bug #1212583

Change-Id: Iafbe3e11f16b51bdf49abce9e68eb01f25bc5df2
"}, {'created': '2013-08-15 16:17:28.000000000', 'message': "clean temp dir in /tmp

In unit tests, many test class use tempfile.mkdtemp in SetUp and
shutil.rmtree in tearDown.

A common wrong case is putting test data in `testdir = os.join(mkdtemp() +
'some_class')` and `rmmtree(testdir)`. As a result, /tmp/xxx/some_class
was deleted, but /tmp/xxx is still leaved in system. So a proper fix is
`rmtree(os.path.dirname(testdir), ignore_errors=1)`

fixes bug #1212583

Change-Id: Iafbe3e11f16b51bdf49abce9e68eb01f25bc5df2
"}]
commit_message:
clean temp dir in /tmp

In unit tests, many test class use tempfile.mkdtemp in SetUp and
shutil.rmtree in tearDown.

A common wrong case is putting test data in `testdir = os.join(mkdtemp() +
'some_class')` and `rmmtree(testdir)`. As a result, /tmp/xxx/some_class
was deleted, but /tmp/xxx is still leaved in system. So a proper fix is
`rmtree(os.path.dirname(testdir), ignore_errors=1)`

fixes bug #1212583

Change-Id: Iafbe3e11f16b51bdf49abce9e68eb01f25bc5df2

commit_message:
Use correct libvirtd-bin group in Debian

While Ubuntu and RedHat family use the libvirtd group, Debian
uses libvirt for running the libvirt daemon.

Change-Id: Iedbea8e1c46d78a897a193f8bed42755bf2dca61

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 18:29:15.000000000', 'message': "Don't use OpenDNS as the default resolvers

OpenDNS returns self referencing records instead of pure
NXDOMAIN records:

root@kevin-test-1:~# host kevin-test
kevin-test has address 67.215.65.132
Host kevin-test not found: 3(NXDOMAIN)

NetRange:       67.215.64.0 - 67.215.95.255
CIDR:           67.215.64.0/19
OriginAS:       AS36692
NetName:        OPENDNS-NET-3

Clearly this is not preferable when the server is being
used as an upstream resolver for internal DNS which may
send incorrectly configured applications running in VMs
to the wrong place

Change-Id: I098bb57e9e71fc3db5b3e4b3d42d9a3e1d966a04
"}, {'created': '2013-08-21 18:31:25.000000000', 'message': "Don't use OpenDNS as the default resolvers

OpenDNS returns self referencing records instead of pure
NXDOMAIN records:

root@kevin-test-1:~# host kevin-test
kevin-test has address 67.215.65.132
Host kevin-test not found: 3(NXDOMAIN)

NetRange:       67.215.64.0 - 67.215.95.255
CIDR:           67.215.64.0/19
OriginAS:       AS36692
NetName:        OPENDNS-NET-3

Clearly this is not preferable when the server is being
used as an upstream resolver for internal DNS which may
send incorrectly configured applications running in VMs
to the wrong place

Change-Id: I098bb57e9e71fc3db5b3e4b3d42d9a3e1d966a04
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use OpenDNS as the default resolvers

OpenDNS returns self referencing records instead of pure
NXDOMAIN records:

root@kevin-test-1:~# host kevin-test
kevin-test has address 67.215.65.132
Host kevin-test not found: 3(NXDOMAIN)

NetRange:       67.215.64.0 - 67.215.95.255
CIDR:           67.215.64.0/19
OriginAS:       AS36692
NetName:        OPENDNS-NET-3

Clearly this is not preferable when the server is being
used as an upstream resolver for internal DNS which may
send incorrectly configured applications running in VMs
to the wrong place

Change-Id: I098bb57e9e71fc3db5b3e4b3d42d9a3e1d966a04

commit_message:
Preserve devstack/accrc files

The user rc files contains all environment variables and certificates
to act as the user. Preserving these files is required for configuring
the ec2 credentials for tempest.

Change-Id: I5d94c26328e7c305ece061a7d2a441223a025be4

commit_message:
add nova v3 api support in upgrade

We have created an endpoint for nova v3 api in devstack in
order to we can test nova v3 api without mangling v2 url.
But it still need add v3 support in grenade.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

Change-Id: I237a8bf3b78c32efef5b3f11c8efbf996d1c8906

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 00:18:50.000000000', 'message': 'Adds default route to DHCP namespace for upstream name resolution.

Any time the DHCP server is updated this code will maintain a default
route in the DHCP namespace using the gateway_ip attribute of the
first DHCP-enabled IPV4 subnet in the list of subnets where gateway_ip
is not None.  This strategy uses the same gateway ip that the DHCP
server hands to the VMs on the network.

Fixes: Bug #1181378

Conflicts:

	quantum/agent/dhcp_agent.py

Change-Id: I0807550a848e1b610c7775d215643ad9c83629ed
(cherry picked from commit 5dd0cf15463e181b92c8809c2dcc7603bb156a0e)
'}]
commit_message:
Adds default route to DHCP namespace for upstream name resolution.

Any time the DHCP server is updated this code will maintain a default
route in the DHCP namespace using the gateway_ip attribute of the
first DHCP-enabled IPV4 subnet in the list of subnets where gateway_ip
is not None.  This strategy uses the same gateway ip that the DHCP
server hands to the VMs on the network.

Fixes: Bug #1181378

Conflicts:

	quantum/agent/dhcp_agent.py

Change-Id: I0807550a848e1b610c7775d215643ad9c83629ed
(cherry picked from commit 5dd0cf15463e181b92c8809c2dcc7603bb156a0e)

commit_message:
Storwize/SVC: More error logging

Some cases had exception raised without logging the error, and one
case where FC was not configured properly raised an IndexError rather
than presenting a clear message.

Fixes: bug 1212652

Change-Id: I7c39977f8e168e5e6afcdeb0f772fec854732140

subject: Port volumes swap to the new API-v3

commit_message:
Port volumes swap to the new API-v3

This ports the additions in the API from the change-Id
Iaace71f46acd33cf1531d953d569c0b6d0bbe680.
Since volumes API wasn't selected to port some changes were made to make volumes
swap fit into extended_volumes, the request will now be done like:
    PUT v3/servers/<server_uuid>/action
and the request body will be something like:

{ 'swap_volume_attachment': {
                            'new_volume_id': <volume_id>,
                            'old_volume_id': <another_volume_id,
                          }
}

Also adds expected_errors decorator and more unittests

Related to blueprint volume-swap
Related to blueprint nova-api-v3

Change-Id: Ia3a9efd68ec52a7bfe8cbe0a6518dd91527f8903

'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-29 19:48:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Not sure I understand the reason for defining/registering the same config more than once; could you elaborate a bit?"}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-07-30 16:15:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

We've three different agents and every agent has to register the configuration parameter for his own configuration file or his CLI. That's why we've three registrations of the same parameter. Two times: configuration file (dhcp_agent, l3_agent), One time: CLI parameter (metadata_proxy)."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-31 18:53:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Thanks, however I should have asked differently: why does the path need to be different? That aside, wouldn't we want to add this config param to the config files under etc for documentation purposes?"}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-08-01 14:34:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@Armando: This patch introduces the configuration parameter for the DHCP agent and the L3 agent and the console parameter for the metadata-proxy. That's what I want to have. Because the DHCP agent or the L3 agent starts the metadata-proxy we've to set the configuration parameters in the corresponding configuration file. I'm not sure what's wrong..?"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-08-01 15:07:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

There is nothing actually wrong with your change; I believe that fewer config params is better than more; I  am trying to understand why we would want to the proxy socket path percolates all the way to the dhcp and l3 agents configurations. If this path is not meant to change, or ever be tuned by the admin, I don't see your change as 'fixing' anything."}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-08-01 15:12:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

This patch makes the socket path in neutron-ns-metadata-proxy configurable inside the configuration of the L3 and DHCP agent. At the moment it's not possible to change the socket path because neutron-ns-metadata-proxy is started inside DHCP and L3 agent without a configuration file parameter. So neutron-ns-metadata-proxy doesn't know where to lock for the defined parameter and always uses the default value. While setting the parameter in the configuration of L3 and DHCP agent and starting neutron-ns-metadata-proxy with the socket parameter it's now possible to set the socket path."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-08-01 15:41:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

the metadata agent should be able to look into its own config file to use a different path. I don't argue with what you're trying to achieve, I understand that, and it is correct. My point is: just because we could expose the config param it doesn't mean we should. But that's my opinion."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-08-01 15:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: No score

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-08-05 20:06:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

commit_message:
make neutron-ns-metadata-proxy configurable

Introduced a new configuration parameter for DHCP and L3 agent
to be able to set the path of the metadata socket to be used
by neutron-ns-metadata-proxy when started inside the DHCP or L3
agent. Also moved the configuration parameter of the
neutron-ns-metadata-proxy to the CLI parameters.

fixes bug #1202628

Change-Id: I3b1aa72b4e06c00f7fed152f0ee03d52b6bbc279

[{'created': '2013-07-28 18:39:44.000000000', 'message': "Update references with new Mailing List location

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

Change-Id: I8aaa5e159c7e5b6b5dc756a03eba1f7a943b3fa5
"}]
commit_message:
Update references with new Mailing List location

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

Change-Id: I8aaa5e159c7e5b6b5dc756a03eba1f7a943b3fa5

commit_message:
Add per-form validators to services markup.

This allows to implement joint validator for hostname template and number
of instances in all services.

Also:

1) Refactor append_properties function(rename to push_properties
and move to field classes).
2) Change service forms markup so each form has a name.
3) Change yaql-validators syntax to {YAQL: validatorExpression}.

Change-Id: Ia6b32e14213b147881b242710ca130a4dea3cdb2

commit_message:
Added total number of secrets/orders available to response.

The total number of secrets/orders available was not being returned
in paged requests.

Change-Id: I03cf93e6ff946c441a6292eec3ed331de9aab4b2
Implements: blueprint api-resp-add-list-size

commit_message:
Add get_instances_availability_zones into nova.az

As discussed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/28669/.
create a helper method to get a list of availability zone of
some instances. Also add test for the method.

In db level, aggregate_metadata_get_by_host() and
aggregate_metadata_get_by_hosts() are similar, just using
different criterion of aggregate host. So create a new method
to reuse these code.

part of bp: different-availability-zone-filter

Change-Id: If3dc7d31a7e7114d20057f9e2d6d4b2f926efe8d

commit_message:
H233 regex can not match some print operator

The regex in H233 checking can not cover the following print operator:
print ('*' * 40) + ' REQUEST ENVIRON'

Change the regex to cover it.
update the sample in doc

Fixes Bug #1211199

Change-Id: I1e0ecb08df98aa1644f8e110a214cbac6fdfbe70

commit_message:
fix gettext calls to operate on uninterpolated strings

The strings need to be interpolated after the gettext call,
so that the gettext() lookup works correctly

Change-Id: Ibdb9044813f42039f7a87ca7e8fec20583aa61ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-20 19:55:26.000000000', 'message': 'Impose a configurable size limit on raw JSON body

Currently WSGI will accept very large templates. The raw size is
not much of a concern at 4MB, but parsing that template can create a
recursive memory consumption which leads to the API server eating up
extreme amounts of memory, sometimes leading to MemoryError. Assuming
the template could pass through the API to the engine, this would also
put a heavy burden on an engine and/or the RPC system as well.

Limiting the JSON portion of the body should prevent any large templates
from entering the system.

Fixes bug #1214234

Change-Id: Id582a560cc37886648eba612346c4ccaf785f4e0
'}, {'created': '2013-08-21 01:03:18.000000000', 'message': 'Impose a configurable size limit on raw JSON body

Currently WSGI will accept very large templates. The raw size is
not much of a concern at 4MB, but parsing that template can create a
recursive memory consumption which leads to the API server eating up
extreme amounts of memory, sometimes leading to MemoryError. Assuming
the template could pass through the API to the engine, this would also
put a heavy burden on an engine and/or the RPC system as well.

Limiting the JSON portion of the body should prevent any large templates
from entering the system.

Fixes bug #1214234

Change-Id: Id582a560cc37886648eba612346c4ccaf785f4e0
'}]
commit_message:
Impose a configurable size limit on raw JSON body

Currently WSGI will accept very large templates. The raw size is
not much of a concern at 4MB, but parsing that template can create a
recursive memory consumption which leads to the API server eating up
extreme amounts of memory, sometimes leading to MemoryError. Assuming
the template could pass through the API to the engine, this would also
put a heavy burden on an engine and/or the RPC system as well.

Limiting the JSON portion of the body should prevent any large templates
from entering the system.

Fixes bug #1214234

Change-Id: Id582a560cc37886648eba612346c4ccaf785f4e0

commit_message:
Boot from image destination - volume

Added class DriverImageBlockDevice that implements
creating volume from image on booting VM
from image if destination_type is volume.

Adding converting to legacy if source is image and
destination is a volume.

Change-Id: I8b8a7a2e40c083c18c4808b6b340360138086c1f
blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-31 16:58:58.000000000', 'message': "Virt driver flag for different BDM formats

This patch introduces a new virt driver property
'need_legacy_block_device_info' that will tell the compute manager if
driver needs to be passed legacy block_device_info.

This patch also refactors the compute manager methods that would pass
the block device info to driver methods - to do so according to the
property of the driver. This is done by moving all the code into a single
private method _get_instance_volume_block_device_info. This method existed
before but now uses the new DriverBlockDevice classes for it's
functionality.

As it is sometimes necessary to refresh the connection info for volume
based DriverBlockDevice objects (a private manager method
_refresh_block_device_connection_info was used for this), this patch
also factors this code to a method on the DriverVolumeBlockDeviceClass,
and is now completely used like that when needed, and removes the said
method.

Finally - this patch removes a _get_block_device_info method from the
compute API class. This remained from early pre-conductor attempts to
remove DB access from the compute service, and is irrelevant now that
conductor is used. This is needed so that the source  of block device
data is always conductor and the version of data is always
known.

After this patch - it will be possible to implement changes in drivers
that will allow them to utilise the new block device data format.

Change-Id: If961329061e5413824d891eada645dd8dd9cb6dd

driver needs to be passed legacy block_device_info.

This patch also refactors the compute manager methods that would pass
the block device info to driver methods - to do so according to the
property of the driver. This is done by moving all the code into a single
private method _get_instance_volume_block_device_info. This method existed
before but now uses the new DriverBlockDevice classes for it's
functionality.

As it is sometimes necessary to refresh the connection info for volume
based DriverBlockDevice objects (a private manager method
_refresh_block_device_connection_info was used for this), this patch
also factors this code to a method on the DriverVolumeBlockDeviceClass,
and is now completely used like that when needed, and removes the said
method.

Finally - this patch removes a _get_block_device_info method from the
compute API class. This remained from early pre-conductor attempts to
remove DB access from the compute service, and is irrelevant now that
conductor is used. This is needed so that the source  of block device
data is always conductor and the version of data is always
known.

After this patch - it will be possible to implement changes in drivers
that will allow them to utilise the new block device data format.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: If961329061e5413824d891eada645dd8dd9cb6dd

commit_message:
Virt driver flag for different BDM formats

This patch introduces a new virt driver property
'need_legacy_block_device_info' that will tell the compute manager if
driver needs to be passed legacy block_device_info.

This patch also refactors the compute manager methods that would pass
the block device info to driver methods - to do so according to the
property of the driver. This is done by moving all the code into a single
private method _get_instance_volume_block_device_info. This method existed
before but now uses the new DriverBlockDevice classes for it's
functionality.

As it is sometimes necessary to refresh the connection info for volume
based DriverBlockDevice objects (a private manager method
_refresh_block_device_connection_info was used for this), this patch
also factors this code to a method on the DriverVolumeBlockDeviceClass,
and is now completely used like that when needed, and removes the said
method.

Finally - this patch removes a _get_block_device_info method from the
compute API class. This remained from early pre-conductor attempts to
remove DB access from the compute service, and is irrelevant now that
conductor is used. This is needed so that the source  of block device
data is always conductor and the version of data is always
known.

After this patch - it will be possible to implement changes in drivers
that will allow them to utilise the new block device data format.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: If961329061e5413824d891eada645dd8dd9cb6dd

commit_message:
Add accept_transfer to solidfire driver

The SolidFire cluster is tenant aware and as such
needs to change account association on volume transfer.

We use the project_id to build this account, so read that
in here and create a new account if necessary and re-assign
the existing volume to the new tenant account.

Change-Id: I29879714c2d32a982918cd1305c8eb00718795fd

commit_message:
Added need info to accept_transfer

Drivers that implement accept_transfer will need
things like the new user_id and project_id.  We were
not including this in the original add, in order for
drivers that are tenant aware this information will be
necessary.

Also the get_volume call in the transfer was using
the new user context, so the volume would never be
found.  We fix this here by providing an elevated
context to the get_volume call when accepting the
transfer.

Change-Id: I7b60c19950f85c4309a97bb842ff238bcf8e746a
Fixes: bug 1213275

commit_message:
Remove unused methods from cinder.utils

These methods were left over from the split from Nova and are unused still.

Remove methods:
	is_valid_ipv4()
	make_dev_path()
	convert_to_list_dict()
	partition_dict()
	subset_dict()

Change-Id: Icb36aa6a2d1f607c440a2d524d3480de23d1cb7a

commit_message:
adds lazy app loading to the uwsgi inis.

This change is to resolve the aggressive forking that uwsgi does which
causes it to only have shared sessions across processes in the p11 plugin
and shared db handles as well

Change-Id: I766e50457474844e518c4be6e7dbdd60779064d7

commit_message:
Call sync before unmounting keeps the mount from being busy.

here is a bug associated with this patch because there is a
workaround included. Calling sync to enable the unmounting...
https://bugs.launchpad.net/diskimage-builder/+bug/1214388

Change-Id: I9d5a1f092fd8f3ae1c14de03dd516203baab4da3

commit_message:
Better indentation for Network Guide chapter "under the hood"

Bug #1211658 reports that the reader was confused that we have
several times "Scenario 1". This is a result of a flat structure, I
grouped the chapter now with better sections and subsections.

Patchset 3: Add dbhtml stop-chunking - thanks Anne for the suggestion.

Patchset 4: Takes in editorial suggestions from Diane (thanks!)

Change-Id: I37d5500b818ad0eed6a4f6fe29317e8dd4134021
Closes-Bug: #1211658

Closes-Bug: #1212772

ML2 doesn't support ext-gw-mode, resulting in L3 agents not
setting-up NAT rules in neutron routers (currently, l3 agents
will assume enable_snat=false if plugin doesn't provide this
parameter as described in bug 1212868)

commit_message:
Add ext-gw-mode support to ML2

Closes-Bug: #1212772

ML2 doesn't support ext-gw-mode, resulting in L3 agents not
setting-up NAT rules in neutron routers (currently, l3 agents
will assume enable_snat=false if plugin doesn't provide this
parameter as described in bug 1212868)

This patchset adds the support of ext-gw-mode to ML2 plugin.

In order to support ext-gw-mode alembic migration (as well as
other potential migrations on plugin dbs), folsom_initial
migration script is fixed to include ML2 plugin. Otherwise
databases won't be set-up during migration script (but at
plugin startup by sqlalchemy), resulting in migration failures.

Change-Id: I95ec18e0a4f0e5b661f3a5d679c434f18f100fa6

[{'created': '2013-08-20 15:56:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Fibre Channel attach for single WWN

The code allowed for only a string of the WWN or a list of them.
Unfortunately unicode is also returned, for which the attach fails.
This patch allows for unicode as well.

Change-Id: I4d2809b41b24b2240e447a5c09f14e6438304cd6
Fixes: bug 1214413
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Fibre Channel attach for single WWN

The code allowed for only a string of the WWN or a list of them.
Unfortunately unicode is also returned, for which the attach fails.
This patch allows for unicode as well.

Change-Id: I4d2809b41b24b2240e447a5c09f14e6438304cd6
Fixes: bug 1214413

commit_message:
Update Brick to use executor

modify existing modules in Brick
to make use of the Executor object,
so we don't replicated the same
set_execute() method everywhere.

Change-Id: Ib0363029557253ad86bae90e1db4fefd24a42df7

commit_message:
remove binaries under bin

bp: remove-bin-directory

There are some binaries which are expected to run in branch, so
we have to keep them there now.

Change-Id: I5134d975cbd69f929a325ab80a6d19ce1f122656

[{'created': '2013-08-21 14:48:39.000000000', 'message': 'docs: Add 'description' field to domains

When the 'description' field got added for domains and records,
only the documentation for records was updated.

Also, fix minor domain schema error - the description for the
"created_at" and "updated_at" fields in domain.json is incorrect
in the v1 code base.

Change-Id: Id50ed109be81723da8e46e23f792173f435e0e3e
Fixes: bug#1213273
'}]
commit_message:
docs: Add 'description' field to domains

When the 'description' field got added for domains and records,
only the documentation for records was updated.

Also, fix minor domain schema error - the description for the
"created_at" and "updated_at" fields in domain.json is incorrect
in the v1 code base.

Change-Id: Id50ed109be81723da8e46e23f792173f435e0e3e
Fixes: bug#1213273
